author: {'steamid': '76561197998817967', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1418580143}
review:
Paranautical Activity was like one of first roguelite FPSes, from back when roguelike was still a novel thing, and looking back, it aged badly. Hell, if what chances are it's more known as the game taken down for it's dev cursing at and threatening Gabe Newell on social media, resulting in the title being taken off Steam for some time, than it's actual merits.

Now, first thing first, as far as unappealing blocky visual styles go, this game takes the cake with really rough pseudo-voxel enemy designs and UI, and level design even more angular - while it tries to be an arena shooter, like Quake of sorts, with lots of projectiles to dodge, the individual areas are way too small and primitive to fully capitalize on this. One thing that redeems style and levels is dynamic lights that indeed look neat and distinct but that's it.

Now, the gameplay, it's pretty predictable roguelite as genre is established meets arena FPS faire, with the roguelike bit sometimes offering interesting gimmicky pickups but too often boild down to flat bonuses to stats, like max lives or whatnot, whereas the FPS kinda suffers from enemy AI being primtiive and simple, running circles is always enough to deal with most threat and the failures usually happen due to fire density getting too high for you to deal with, so the main skill here is dodging, not much space for buildcrafting, most playtroughs feel quite similar as a result.

Just... was nice for it's time but now there's so many more titles with a better sense of how to make something a roguelite, and even more titles that are just fun simple singleplayer shooter so this comes off weak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036643316', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1707434517}
review: Once I took mushrooms and ate some opiated black. I went to the toilet tripping balls, and heard what sounded like the police breaking in, and beating/shooting my friends to death downstairs. I finally got the courage to pull my pants up and stagger down, terrified, and they were sat playing Doom. They call this kind of game a 'boomer shooter', but I remember them starting, they're Generation X games. Anyway, this one is too hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046277022', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1697069791}
review:
Almost every upgrade you pick up in the game literally makes the game harder. Every drop is a fucking speed down, and speed down bricks your run.

I was having a pretty good run till I accidentally picked up an item that took away all my health and gave me infinite bombs. I died the very next room.

The run before that I got an item that took half my health for some damage.

I've literally gotten an item for killing a boss that revives all the enemies on a floor and that's it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977515982', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1688778847}
review: This really hasn't aged well, though not sure it would have been all that great even during its time.  Gameplay is not well tuned, gunplay doesn't feel great, itemization is just a landfill of nonsense in not a good way.  It has style, I'll give it that, but there's many other similar games at same price or cheaper that deliver big on style points and have much better quality to back it up.  I suppose I can at least say I finally knocked one more game from my humble bundle binging days off my backlog so in turn the money I paid for it at least primarily went to a good cause.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118816530', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1679117661}
review:
I generally have two rules about playing games. Rule number one is that if the first 40 minutes are filled with me wanting to do anything else with my time, I don't continue. Rule number two is that I don't like spending money on games that aren't finished. Paranautical Activity met both rules.

This game is an ancient relic from a time when the indie world was dominated by people who wanted to be the next Spelunky  or Binding Of Isaac. Compared to both its classic and modern contemporaries, it is sorely outdated and is blatantly an unfinished product sans the early access tag that should be on the storepage. The whole game feels like a pre-alpha that lacks polish.

As documented pretty extensively in other reviews, the developer of this game was not a nice man, stiffing his composer and saying that he would personally kill Gabe Newell because Steam accidentally put it in Early Access when it should have been full release (although this game deserves to still be in the former.) The developer also advertised and promised features that never came to the game, and now will never come to the game due to its unsupported nature. Hilariously, the game still advertises potential VR support in the menu. However, beneath all the controversy, there is a game, and it's not very good.

I don't actually believe this game is finished despite the storepage saying otherwise. Combat is very bland; you have one weapon that you'll be firing over and over and an alternative weapon that, depending on your luck and starting gear, ranges from situational to near worthless. All of the different areas of the game make make minor aesthetic changes every now and then, but they are still mostly gray boxes with the same few room layouts scrambled together. How far your run goes depends heavily on luck. You can get a powerful weapon for free in the first floor, or you can be forced to slug through multiple floors with your starting weapon with no upgrades ever given out, as is unfortunately standard for indie roguelikes, especially ones of this era. The guns are also bland, with even powerful weapons feeling like piddly little super soakers.
 
Monsters do not make sounds except to attack, which is REALLY bad in a game that's trying to be a supercharged first person shooter, because keeping track of monsters via noise becomes a valuable skill in most fast-paced FPS games. I have died several times to monsters I didn't even know were there because I backpedaled into them. Almost every room requires me to seek out monsters after big battles to get the doors open because they have a habit of crouching silently in corners and staying there.

I could go on, but in conclusion, please just go buy Tower Of Guns or Ziggurat or any other FPS roguelike. Or hell, go buy STRAFE. All of those games are far more deserving of your money and time than a game from a developer whose instinctive reaction to a technical difficulty is to threaten harm to an employee of the company who hosts his game's store page. They also have the nice side effect of being fun.

review:

*takes notes*

It's a crazy world out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051800225', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1636391487}
review: I got this for $1.50 thats about what I'd pay for its. This is a fun but very dated and unbalanced game. There are a lot of mechanics that are downright frustrating and a lot of weapons that are complete dog shit. But on the flipside there are a couple items that are totally broken and fun to exploit. I won on my third run thanks to a broken item combination, and the runs are quite long (7 floors/bosses) so I got to see a lot of the game. I think this game is something fun to play over one weekend or a day or two but it feels too repetitive to have the same staying power as Binding of Issac or Gunfire Reborn. If you are a fan of FPS roguelikes wishlist this and wait till it drops to 1-2 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224122680', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 567, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1621871914}
review:
I am 95% sure, the game is broken.

Everything about this feels like an early demo, something that you would show to friends and family, to prove that you didn't waste the last year of your life. But you did....

Ah where to start. No tutorial of any kind, no controls menu, no context, no story, poor hit detection, poor room design, terrible UI, sometimes outright missing UI, bugged weapons, bugged gameplay. 

The music is okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1612713534}
review:
This is a low poly/"voxel art" style FPS with a focus on procgen, and a supernatural fish theme.  Yeah, me either.  Run around between procgen rooms and shoot the low poly voxel things in each one.  See how many rooms you can go through before you die and enjoy the sweet release of not having to play Paranautical Activity anymore. 

This game was released in 2013, a full 17 years after the Quake game it's ripping off, yet is worse in every single respect.  Graphics are worse, and gameplay is non-existent as the developers were unable to come up with meaningful level design, and were hoping procgen would be a viable subsitute.  Developers must learn that procgen is not content.  To try to disguise their failure at the basic task of story/level design, they made the game ultra difficult in the hopes gamers wouldn't see enough of the game to notice.  We noticed.  The icing on the cake is the core gunfighting FPS mechanism is woefully bad, with sloppy loose aiming and controls, where FPS games must absolutely be tight and precise on this. 

Unacceptably low quality but a crazy $10 USD price tag here, which would get you any of the Quake games, or one of the newer Wolfenstein games or one of literally hundreds of the other, better FPS games on steam.  Untouchable bundle worsening garbage.

review:
I literally finish this game under 2 hours and this not bad at all except! It's literally Bullet Hell, Roguelike, Binding of Isaac, Doom theme. But it's pretty fun when you get used to controls and the ost is not bad but I prefer just play your own music in the bg like Technical Itch or Heavy Metal. (UwU) 

The first four levels are interesting but sometimes can be challenging it depends on your R&G on Items or Enemies the Bosses are interesting to fight some are easy and others are odd just a little bit unfair in ways... There are other four levels it gets a bit harder but interesting also the environment changed now you are in a Nazi Submarine I guess. But there one item in the game makes you god-tier it gives you the ability to "control gravity" at this point you just won the game no enemy can't touch you except for range!

F u n  F a c t  T i m e: Make sure to dodge a lot and Bunny Hop a lot you're going to need it! :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198024088429', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1602342431}
review: I think most of the enjoyment you'll get out of this game will come from the movement/shooting you'd expect from an arena shooter, which I think holds quite well into the roguelike environment that Paranautical Activity created. Being able to control your character is key, evading danger is the best way to stay alive and it makes for really exciting gameplay, especially with the variety of enemy types and attacks. Along your run you pickup new items or weapons that can change the way your run plays quite dramatically. Overall I think if you're really into the arena-shooter gameplay you should give this game a shot, although it doesn't have a whole lot more to offer past that, so beware

author: {'steamid': '76561198029433394', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1601523375}
review:
For a game where movement is this important, the developers sure sucked at making you able to move at all. Quickly strafing is impossible, because there you have to accelerate to each side you want to strafe to.

So you are left with two movement options: either you keep running in the same direction, which WILL get you killed, because the enemies shooting at you are too fast.

Or you jump.

So, the game is running in circles and jumping, while trying to remain aware of your environment in a poorly lit room.

Also, the style is all over the place. The game itself goes for a pixelated 3D (well, voxels), whereast the menus (which stink) follow an entirely different style with an ugly "bleeding" font.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018892742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1586411996}
review:
Maybe my brain is too old, and my hands too arthritic, but I can't get into this.

Paranautical Activity is a procedurally generated throwback to late 90's twitch shooters, where you're expected to be spamming jump constantly. Back then, jump dodging in a shooter was necessary to be competitive against online human players, but here it's the core gameplay mechanic, and even twenty years ago, I wasn't into it.

The game's a little too random. The kitchen sink vibe with weapons, power-ups, and enemies is kind of appropriate for the throwback vibe the developer is going for, but the level layout gets samey. Procedural generation is best used to create moments of emergent gameplay: here, I found myself hoping I'd run into bosses I was already equipped to deal with, rather than finding ways to use what I had.

The low-fi voxel graphics are good, as is the music (if a little repetative), but the gameplay just isn't what I'm looking for in a shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067238539', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1592861818}
review:
Something somewhere went terrible wrong with the development of this game.

The music's amazing, and I'm returning for it, but that's the only good thing I can tell.

Everything's rushed and clunky, it just doesn't work. There are much better roguelikes out there, honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053229942', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 1092, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1418388697}

author: {'steamid': '76561198180063266', 'num_games_owned': 8807, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1592129670}
review:
I think I got old, can`t get more than a couple of rooms in before getting stomped. More often that not I`m killed by something I can`t even see as soon as I enter a room, I assume something has spawned under me but I really can`t tell, yes just seen an enemy spawn on top of me, that`s not good. 
Some of the room layouts are very cramped and favour not being able to avoid enemy attacks reliably because you also have to contend with heavy inertia on your character yet you`re also very bouncy, it`s not a good combination. Enemies, pickups etc are also too hard to see when a lot of the levels are a sea of darkness.
Like others have said(years ago now.. I`m lazy, so what) there are way too many better examples out now for this to stand out. A shame because with a few tweaks this could be good, the basics are there. Graphics are simple but cute(although the voxel is overused by now) Music and Sfx are generall good too.
Maybe wait for a heavy sale or a bundle and have a c..p ton more patience and be better at games then I am.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988783984', 'num_games_owned': 3010, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1578034827}
review:
Gripes:
* Menu's are very unpolished static Images with what is white slimey text which is very suggestive.
* Enemies are thematically random. No thought was put into the enemies you're facing.
eg. Sharks Swimming through Metal, Ninja's, Midget Wizards, Demons, Flying Rocket Turtles.
* Maps are very samey the more you play with no variation to area's (Everything is metal boxes)

Nices:
Unlockables through Acheivements slowly feeding more content (Bosses, Guns, Buffs\Debuffs)

All in All:
There are other games that do Roguelites alot better (like Ziggurat).
If you get this free, it's worth giving a quick play.
Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend buying it.

review: Worth it if you get it on sale. It's a short rogue-like with solid shooting mechanics and interesting upgrades that let you attain very different play styles on each run. I also appreciated that it was moderately difficult and was a little bit of a challenge to beat. For the replayablility factor it's fun to try out the various different weapons (I think the best primary is the rocket launcher), but after I beat it once I didn't feel like coming back and trying to beat it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1187, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1565348075}
review:
One of the worst things I've ever seen on steam or in my life period. It's almost as bad as Postal 2. It feels like someone took a bad atari 2600 game and somehow made it into 3D. There are no sound effects hardly at all besides when you fire and maybe one or two other things but that's it. Only a few weapons have sound effects anyway. Enemies have none, the environment has none. The weapons in the game, all of them, are just god awful horrible buttgarbage. The music is about ten times louder than the sound effects unless you fix it in the options, which I didn't even bother looking to see if I could because I alt+f4'ed right the hell out after 9 minutes of torture. The music never stops either. It plays on a loop and dying, going to the main menu, nothing stops it except maybe turning it off in the sound menu. This feels like a super generic Doom knockoff from the late 90's, basically vaporware. Actually it feels like the alpha of a super generic Doom knockoff that got abandoned and just released as shareware/freeware. I played a bunch of those back in the late 90's and they were suicide inducingly bad, and this is just as bad if not worse. It's like playing this is giving me flashbacks and triggering my 90's bad-game PTSD. Nam was bad enough, I don't need this shit now.

I got a key online for around 80 cents and that was about five dollars too much, which in other words they should pay people to take this trash. As for me, if I had a physical copy I would take it alright. Take it right to the dump. I would lay it on top of the dump, climb up a big ladder, tape a live grenade to my arm, and do a Macho Man Randy Savage elbow drop onto it and pull the pin on the grenade in mid-air so it explodes when I hit.

Holy fucking shit this is GARBAGE.

-2500/10 and I mean this score with genuine sincerity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163513876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1593037360}
review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review:
Most wretched rogue-lite FPS I've ever played. Wretched aesthetics (I'm not a graphics hound but I like nice design), wretched music (the kind one would find in a youtube video made by a 12 years old), room layouts are completely uninspired and, above all, killing enemies is the most unsatisfactory experience I ever had in my life. I do not recommend it.

Edit: People who compare this game to Doom have either lost their goddamn mind or are 12 years olds who never even played it.

review: Tougher than leather soaked in year-old grease. Somehow if you stick to it, you'll see yourself grow tougher yourself. After 20 restarts I got my first achievement Beat a room without taking damage. After 50 deaths, I finally looked up a guide on how to strafe correctly. It's not about 'Git Good'. It's about 'Git Better'. Learn-adapt.  Your reflexes will eventually catch up. Those glowing bullets will start to look dodge-able. Very thankful for this game. Might just get me to start playing FPS more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 2041, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1551788408}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Paranautical Activity: Deluxe Atonement Edition (or simply Paranautical Activity) is a game developed and published by Digerati Distribution

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless

Paranautical Activity: Deluxe Atonement Edition (or simply Paranautical Activity) overall, however, is a fun game to play, yet sometimes repetitive and it does get boring and tedious if being played for a long time, but is a great rouge-like action game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025244321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1546446004}
review:
marginally worse than a death threat.

No wait: that's trite. Let's be proper about this.

It genuinely amazes me that the dev of a buggy chunk of voxelated turd like this really thought they were such a badboi that they could threaten Gaben. It's just as staggering that anyone considered this worthwhile enough to let it come back to steam.

Here's my experience:

Game starts. Music is blatantly made from a "DIY Dubstep pack of loops and samples" (my old job used to be designing cover art for these, so  know 'em when i hear them). I see a static menu, and can't use a (regular xbox) gamepad to select anything on it. Mouse pointer is present, but menu options don't light up on hover. I click new game. Nothing happens for about 2 minutes. Then I'm dropped into the game, which is paused. Gamepad can now move the selected pause menu option, but no button on it actually selects anything. I click resume or whatever with the mouse instead. It lags for about 10 seconds, then unpauses and my PoV swings around wildly and i end up looking at the floor, despite me touching no inputs during this. I try to mouselook. That's a nope. I use the gamepad instead, and look around. Turning is sooooooooo slow by default that it takes 15 seconds to turn 360 degrees. I consider pausing, but neither esc nor gamepad start seem to do it, although they do make the music hiccup. I take a rough guess that the pause button is set on high speed autofire, and decide ok no pausing. I walk into the next room. Walking on gamepad is at a reasonable pace, but as i get into the next room, shots are fired and i see that something to my left is attacking me. After SEVEN WHOLE SECONDS of turning, i see that it's some kind of devil guy and i get a bead on him just long enough to squeeze off one shot, or rather i slam all the gamepad's shoulder triggers and bumpers in order, and 1.5 sec later, my gun fires. I'm amazed i even notice, mind, because there's no visual feedback to indicate this other than a few voxels at the gun muzzle. No kickback. Maybe it made a noise, but the music is turnt up so high I'd never hear gunshots. Then I dides, because of course i took 7 sec of being fired upon before i could even look at what attacked me.

Weirdly, using this exact same PC multiple years ago, I've seen this game run at a reasonable speed with mouse and wasd.

Based on my experience with it today, which is my only firsthand experience, this is a laughable borkfest, and so is its author if they ever considered it anything worth defending with such spite as death threats.

Maybe the atonement should have been "learn to dev" instead of getting to repollute steam with this piece of fail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058713421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1462841275}
review:
Actual review: P good, but I wouldn't recommend supporting whoever gets money from this game now and that's what the rest of my review is going to be about.

Why you shouldn't buy this: This game was halted in development after it was removed from steam. The Deluxe atonement part of the title refers to that.

 One of the two main devs for this game, the one responsible for coding if I'm not mistaken, made a post intended to express his frustration with how steam handles update pushing, in this post he said that he wanted to kill Gabe Newell for this, as a not so proper way to show his anger toward the system. Now while I'm not saying he was right to say that, I also understand the joke there. Everyone who plays competitive online games gets that, its the same as that little kid threatening to kill your mother for beating them. As such it should be obvious that the Dev meant that as a tactless joke.

Unfortunately the guys at Steam didn't see it this way. And while it is completely in their right to do so, I believe they overreacted by removing this game. Do I think this was justified, not entirely, but the same could be said about the statement, Dev didn't Have to include the killing part and we would have understood his frustration just the same. 

This all occured right in the middle of a pretty consistent update stream from the devs, they were very active with the community and had Just started getting through some of the stretch goals from a kickstarter for this game. They were being the good devs that we want early access games. Unfortunately for everyone they had to sell the property to the new publisher, this made it so there would be No new updates, ever. The online Co-op that was promised and being worked on will never come as a result of this, nor will anything.

This game could have been big. There is already a ton of content in here and it was going to be so much more.. But a stupid statement by a naive dev and an earned, however unjust, punishment from steam, robbed anyone from seeing what this game could have been.

review: This game is awesome! It's a high action, super fast paced, roguelike game and I love it. Imagine the graphics of Clone Drone in the Danger Zone and mix it with the fast paced play style of superhot and then add a binding of isaac twist to it and that's what you have here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014294392', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1530554657}
review:
Not a bad game, I did not expect much but was pleased with the rush of fighting...until the "Dark Room" comes in (which I think is at random) Then it's game over.

The idea of the game is to watch the monsters closely and their attacks but the whole idea is floored when you add in random almost pitch black floors meaning you just take hit after hit. Due to this, it's almost unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1529883108}
review:
Un shooter roguelike, bastante entretenido, el modo clasico cuenta con la dificultad adecuada para ir avanzanzando poco a poco. Los enemigos son contados pero no resultan repetitivos.
El juego transcurre en niveles generados aleatoriamente, lo que puede causar que la entrada sea de cara a un enemigo, asi que tienes que estar listo, tiene un buen numero de items con varios efectos que te hacen la vida mas facil. En cuanto a armas yo apenas he encontrado mas de las que te dan por clase.
El juego esta bien, los graficos igual son un poquiito feos pero meh.
Me parece que logra lo que se propone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974707623', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1516141810}
review:
If you‚Äôre like me you probably had never heard of Paranautical Activity until either, A: it made the rounds on YouTube for a short period of time; if you blinked you might have missed it. Or B: You heard about the lead dev threatening to kill Gabe Newell over incorrect branding on the front page of steam. What you probably never heard is that it‚Äôs a good game.

Now, I don‚Äôt have the playtime to get deep into the mechanics of the game, and I‚Äôm not going to waste my time on a game I don‚Äôt like. So this is coming from a complete novice. But I can‚Äôt think of a game I‚Äôve bounced off of harder.

For starters, the movement in Paranautical Activity is strangely floaty and has a momentum to it that I wouldn‚Äôt expect from a game where you run around like you‚Äôre playing OG DOOM. There is something to the movement that just makes it feel bad‚Ä¶ You don‚Äôt quite speed up like you would expect, and you don't‚Äô really stop where want to either. It‚Äôs like you‚Äôre moving through water at all times. I‚Äôm sure that if I was willing to put more time into this that I could probably get used to it. But I find the feeling to be very, very, off putting.

Like most rogue-likes there are multiple starting classes, each with their own stats and weapons. Sadly most of the starting weapons suck. You either have a high damage, slow shot speed crossbow that‚Äôs difficult to land a hit with. A grenade launcher with timed explosives. A close range sickle. Or a Shotgun. The only gun that felt good to me was the shotgun, sadly it‚Äôs also comes packaged with the slowest starting movement speed. Perhaps I‚Äôm just bad, but I found that it was nigh impossible to avoid the first floor boss‚Äôs attacks with ‚Äúthe tank‚Äù. Nothing feels better in a game than being too slow to move out of the way of an attack. If you couldn‚Äôt tell, that was sarcasm.

The slow ass movement and the unappealing weapons combined with the floaty movement is a recipe for disaster‚Ä¶

Perhaps if the game looked better I would be willing to give it more of a chance. But no, the art sucks too. Paranautical Activity has a voxel based artstyle, making it look like it was inspired by Minecraft‚Ä¶ Which maybe in 2013 wasn‚Äôt done to death, but I‚Äôve never liked the blocky look of these types of games, where everything looks like it was put together with legos‚Ä¶ ¬†Now don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm willing to give this kind of art a pass if it does something interesting with it like say Paint the Town Red. Or 8-bit Armies. But this game really doesn‚Äôt do much. It has some nice colored lighting and a few interesting shaders, and that‚Äôs about it. Plus it‚Äôs almost like they knew the art wasn‚Äôt anything special so they made the game really dark to kind of hide it... But all it does is make enemies blend into the environment.

Now to continue beating a dead horse, the music is bad too. It feels straight out of a 2007 Newgrounds flash game. It has almost no thematic relation to the feel of the game, the beat is just a little too fast for the gameplay, and‚Ä¶ Well it‚Äôs just bad techno....

I almost feel bad because I know people spent a lot of time making this. But it‚Äôs just bad. No, it's awful. There is no redeeming quality to it. It's a waste of time, money, and hard drive space.

I cannot recommend this game in any way, shape, or form. I think I got it in a humble bundle, and honestly even that‚Äôs not a great value. If this game truly interests you, well you probably already own it and have played it enough to not care what I think.

But on the off chance that you‚Äôre coming upon this before you actually buy it. Turn back. Abandon hope, all ye who play this game.

review:
Paranautical Activity jest ciekawƒÖ strzelankƒÖ z mechanikƒÖ podobnƒÖ do tej z The Binding of Isaac, chodzisz po pomieszczeniach, zabijasz wszystko co siƒô rusza, walczysz z potƒô≈ºnymi bossami, zdobywasz itemy dajƒÖce r√≥≈ºne efekty, jedziesz coraz ni≈ºej, ≈ºeby spotkaƒá siƒô ze swoim przeznaczeniem. Wszystko ≈õwietnie, ale gra wyglƒÖda na jakby niedoko≈ÑczonƒÖ, nieco pustawƒÖ i niezbalansowanƒÖ. Mamy tu nieco item√≥w, tylko brak w nich balansu, poniewa≈º niekt√≥re sƒÖ beznadziejne, a niekt√≥re a≈º za dobre. Gra wymaga od nas czasami niez≈Çego refleksu i zwinno≈õci, poniewa≈º niekt√≥rzy przeciwnicy sƒÖ bardzo szybcy i zwinni, przez co musimy byƒá w ciƒÖg≈Çym ruchu. Mamy boss√≥w, kt√≥rzy w sumie nie sƒÖ jakim≈õ wyzwaniem szczeg√≥lnie, gdy zdobƒôdzie siƒô odpowiedni item na odpowiedniego bossa, mamy np. go≈õcia z rybnƒÖ broniƒÖ, kt√≥ry nawala jakim≈õ mega atakiem, ale gdy zdobƒôdziemy grzybek, kt√≥ry nas pomniejsza to okazuje siƒô, ≈ºe jego atak nie siƒôga ni≈ºej, wiƒôc boss ma przekichane i nic nam nawet zrobiƒá nie mo≈ºe. Naj≈õmieszniejsze jest to, ≈ºe odblokowujemy tutaj wiele rzeczy zdobywajƒÖc osiƒÖgniƒôcia w grze, w sumie podobna mechanika jest w The Binding of Isaac, tylko ≈ºe te osiƒÖgniƒôcia nie sƒÖ trudne, gdy siƒô odblokuje konkretne osiƒÖgniƒôcia dla danych rzeczy, a i to jedyny ≈õrodek napƒôdowy dla naszej motywacji, poniewa≈º w tej grze nie mamy ≈ºadnej historii, schodzimy do 7 czy nawet 8 piƒôtra, zabijajƒÖc hordƒô przeciwnik√≥w, robimy czasem rze≈∫, ale bez konkretnej przyczyny, bo tak i tyle, we wcze≈õniej wspomnianej grze mamy chocia≈º jaki≈õ konkretny cel, a tutaj? Jedynym konkretem jest Dahlia, ostatecznym boss, kt√≥ry wystƒôpuje na 7 i 8 piƒôtrze, ale nie wiadomo w jakim celu go mamy zabiƒá.

To mo≈ºe ja lepiej opowiem o oprawie audiowizualnej. Grafika jest strasznie nijaka, prosta i ponura, czasami potwory zlewajƒÖ siƒô w tle, przez co trudno czasem je wypatrzeƒá, a muzyka jest ≈õredniawa, wpasowuje siƒô w tƒÖ rozwa≈Çke, ale jest takie sobie.

Jak chodzi i optymalizacjƒô oraz inne cuda to gra zazwyczaj dobrze dzia≈Ça, ale klatki lubiƒÖ spa≈õƒá, gdy dzieje siƒô za du≈ºo, no i wystƒôpuje w tej grze mn√≥stwo bug√≥w, jak pr√≥bowa≈Çem graƒá tr√≥jzƒôbem, bo siƒô trafi≈Ç to dwa razy mi siƒô zbugowa≈Ç, niestety za drugim razem zniknƒÖ≈Ç i by≈Çem bez broni g≈Ç√≥wnej, czyli zgon, bo druga bro≈Ñ na amunicje nie nadawa≈Ça siƒô do walki.

To mo≈ºe plusy i minusy:
Plusy:

+R√≥≈ºnorodno≈õƒá item√≥w
+Nieg≈Çupie AI

Minusy:

-Brakuje nieco wyko≈Ñczenia tej grze, gra wydajƒô siƒô trochƒô pustawa

PodsumowujƒÖc potencja≈Ç by≈Ç, zrobiƒá FPSa ≈ÇƒÖczƒÖcego Quake-a z The Binding of Isaac, ale gdzie≈õ tu brakuje wyko≈Ñczenia i balansu, choƒá gra jest nienajgorsza to mozna by≈Ço zrobiƒá to lepiej, moja ocena to 6,5/10, jak braƒá to tylko po tanio≈õci albo za darmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996630152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1512353641}
review:
I have very mixed feelings about Paranautical Activity. Almost every positive about the game is countered with a negative, yet I'd still recommend it to players who are really into roguelites and mid-90's first-person shooters (and don't mind a game that looks and sounds like crap, if I'm being honest). They could get a few hours of genuine fun out of it, and maybe even find it addicting, like I have. However, if you're not totally in love with both of those genres, the game's flaws will probably be too much to ignore.

When the game works well, it's honestly a lot of fun. It elicits some of the same excitement one would feel from playing the original Quake, or even Doom 2016: you're circle-strafing all over the room, leaping from platform to platform, hopping over lava pits, looking for escape routes, dodging fireballs, setting off explosive barrels at just the right moments, and prioritizing targets based on what kind of attack capabilities or strength they have. It's an old-school FPS treat.

When the game [i]doesn't[/i] work well, you enter a room and are immediately swarmed by melee enemies who move too fast to avoid getting hit by, who are hard to see and shoot because the game's visual style is so dark, and who can easily sneak up on you because almost no enemies in the game make any sound, all while relentless homing fireballs chase you everywhere. Then you spend a minute sweeping the room to find an enemy that's stuck behind a wall so you can kill it and clear the area. That's when the game feels remarkably clumsy.

With this being a roguelite, you can expect perma-death and levels with randomized layouts and object placements. Map design here is extremely simple, with every room being a cube, identical in size and shape to every other room. Thankfully, each room is decorated with a variety of multi-tiered platforms, staircases and hazards to keep things exciting, though it won't be long until you start noticing repeated room designs--sometimes several in a row. Randomly, modifiers will also kick in that make levels darker (as if they weren't dim enough already) or icy and slippery. These modifiers are a cool design concept, but the execution tends to just make the gameplay more annoying.

You can obtain equippable items from shops and bosses. The thing is, the game never tells you what an item does until you've actually collected it (and sometimes not even then). That makes item collection a real gamble, as you might spend money on useless equipment, or get stuck with something that messes with your stats and actually makes you weaker. That sort of random chance and learning curve is part of what makes roguelites enjoyable, as a single decision can drastically alter the difficulty of a run, but the game being so vague and unhelpful can induce frustration as well.

Saving your game isn't an option either. A full playthrough generally isn't terribly long, but it still sucks to have to lose your progress when real life calls you away.

The game has a nice unlock system at least, where new items, playable characters (with unique stats and weapons) and game modes are introduced when you perform certain achievements. This encourages skillful play, and gives you fresh stuff to look forward to on subsequent runs. Admittedly, a lot of the items in the game are generic buffs and debuffs, but there are a few creative powers--an item allows you to shrink down and become a tiny target who can hide inside small openings, for instance--that fundamentally alter the gameplay, sometimes to a deliciously broken degree.

In the end, despite all the flaws, I kept coming back to this game. The core gameplay constantly demands dextrous movements and careful aim. Couple that with the inherent roguelite charm of experimenting with different characters and getting lucky with item shop selections, and I found it pretty engaging. But it's definitely rough around the edges.

review:

Cool mechanics
fun gameplay

Cons:
The graphics are voxel graphics ( i personally dont mind but some people hate this)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066545552', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1459876107}
review:
[h1]ENGLISH AND ITALIAN REVIEW[/h1]

[b]ENG[/b]
Paranautical Activity is a bad dungeon crawler, hands down. An indie game which is rotting here on Steam since years and imho, it did nothing to redeem itself. It's bugged, the difficulty is contrived... It's empty; initially i was attracted by it for the pixels' gaudy tones and the frenzy fights, but then i've found this and nothing else. It's also very easy to die in unpredictable ways and for the aforementioned frantic gameplay, so in the end even this thing is a negative point (mind you, i'm all in for games like Quake or that sort of thing, but this is just a bad kind of cheap bullet-fest). It's true, each time you play there's a random layout of the rooms just like 'The Binding of Isaac' and other similar games, but actually there isn't that much of variety. Zones are copied and pasted continuously, to put it bluntly. This is perhaps the most ugly and messed up review I've ever wrote, but i don't know how to say it otherwise. This game is petty, boring, unsatisfying, incomplete, bugged, unmotivated. If you like the genre, then just stick with the pillars and don't waste your time and money. Don't get me wrong, i like novelties and niches, i've played a lot of these games and i even appreciated more obscure gems like Ziggurat or Delver, but this one... This one doesn't have neither head nor tail, for me you should avoid it and give a shot to something else on the store. Could be worse, but it could be way, way better.

[code][b]Did you find this review helpful? Then you should consider the idea of visiting the following [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/autisticreviews]link[/url], in order to get infos for even more games![/b] https://steamcommunity.com/groups/autisticreviews[/code]

-

[h1]ITA[/h1]
Paranautical Activity √® un brutto dungeon crawler, poche storie. Un indie game che sta marcendo qui su Steam ormai da anni, e imho non ha fatto nulla per redimersi. E' buggato, la difficolt√† √® artificiosa... √® vuoto. Inizialmente mi attirava per i toni sgargianti dei pixel e la frenesia dei combattimenti, ma poi mi sono ritrovato questo e nient'altro. Che poi √® facile morire in modi imprevedibili o appunto per la "frenesia" appena citata, quindi alla fin fine anche questo diventa un contro. Certo, abbiamo il layout randomico delle stanze un po' come succede su giochi come 'The Binding of Isaac', ma non si riesce a percepire chiss√† quanta variet√†, anzi. Le zone sono trite e ritrite, detto in maniera molto schietta. 
Questa √® sicuramente la recensione pi√π brutta ed ingarbugliata che potessi scrivere, ma non so come dirvelo diversamente... 'Sto gioco √® meschino, palloso, insoddisfacente, incompleto, buggato, immotivato. Se prediligete questo genere, tanto vale continuare a stickare con i pilastri, piuttosto. E badate che non sono contro le novit√†, o meglio, le nicchie. Dopotutto non faccio altro che giocare a questo genere di giochi! Ve lo dice insomma uno che ha saputo apprezzare dungeon crawlers pi√π misconosciuti quali Ziggurat o Delver, ma questo... Questo non ha n√® arte n√® parte. A mio avviso √® da evitare.

review: There are too many good roguelites on steam for the same price or cheaper to warrant playing this boring, vapid, shallow, low effort game. I may have changed my mind if I had played more, but I won't because I returned it, because if the first 100 minutes are trash, it's probably trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084577486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1414346913}
review:
This game [b]is not finished[/b].
This game [b]does not have mostly positive reviews.[/b]
This game [b]is abandoned[/b] and it is a fact, there has been no dev interaction.  No dev updates for years.
[i][b]The only potential updates you will see is this game added to a Humble Bundle or other content sharing service and put on sale for a quick cashgrab.[/b][/i]

Code Avarice [b]SOLD[/b] the game to another company after they got [b]BANNED[/b] from Steam.  This game was banned from Steam because one of the Code Avarice devs made a vield death threat during Halloween a few years ago towards GABE the man of Steam.  They played it off as a joke and were eventually allowed to return to Steam but only under the ownership of the new company, Digerati.  Sadly they do not update the game or make bug fix patches either.

If you buy this game beware.

[b][i] --- Onto the actual game review --- [/i][/b]

This game is great to play for a while.  You load it up and feel great like you are slamming down some monsters.  After a while you notice the rooms are repeated and use the same few types over and over.  There is little diversity to what you experience after a while.  I mean everything is repeated.  Mob types, graphics... everything.

Code Avarice made an update to "Delux Atonement Edition" which fixed a few things.  It is obvious the mobs and weapons had some work put into them and they're interesting in themselves.  However everything remained repeated like in the original version.  They added diversity by adding a static picture of lava to the floor.  It was nice at first... but it is not moving lava or anything with smoke/steam particles.  The same picture on the floor on every lava room.  Just like the first version with everything being repeated.  I was not impressed as there are so many particles on everything else... could of reused that code for a little diversity.

All together with the bugs, lack of updates, *zero* developer involvement and generic repetition of environment in this game.  It makes it difficult to play for more than a few hours.  I enjoyed [i][b]Ziggurat[/b][/i] more than this, or [i][b]Tower of Guns[/b][/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198003729995', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1551574485}
review: I must admit, what initially drew me to Paranautical Activity was the name. I don't know what it means, but it sounds cool. In terms of gameplay, picture Minecraft, but with guns and bombs and samurai swords, flying skulls, spiders, bats and sharks all trying to kill you, and add a drums and bass/dubstep soundtrack. That's Paranautical Activity in a nutshell. The way the game works however, is that on each floor, there's a number of randomly-generated rooms with random enemies in them. Kill the boss on each floor to advance, but here's the catch. If you die, you start at the very beginning. Now, this makes PA more punishing than some other games, but I suppose it's niche is for people who enjoy the grind, or the process of constantly dying. While I don't personally have the patience for such a game, it's actually entertaining, but above all intense. The run and gun aspect of the game makes it incredibly fast-paced, and were it not for dying and restarting from square one over and over, I think I could easily keep playing Paranautical Activity. Overall Score: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054637442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1601675563}
review: when i first launched the game i was confused, there was a man with a shotgun at my door. he was telling me not to say something, i was unaware of what i was supposed to refrain from saying. i was screaming as he pointed the shotgun at my head only for it to cut away. then it shows 3 college kids looking to purchase a house in the middle of nowhere, the blonde girl is sceptical of the purchase but the other 2 convince her to take the house offer. when the nerd and blonde girl are sleeping the nerd hears voices coming from a desk unit only to find a bunch of writing on the inside of the drawer. the writing says "Don't Say It, Don't Think It" repeating over and over again. when the nerd kid flips the drawer over he see's the words "The Bye-Bye Man" carved into the bottom. It was at this moment that i realised that i was in fact not playing Paranautical Activity: Deluxe Atonement Edition. Instead i was actually watching the 2017 film The Bye-Bye Man.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080247122', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1426812168}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2454, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 17875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9553, 'last_played': 1521646657}
review:
Paranautical Activity is what would have happened if Binding of Isaac had been a retro pixel shooter game with a nautical setting. You clear randomly generated rooms in search of an elevator to take you one level deeper until you eventually have to kill several bosses to clear the game. Why? No clue, as there is no story. The game would be fun if it wasn't for the mindbogglingly repetitive gameplay and the extremely small diversity of enemies trying to kill the protagonist. Boss battles are the only redeeming feature, but everything else has been done better before somewhere else.

It's not a bad game per se, but there are many other (an most importantly better) alternatives. Binding of Issac, Enter the Gungeon, Deadly Tower of Monsters etc.

Can't recommend, as I really had to grind though hardcore mode with different characters just for completion's sake. Had fun the first two hours but none after that anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024338968', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1499195959}
review:
Didn't really enjoy this. Menu system is bland or non-existent. Gameplay is repetative. Not in a good way like other games. It's just boring. It wouldn't be so bad for the price if the music wasn't absolutely irritating. 

I can see the appeal for those who like Binding of Issac andare looking for an alternative for cheap, but I just couldn't enjoy it. Only played for about 20 minutes but knew it wasn't for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066159836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1547853256}
review:
Meh.
Is all I can really say if someone asked for a quick description of this game.
The long one is here:
The game has a pretty good soundtrack which I really like. But it is too quick for the gameplay, which is slow and should be much quicker. For example, you have 4 classes David Bowie, Di-no-mite (or sumtin') , (the really quick one), and The Tank.
Out of these 4 only 2 are playable. (David and The Quick One) Becouse Di and Tank are too slow. When I played as them it was extremely boring going to room to room slower than a snail on salt. And even with the quick guys (B and T.Q.O) you sometimes can't run away from the enemies. The A.I. mostly tries to get as close to you as possible, and most of the time it's faster than you. So you get stuck in an endless party of pain. Which sounds cool but when you're in one it's really frustrating. 


I won't list any ways in how the game could get better simply becouse it's 4 years old and It's in a ''Deluxe Atonement Edition'' and if something has that big of a name, and still sucks. I don't think the creator is going to fix sh**.
So yeah.
0.6 hours in and I already saw everything. Ok game for a very, very short while. Also the price is too big for a simple shooter. Just buy Reptilians Must Die instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070796571', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1493888081}
review:
This game is an absolute trainwreck.

-The ludicrous artstyle makes my brain hurt, voxel games CAN look good, I adore Trove and 3D Dot Game Heroes visuals, but not this one.
-The music, at first, is good, then you realize it's just the same thing over and over and over and over again.
-Unity.
-Controls are janky as hell.

I'd still love to give this game a positive review, especially considering I love these types of games, but I just can't recommend this one, there are far superior games like it out there. If you want an fps roguelite go with Ziggurat, or maybe even Immortal Redneck, it seems to be doing well so far. If you want an isometric/top-down type there's the obvious Binding of Isaac. If you want a platformer go Rogue Legacy.

Just avoid this game at full price, for your own sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087713157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1490059215}
review: This game is even simpler than the description implies; it's essentially just the feel of Quake in the dungeon design of Binding of Isaac. It can't hold a candle to Quake, but it's not quite fair because of the difference in budget. Some of the characters take a lot of getting used to and some of the enemies can fuck right off, but if you're looking for a more frantic, roguelike rendition of Quake, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001460107', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1463486794}
review:
Pissed off Gaben/10

On a serious side, this rougelike, taking cues from Binding of Issac and Quake, mashes up the aforementioned to make something very unique and quite interesting as well, pitting a mere human, at the very bottom of a cruise-liner's hull of which has been possessed by demonic beings, with religious overtones. The gunplay and movement system is much like Quake, with general gameplay and map layout much like Binding of Issac. Also the dev has some real cojones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1488177912}
review:
https://youtu.be/CeMrfJtqDAQ

Roguelike games are increasing in popularity and branching out to different gameplay genres like first person shooters.  The curious design choice to not provide a playable character with a normal weapon is mind boggling.

Enemy AI is very limited and has trouble moving, especially vertically.  As with most games of this type there are lots of things to unlock and explore if enough time and patience is put into the game, but from the jump it's simply not rewarding enough to justify that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971140034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1609883796}
review:
Well, that's 5 minutes I'll never get back.

Turn off the obnoxious music and work around the barely-implemented gamepad support and you'll be taken aback by a game in which graphics, sound and design are so sparse you'll barely have time to notice that the insta-spawn enemies have chewed off half your health bar. There's no ceremony, grace or learning curve to this game, and anything that isn't painfully bland is simply working to disadvantage the player.

At least it came with 2 much better games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325515671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1571110517}
review: Fantastic game. I would say this is a seriously underrated gem that most people will unfortunately look over. I have spent hours in this game. It is a single player rogue-like fps and despite being a single player game, I have spent countless hours playing with a friend by taking turns and switching over after each completed floor. The only thing I would suggest is to add  a co-op option where you can hook up with a friend and take on floors and bosses together. But even without that, this game is a blast to play. I'm not a fan of the music myself so I just mute the music but leave the sound effects on and the game is still intriguing without music, although it would be easy to play whatever music you want over it. I highly recommend this game. It's an easy time waster when you have nothing else to do

author: {'steamid': '76561197990921513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1486408168}
review:
I'm really trying to enjoy the gameplay here, the old-school straff, dodge and shoot kind of gameplay. It seems solid enough I guess. Though I must admit, I find it mostly boring. Not to the point of being tedious, but boring.

But by Glob, I can't stand to look at this hideous art design from the menus to the ingame rendered graphics. And I can't stand this music either. I really tried to push through the visual and musical aspect of it all, but for once, it really ruined the game for me. It feels like this part of the game is totally overlooked as opposed to minimalistic or simple; and the little attemp you can find is way too ugly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037582144', 'num_games_owned': 1790, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1484888967}
review:
This game is fine, but it isn't very polished. It feels like a budget game by one or two people, and it makes a lot of rookie mistakes in its design. Everything is very basic, but doesn't feel very stable. Enemy AI is very simple, always firing where you are instead of where you're going. Most fights just boil down to repetitive kiting. 

Nothing is explained or discoverable. There aren't any tutorials or controlled settings for you to learn how to play, you're just dropped in and expected to figure it out without any signposting. This wouldn't be a big issue in some games, but because of how hectic the fights are, you don't get a chance to absorb information or experiment. When you inevitably die to something that blended in to the chaos fired by an enemy that blended in to the background, the screen presents you with the option to "restart" or "quit". "Restart" sends you back to the main menu. "Quit" closes the game. 

I could go on for hours on the tiny mistakes the game makes all over the place, but overall the game isn't objectively bad. A lot of the problems could be fixed relatively easily. Regardless, I still can't recommend this game considering how many other games on steam are essentially the same game with a hell of a lot more polish.

The soundtrack is nice, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063718507', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1512447623}
review:
As an FPS veteran, this is by far one of the most unbalanced and finnicky games I've ever played.

All copious issues with the developer aside, the game ittself has an extremely weird and just plain annoying difficulty curve. For instance, Khan should not spawn on floor 1. On top of this, the bosses swing wildly from being way too easy to way too difficult. On top of that, the classes are unbalanced too! I could g on.

As a blanket statement, this game, rather than being fun and challenging, will just leave you frustrated. 

I just can't recommend this unless you're a masochist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063351882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1492805534}
review:
Paranautical Activity is truly something special. I remember back when the game was in early access and how the developers were pretty much neglecting their fanbase. I think it took them like 8 months to fix a couple of bugs yet everyone was in shock that the game wasn't abandoned. Now, I haven't really followed the controversy surrounding the game since I'm not interested in developer drama but I am glad that the current developers are actually putting effort into it. 

The game itself, to me personally, is nothing more than a nice time waster. Kind of like The Binding of Isaac, you play in randomly generated levels with rooms you must clear in order to advance to the next floor. What differentiates it from other so-called "time wasters", however, is the pure adrenaline you get from fighting multiple enemies or hugh mungus bosses. Even though I haven't played many rogue likes (mostly because I'm not a fan of the genre), I think this game is a great introduction. Your reflexes and coordination will be put to the test, along with your sense of direction in the sometimes overwhelmingly confusing levels. The voxel graphics are nice to look at for what they are though the level design is pretty bland and not memorable in the slightest.

I'd personally recommend the game if you find it on sale. I see a lot of people saying Ziguratt is better and even though I haven't played it, they seem like two entirely different games. While there are certainly better games than this one, I think you will have a good time with Paranautical Activity.

review: Remember the primal frenzy of the original Quake deathmatch? This brings back that same feeling for me, except it's harder. You have to have really good snap aim and quick reflexes to progress very far. I'm actually taking supplements and exercising in an effort to boost my reflexes and reaction time so that I can survive longer in this game. So far, I've lived past the title screen and menu a few times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963358821', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1488702817}
review:
I'm not a big fan of roguelikes, and I'm not very good at them.  This game has a lot of good things going for it, but fell just short of being great.  If you're a fan of roguelike fps games, then it's worth a try.   However, be aware that the learning curve may be steep.  There's no single starting character that is well balanced for someone new to the game.

Pros
-Great music.  The music may be the best part, imo.  I don't know if I'd call it dubstep, as the outline has.
-The voxel artwork is interesting, and the bosses are all pretty great in their own ways.
-The Seafarers Guide pdf is useful and the mini documentary is interesting. (To find it, right click your game and click properties, then click the "local files" tab and "browse local files")
-I believe a lot of thought was put into the pickups and weapons and effects and differentiating objects from each other.

Cons
-There's no well balanced character for a begginning player to pick up the game quickly with.
-It's not obvious what pickups do.  The seafarers guide will tell you, and google might.  
-A lot of pickups can be detrimental to gameplay, and those seem to be the items I get most.  For example, I seem to get a lot of slow down items when I'm the tank until I move too slow to get out of the way of anything.
-When there are a lot of particles on the screen it can be hard to tell what's going on (this may just be an unavoidable side effect of bullet hell shooters)
-The menus can feel a little cheap.  I can't put my finger on why exactly.  But they're menus, so they don't really matter.  They are the introduction to the game.  Also,  the Unity frontloader always feels kind of amateur(cookie cutter) to me. Moving the controller options and video options into the main game menu and dropping the frontloader would have remedied that.  Again, it really has no effect on gameplay, so it's not a big deal to me.
-On my machine, in OSX, there seems to be some issues with music lagging and possibly other kinds of lag.  An fps counter would be nice, so I could know for sure.  This could just be my machine, or just OSX.  I don't know.
-The controversy surrounding this game is highly disconcerting.  I hope those at fault learned the right lessons from the experience, and that everyone involved was compensated fairly for their efforts.


Games are hard as hell to make, and overall I feel like this was a really good effort.  Without the controversy, and with some incremental improvements, I feel like this game could have gone much further, and been a lot more successful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1479406739}
review:
[h1]Gutes Spiel mit einem fragw√ºrdigem Hintergrund [/h1]

Was meine ich mit fragw√ºrdigem Hintergrund? Dann schonmal vornweg: Ab der 5ten Ebene des Spieles kommt man auf ein Gebiet, wo √ºberall Hakenkreuze zu sehen sind. Man k√∂nnte hier denken, dass man ala Wolfenstein Nazis abschlachtet oder sowas √§hnliches, jedoch scheint der Entwickler(nach den Ger√ºchten) doch diese rechte Einstellung wirklich zu haben. Als das Spiel von Steam kritisiert und darauf von der Plattform entfernt wurde, bedrohte der Entwickler Gaben (Chef von Steam) und und drohte damit, ihn umzubringen. Jetzt wird das Spiel von einem anderen Entwickler gef√ºhrt, jedoch hat der kaum etwas ver√§ndert, au√üer den Startbildschirm und des Einf√ºgen eines Darkfloors. Das Spiel entwickelt sich also nicht mehr wirklich weiter. Es kamen sogar Ger√ºchte auf, dass immernoch derselbe Entwickler an dem Spiel beteiligt ist und der Publisher nur zum Schein gewechselt wurde. Die Hakenkreuze sind auf jeden Fall immernoch da, jedoch kann man es auch so verstehen, dass man eine Unterwasserbasis der Nazis zerst√∂rt. Naja, das war die Vorgeschichte, jetzt zum Spiel:

[b]Gameplay[/b]
In Paranautical Activity gibt es zuf√§llig generierte R√§ume, √§hnlich wie in Bindings of Isaac. Darin befinden sich verschiedenste Gegner, die man schnell und ohne viel Leben zu verlieren, umnieten muss. Dabei hilft es, schnell rumzulaufen und m√∂glichst viel zu springen. Das Spiel ist recht schwer, aber gerade das macht ja Spa√ü daran. Ansonsten kann zwischen mehreren Charakteren w√§hlen(die man auch noch freischaltet) und es gibt auf jeder Ebene immer einen Boss, Nebenboss und einen Laden, wo man sich mit neuen Items eindecken kann. Diese Items sind teilweise sehr kryptisch, was ihren Nutzen angeht. Manche sind mega praktisch, manche bewirken nur, dass der Charakter "ouch!" sagt, wenn er getroffen wird und manche Items sind sogar sehr negativ. Daher sollte man sich vielleicht nen Guide offenhalten, damit man irgendwann mal wei√ü, was man da eigentlich tut. Zudem gibt es noch eine Nebenwaffe, welche Munition ben√∂tigt und kurzeitige Buffs, die man gelegentlich einsetzen kann.

Ich habe es erst nach knapp 10 Stunden Spielzeit geschafft, alle 7(8) Flure durchzukriegen. Mitunter liegt das an nen paar Bugs, wo die Gegner auf mich zukommen und ich quasi auf ihnen stehe und so innerhalb von 2 Sekunden tot bin, da ich mich net wegbewegen kann. Das d√§mpft nat√ºrlich den Spielspa√ü. Dennoch macht es wirklich viel Spa√ü, von vorne anzufangen.

[b]Story[/b]
Naja, es hei√üt Paranautical Activity, also unter Wasser. Ein paar Gegner sehen so aus, aber sonst gibts da keine Story. Da es die bereits angesprochenen "Nazi"-Inhalte gibt, habe ich die Theorie, dass die Nazis die ganzen Gegner erschaffen haben und man selber soll sie aufhalten. Nur eine Theorie. :D

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Tja, wir habens hier mit Voxel Grafik zu tun, die wie ich finde, gut umgesetzt wurde. Nur auf den geheimen "Dark Floors" ist es manchmal schwierig, da manche Gegner nicht genug leuchten, um sie wirklich zu finden. 
Der Soundtrack ist eigentlich recht gut macht irgendwie s√ºchtig. Auch die Waffensounds sind sehr sch√∂n passend umgesetzt worden.

[b]Fazit[/b]
Es ist schwer, Paranautical Activity zu bewerten. Das Spiel kann ja nichts f√ºr seine Hintergrundgeschichte, aber dennoch st√∂rt diese mich. Zum anderen fehlt mir die n√∂tige Itembeschreibung, die nicht mehr kommenden Updates und ein paar Bugs, welche echt nervig sein k√∂nnen. Aber dennoch hat mir dieses Spiel viele lustige Stunden beschert, die einfach viel Spa√ü gemacht haben. Ich gebe daher nen Daumen hoch, der eigentlich auch weiter in der Mitte zu finden sein k√∂nnte. F√ºr den derzeitigen Preis 9 ‚Ç¨ w√ºrde ich es vielleicht grade so noch empfehlen, w√ºrde aber auf ein Angebot warten. 


Hat dir das Review weitergeholfen? Dann folge mir doch in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url], wo ich meine Reviews als Kurator verfasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173495566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1481445219}
review:
Voy a ser claro y conciso en esta rese√±a.
Paranautical Activity es un FPS combinado con elementos Rouge-like y con un aspecto bastante interesante, y hasta cierto punto, agradable de ver. Tiene un estilo visual basado en cubos que es muy bueno y orignal, ademas, tiene una generosa dosis de contenido.
Hay un par de problemas en el juego que me gustaria recalcar:
El primero es que el menu luce bastante sencillo, incluso para los estandares de hoy en dia. Parece que fue hecho de forma sumamente desganada, lo mismo quiza con el HUD, aunque este ultimo se ve mejor trabajado.
El segundo es, y por mucho lo peor, es que los enemigos no hacen ruido alguno. Pareceria que no fuera un gran lio, el problema es que muchas veces los enemigos te saltan por detras o estan escondidos detras de un pilar o debajo de una plataforma, por lo que terminan causandote da√±o de a gratis o te preguntas porque las puertas no se han abierto aun.
He visto rese√±as de gente que se queja de que la unica clase buena para jugar es la del tanque, aunque, personalmente, la clase que maneja el lanza-granadas me parecio un poco mejor y mas divertido, aunque tiene 3 puntos de vida menos que el tanque.
Yo compre el juego con un 75% de rebaja, asi que realmente no me siento estafado. Eso si, no te recomiendo comprarlo a precio completo, hay mejores Rouge-like FPS por ahi si buscas un poco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258932575', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1476049738}
review:
If this was the only dungeon-crawling procedurally-genrated permadeath FPS I've ever played, I'd probably recommend it. It has a strong style going for it‚ÄîI admire that‚Äîbut it just feels a bit mediocre, especially when compared to other games of this genre.

The gameplay is really basic: murder bad things with weapons, run & jump & dodge, enhance your character with power-ups, and progress forward. This is all just fine, but there's not much that makes it stand out here, just like this paragraph!

I understand the logistics in building the enviroments as cubes of equal size, but the designs within are so unimaginitive: too much symmetry and open space. There are a few areas that utilized space in all three axes quite well, but they are rather sparse.
 
The voxel graphics and lighting are my favourite aspects of this game. The enemies are neato, and I especially love the minotaurs... woof, so sexy!

I do like this game, but I don't recommend it because there's more fulfilling ways to spend time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014445897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1480916475}
review:
7/10

A fun roguelike shooter with pixelated graphics. Not the best in its genre, but fun nonetheless.

In Paranautical Activity, you have a few classes to pick and they differ in speed, damage, fire rate, health and starting weapons. After picking your character, you'll be traversing through randomly generated rooms, defeating enemies on the way, collecting money and using said money to buy upgrades when you come to a room with items for sale. At the end of each level, you'll fight a boss before progressing to the next level.

The main issue with the game is that it can be very confusing at times. As a roguelike game, it's expected that the game won't hold your hand and a lot of trial-and-error will be involved, but even then the game does little to tell you what each item does. The game could certainly benefit with being at least slightly more descriptive.

Another issue is that because rooms look mostly the same and enemies repeat themselves a lot as well, the game can become quite repetitive.

In comparison to games like Tower of Guns or Ziggurat, it doesn't stand out, but it's still recommended for those who enjoy roguelike shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963390288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1475890470}
review: Simple and fun, took me a while to get used to the old schools style strafing again.  Areas are cool for voxel, guns feel different from eachother(wish there were more on offer at game start). baddies act differently requiring you to learn each pattern. Very hard. ive gotten to the second stage with the Tank class(High hp) but because of the randomly dropped loot, and my want to clear every room gets me killed before I can go further.  I poke at the game every so often, but the difficulty is off-putting, along with the lack of things to do if you cant beat the first mode. if you want a fast minecraft looking shooter that requires you to jump-turn-attack and toss-bombs at the same time PA's good.  If you have ever played Dark Souls and gave up at the first boss, skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976973986', 'num_games_owned': 3690, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1471986564}
review:
It isn't the most polished game on the planet but at it's core it's simple and executed well enough to be enjoyable. It's a roguelike voxel FPS that's fun just to play a quick game. The only major complaint was a leaping enemy after round four that's near impossible to hit and if you're speed isn't high enough will almost always instakill you.

Standard Price at Time of Review: $9.99
Aegis's Recommended Price Pickup: $2.49

author: {'steamid': '76561197994002569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3372, 'last_played': 1670787305}
review:
Alot of reviews hate on this game unreasonably harshly. This is in part from reviews when it was still in developement, or under prior ownership. Admittedly the designers of this game had some management problems and also did not deliver all of the things they promised (such as multiplayer support). What they did do is create a satisfying and addicting shooter. 
reasons for this
The game is randomised for a different experience everytime
TONS of items, over 100 I believe
Overall fun and FAST fluid play 

I could go into much more detail but it is only by playing the game for at least a few hours that you start to appreciate all the different items/powerups/weapons and how they can interact with eachother. An item that seems terrible 95% of the time may in some circumstance or combined with another become so powerful it is almost game breaking. This coupled with dodging and destroying hoards of 8 bit enemies all the while listening to pumping techno music is extremely satisfying.
