author: {'steamid': '76561198066699578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1741, 'last_played': 1621922674}
review:
Another early access game gone astray, this game had so much potential till 1) the devs are the worst 2) sold out quick 3) released an unfinished game. 
     The grindy industrial music adds a lot to this epileptic bullet hell fps but everything else in this game is extremely lacking. Stylistically, this game is total garbage. There is no consistency to any of the art you find in the game and the "nautical"  of this game is forced in to what seems like a random set of enemies. You're on a nazi ship and you'll find anything from moths to snails if you get the just. They only have two different room backgrounds they apply to rooms with different torch placements. Yes you heard that right two room backgrounds on a FINISHED GAME IN A GAME WHERE YOU ONLY GO INTO ROOMS. And the graphics oh my lord the graphics. These graphics looked like they were made by a 15 year old learning how to use voxel. Holy shit are they just flat out terrible. 
     There is no such thing as balance in this game classes or items. That wouldn't be such an issue if there was such a thing as building your character but its all 100% chance based folks. That boss that gives you double jump which is essential? Well you are just about as likely to find a shitty boss who gives you a garbage item. Wanna beat the game as the Tank? Well you might as well play bouncer because you don't need a speed up item or skill. OH BOY I got another dark floor item even though I didn't and will not get a single DARK ROOM. 
     Progressing in this game is like using a cheese grater as a fleshlight. You have no fucking clue if your build will win because you might just die to a totally random room because it was so fucking impossible.  Its almost like you're not even building to win, you are just building to hopefully surive to floor 7 MAYBE. The first playthrough where you think you're going to win is tarnished when you walk into a room and take 10 damage. This isn't even due to lack of skill, the devs flat out made layouts where if you don't see every enemy in the room and the room itself and react before 1 second 95% of the locations you try to run to will lead to 2-3 damage. Do you feel like you are making it anywhere with your build? No. Never. You seriously will get fucking destroyed sometimes and all your left with is why am I still playing this game.
     This is game has its fair share of bugs, there are so many I don't even know where to begin.I swear the more rooms you enter the game gets laggier by the end so you might as well just not try to stock up. I've had so many fictitiously good builds and then I get to the last boss and it drops to one frame rate. The only poor soul I got invested into this game has a super computer and after it released as a full game it could barely run at 10 fps for him. Enemies will like the caustic dogs and the flipping monkey men will get caught on room obstacles constantly. Enemies in general will sometimes get stuck in walls and you are literally just trapped in a room and have to restart. 
     Don't even get me started on their cheesy excuse for an update. They somehow made the game worse and managed to overlook anything any player of this game might want. All I can imagine is the devs for this game sitting at a table thinking "Lets make a floor type that fucking blows, a poor attempt at a hardcore mode, and a couple of new rooms that ARE TOTALLY UNBALANCED.". Well thanks devs thats about as good as an idea as sending death threats at Gabe Newell and losing all the poor souls paying too much for your game. The devs even made fun of the players of their OWN GAME on twitter. WHO EVEN FUCKING DOES THAT.
     If you are looking to buy an fps roguelite don't buy this one. Please do not buy this. The devs are trash, the game will only ruin your hopes for what it could have been,  and it will give you a sezuire. Speaking from a player whos been playing since early access, it is not and it will never be worth your time sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 685, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1467939939}
review:
This is how not to do a roguelike. You can choose from 4 different guys, 2 of them worthless and unplayable, and 1 pretty bad. Then theres the game. Half the stuff you pick up on the ground you don't know what it is until you get it. Same for pickups from boss drops. Some items will tell you what it is called before you pick it up, but you have no idea what it does. Then theres the permanent items that you can't even read what they are, so you can't reference an item list from a guide. So you can be completely screwed. I was shotgun guy and picked up 1 slow down but more health, but i had no idea thats what it did. I was too slow and lost and had to immediately restart. I shouldn't be screwed bc of the game's fault for lack of info. Many items are just tradeofs, like temporary armor for perm speed reduction, which is just dumb and screws you, but once again don't know till its too late and you lose. There's no item list or info from the game about what items do, so you need outside lists. Enemies can spawn on top of you once you enter a room, leading to cheap damage. Some enemies also blend into floor and background, leading to cheap damage bc u can't see them, once again game's fault. Then there's worst of all. I was half way through game and first room I got had lava all over, and then these skulls that can auto catch up to you and you can't run from and home you and you get hurt. Able to kill them but took damage. Next level 8 skulls spawn, auto catch up to me, and I die in 5 seconds. It's so stupid I got auto loss when there's nothing I can do about it. 

Every room is almost the exact same with maybe some stairs. You fight the same 3 enemies each floor, and usually most of them on the floor above. Bosses are the only cool or original thing, but they usually just shoot colored balls at you anyways. You keep no progress. Can't start from higher floors. Keep no boosts nor money. You don't unlock new guys or any reason to keep playing. You get random unlocks from doing achievements but all that does is make it so an item has a chance of dropping now, which isn't much bc of the randomness. Very poorly designed how you can get into a room and bc of spawn there's nothing you can do  to keep from dying, and you auto die bc of the game, and lose all progress with nothing new to use next time or beefed up character to take going forward. Tons of better roguelikes, that are fair and well made that have incentive to continue playing. 

3.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080435169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1467577299}
review:
Okay so I finally decided to write a review on this game, keep in mind that I have about 8 hours of game-time but wasn't recorded due to me being offline.

I will make the review as short as possible since I was not impressed at all and was so frustrated.

[h1] The game [/h1]
Paranautical Activity is an FPS Rogue game that copies the style of binding of isaac, from the character voices, to the weapon description, the level progression and more, which I think is great but sadly they screwed up something so bad.

[h1]The Good [/h1]
Fast-paced action, nice controls, easy to understand weapons and items.
Nice enemies, good level progressions, replay-ability, a lot of secrets.

[h1]The bad[/h1]
There are some levels that just throws the game for me and sadly you have to go through some of them "random luck" to finish a run, they're the dark room levels, your vision is dead, the rooms are TOO DARK 
I get it they tried to add a horror factor and maybe copied the idea of the shadow curse of binding of isaac but they did it so bad, this is FPS you cant make it impossible to see the floor around me and the enemies thats so dumb.

So many times I had an op run I was killing bosses so easily, but then I encounter the dark levels and I die from normal enemies because I cant see them.

All you can do is keep on jumping and shooting around like a maniac hoping you might see the red glowy small light that some enemies have, but eventually die because its almost impossible to see them coming, this really REALLY threw the game for me, reached the point where its not even funny anymore I just barely finish those levels by jumping constantly, then next floor ? Same level ...

There are a lot of bugs in the game, I keep getting glitches every time I start a new run that brings up the menu and doesn't go away "I think they tried to force pause the game so you cant move while the level starts but screwed up" 

The music is REALLY good but even at my best headsets they do sound a bit ...static I guess ? or maybe thats how they meant to do them, I don't know.

The game could have so much more but it ruined all of that with the shadow levels it just threw the entire game out of concept, ruined my experience, made the game unbelievably frustrating and I just had to alt+f4 when I got 3 dark levels in a row.


[h1] Short version [/h1]
If you're ok with playing this game with the dark levels that will frustrate the hell out of you, get this game on the current 1.99$ price sales, dont get it full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047020580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1467056498}
review:
Avant toute chose je tiens √† dire que je ne me consid√®re pas du tout comme un expert du FPS. Au mieux, je suis un joueur moyen qui peut se vanter d'avoir fini les 2 premiers DOOM en mode Ultra-Violence et c'est tout.

Si vous avez ce niveau l√†...laissez tomber et ignorez ce jeu. Il va r√©ellement vous √©nerver.

Trop peu de points de vie compar√© aux menaces qui vous attendent. Car certains monstres n'h√©sitent pas √† vous spammer de coups. (les esp√®ces de diables qui vous mitraillent sans r√©pit ou les requins qui vous collent sans arr√™t)
Trop peu de coeurs apparaissent.
Trop peu d'armes sont r√©ellement efficaces.
Les bonus sont chers, et surtout, le jeu vous oblige √† m√©moriser par coeur ce qu'ils font car aucune explication ne vous est fournie tant que vous l'avez pas pris/achet√© (en plus c'est en anglais)
Et au final, il semblerait qu'il n'y ait plus de mises √† jour depuis longtemps.
(Ah, et aussi, mais √ßa regarde que moi, j'aime pas la musique)

Les bons points c'est le fait qu'il est un des rares jeux Unity dont la config des touches fonctionne, et que le concept est bien trouv√© et original. Mais c'est tellement dommage que la difficult√© soit si √©lev√©e, surtout dans les premiers niveaux... 

Si vous cherchez du challenge et que vous n'√™tes pas nerveux, prenez le jeu, √ßa vaut le coup. 

Mais si comme moi vous √™tes un joueur moyen qui s'√©n√®rve vite, √©vitez-le.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114106680', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1638662064}
review:
I got a real kick out of Paranautical Activity.  

You're moving around on a Nazi submarine blowing the shit out of the forces of hell.   Collect power ups and kill tons of bosses in a super fast paced FPS roguelike.  The music is fantastic, the lighting on dark levels is cool as shit, and is fun enough that any run you do can potentially turn into a game winning one.  I had never got to floor 6 before when suddenly, in one run, I managed to beat the final boss and just barely managed to kill her without taking damage.  Fun as hell, would reccommned.

Replay value:   9/10
Music:              8/10
Gameplay:       8/10
Graphics:         6/10

Overall:            8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197985267228', 'num_games_owned': 1457, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1466120556}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062118386', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1550004753}
review:
Got this on sale for under $2. So worth it even if it were $5.

The game is a random generated map every restart. First person shooter mixed with elements of dungeon crawlers where you earn gold to unlock upgrades. But nothing is kept between restarts. Only for as long as you can live.

Imagine Binding of Issac is it were good enough to be in 3D. Occulus makes it that much more intense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059819903', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1586804688}
review:
It's a game about going fast on a nazi ghost ship and killing the hell out of anything that happens to come across you. Powerups in this game are more along the lines of weapons, and store items. It's a very challenging game, with loads of replayability. Only issue is it's not optimised as well as it could be, but honestly it's a unity game so what do you expect.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987356506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1465255254}
review:
A very flat feeling experience due to the lack of sound effects and animation.
No theme or wrapper to the experience, just some odd creatures in rooms that feel very samey.
Gameplay that's basically "shoot at the thing that's jumping up and down" "shoot at the fish on the floor" and "don't get hit".
The dev might have played Doom and Spelunky, but they don't seem to understand what made either of them great. 
Oh yeah, and the soundtrack is horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990669366', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1466647661}
review:
As an Isaac player I was extremely unimpressed.  In Isaac there are a large variety of viable builds and items that you can use to get through the game.  That is not the case here.  There's 1, maybe 2 different combinations of upgrades that you can get that'll allow you to win, if you're unlucky and don't get them, you'll probably die.

The enemies are boring, the rooms are too large and confusing, there arent enough weapons or upgrades to keep gameplay interesting, and the game feel pretty clunky to play. 

Overall, had I not gotten this in a humble bundle, I'd be pretty upset with my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055454345', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1434693985}
review: Just play Isaac or Gungeon instead.  Don't waste your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119057120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1495184820}
review:
I kind of don't get this game.

From a technical point of view this is a quite fine game. This is a FPS game where every room and every level indeed is randomly generated. We have some patterns like a boss room or a shop room every level although everything else is mostly random.

It's really hard to give a thumbs down to this game as it is technically a good game. This is just my personal opinion.

Pros:
- it's quick
- four distinct character classes - different starting weapons, hit points value, speed and so on
- randomness - after every boss fight we get a random item that changes our stats
- nice graphics, looks like Minecraft on steroids

Cons:
- music is a dubstep mess - personally I don't like such kind of music although someone might find it amusing
- this game is really hard. Maybe not Dark Souls level of hard but still hard
- well character classes are distinct but only Tank starts with 9 hit points which relates to higher survival chance
- I don't see a point in playing this game - this is only imo

So in conclusion - we have a technically decent game that lacks some kind of main motive. Or guts or spirit, whatever we may call it. 

If you like randomly generated shooters then go for it, it's ok, it's hard as nails, it's quick as Quake 1 and so on. 

I personally cannot recommend this game as it lacks something vital. I can't really describe this value in one words but let's say it this way - this game lacks a value that makes a player want to play this game. 

---------- 
For anyone interested in joining in on completing your own backlog; check it out here - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog/discussions/5/530645446320364338/

author: {'steamid': '76561198210573256', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1496534848}
review:
Well, Its my first time playing a crawler FPS.
I liked a lot and reminds me of Doom and Unreal Tournament.

I like the simplistic graphics, and they seem the graphical options seem to be well adapted to everykind of computer, from trashy to ""high-end"".

The music is awful, but kind of gets you into the game I suppose.

The game is *really* hard to play, its meant for hardcore FPS players, 
it requires fast reflax and pretty much same skills as anyone who has ever played ( sucessfuly ) Doom.

I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086058695', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1427497025}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027096824', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 249, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1710864582}
review:
I don't see how so many people find this game boring lol. I agree with the ones that say its a mix of BOI and DOOM that its a captivating dungeon crawler/FPS that can really be fun once you get the hang of it, and for a while can feel like a fresh experience everytime you play it, because of all the interesting items and the even more interesting synergies that you can have with these items.

I seriously recommend if youre fans of RPGs, FPSes and/or dungeon crawlers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063466362', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1598107602}
review:
+Great OST.
+Well optimized. Even on an old PC, no worries.

-But not enough different soundtracks.
-Unbalanced : Some Boss can't be beat without some specific upgrades.
-Repetitive. Always the same rooms, the same monsters, the same upgrades....
-Only 4 loadouts to start.

To sum up, it's not a bad game, but it's boring and not worth 9e.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057473202', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1421801495}
review:
I think the idea of this game is awesome. A nautical themed FPS roguelike. The graphics are nice pixel style. The music is good, if not a bit obnoxious. It's just that the execution is terrible. Every room feels the same. None of the enemies or bosses are fun. The variety of weapons is bad. You just strafe and hope around and hope you win.

Go check out Ziggurat or Tower of Guns instead. Hell, even Heavy Bullets is miles ahead of this. Don't buy this unless it's on sale. Even then, don't buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964258610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1461449867}
review:
This game is special.

Original developer and publisher: Code Avarice
Current developer and publisher: Digerati Distribution

Initially the game was placed on Steam Greenlight on Aug 31, 2012
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=93241332&searchtext=

Then they had a successful Kickstarter campaign that collected $12,540 USD. (August 4, 2013 - September 3, 2013)
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1125357480/paranautical-activity-old-school-fps-meets-rogueli

There were issues with the greenlight campaign:
"Code Avarice already set up a placeholder Steam Greenlight page and Steam 'didn't want to send the message that indies can seek out publishers to bypass Steam Greenlight.'"
http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2013-06-04-first-person-roguelike-paranautical-activity-not-allowed-past-greenlight-even-with-a-publisher

But Officially, the title got Greenlit by 8/28/2013.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1125357480/paranautical-activity-old-school-fps-meets-rogueli/posts/582749

Subsequently, in October 2014 the developer threatened Gabe Newell's life over a Steam listing issue associated with the title. 
"harsh lesson Paranautical Activity developer Mike Maulbeck learned today when after a Steam snafu erroneously advertised his game as an Early Access title he crossed a line and tweeted a death threat to Gabe Newell. Following this outrage, the game was pulled from Valve's distribution service."
http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2014-10-21-valve-pulls-game-from-steam-following-devs-tweet-threatening-gabe-newell
http://gameranx.com/updates/id/17237/article/paranautical-activity-on-steam-early-access/

Needless to say, the developer didnt handle the situation and associated fallout well:
http://www.pcgamer.com/paranautical-activity-removed-from-steam-following-developer-outburst/

This caused the game to be removed from the Steam store, the offending dev to resign from the studio ("Code Avarice"), the "Paranautical Activity" IP to be sold to another company ("Digerati Distribution & Marketing"), followed by the offending dev rejoining his original studio.
http://www.polygon.com/2015/2/17/8053713/paranautical-activity-death-threat-gabe-newell-steam
http://www.pcgamer.com/paranautical-activity-returns-to-steam-with-deluxe-atonement-edition/

On the Early Access Steam store page, they claimed "We're planning to add multiplayer co-op in the very near future, as well as a ton more content, and of course some bug fixes and polish." https://web.archive.org/web/20140418040048*/http://store.steampowered.com/app/250580

They also claimed that:
"Paranautical Activity multiplayer is definitely a thing that is happening...We‚Äôve been really busy trying to get MP working...The multiplayer patch will be going live before the year anniversary of the game (february 14th)[2014]"
http://web.archive.org/web/20140407082949/http://codeavarice.com/post/71570505839/paranautical-activity-mulitplayer

Subsquently, the devs disclosed that they would not add a multiplayer mode.
"Sorry to those who purchased this game under the guise of the fact it will be multiplayer. We just couldn‚Äôt rebuild the entire game to make this happen, there is only two of us.‚Äù
http://www.pcgamesn.com/indie/paranautical-activity-developers-fight-community-over-cancelled-co-op-mode-insist-roguelike-fps-not-being-abandoned

Allegedly, the devs were asking for good reviews of the game and doing some "heavy moderating" ie. censoring of negative critique, on their forums.
https://www.reddit.com/r/Steam/comments/2jspdu/paranautical_activity_devs_begging_for_good/

The offending dev claimed he was "quitting the video game industry." 
However, he is already working on 2 new games:
"Arkshot and Timefight Zone" as of 4/2016.
https://twitter.com/SpooderW/status/524327596939440128
http://www.codeavarice.com/arkshot.html
http://www.codeavarice.com/timefight-zone.html

review:
Decent Roguelike, doomesque enemies +weapons. Annoying at times due to the main strategy of dealing with bosses being circlestrafe+jump. Pickups from boss rooms & item rooms in general serve to add minor changes to gameplay, mostly by increasing a stat or adding a gimic to your movement (wall flipping jumps, shorter, faster jumps etc.)

Pros.
Great Soundtrack
generated levels
Interesting Level Design
Creative Enemy Design
Good Art Style 
Secret levels and floor
Great Bosses

Cons.
Lack of Variety in Levels
Lack of Variety in Weapons

author: {'steamid': '76561198081082385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1463712764}
review:
Here's how a recent session went for me:
Spawned
Went to first room.
Jumped for the entirety of the rooms fight, and won.
Did this (^) for the entire floor and went to floor two.
Rinse and repeat until floor three.
Rinse and repeat until floor four.
Walk into first room of four floor with full health.
Did the same old same old.
Saw these jumpy ceiling monsters.
Stopped jumping, stopped moving.
Got raped by monsters.
Died.

10/10 would get raped by jumpy ceiling monsters again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013735252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1459393921}
review: Paranautical Activity: Deluxe Atonement Edition is a rogue-like FPS game that takes elements and gameplay from Doom and Quake and couples them with a game like Binding of Isaac, however quickly falls flat. The game is terribly punishing with your small health pool and terrible weapon selection. The controls and gameplay are designed so that the player has to run around and constantly kite enemies hoping their shots will land and hit the enemies. The controls and gameplay are clunky and all the rooms the player goes through seem so repetitive as they are all boxes with different props and obstacles thrown in.  There are items that you can purchase to upgrade but the game does nothing to tell you what does the item do. Most of the time you just purchase an item only to find out that it has negative effects! Also, the difficulty of the game seems odd, some enemies and bosses are really easy and on the other hand some are really difficult. I did about 10 runs, and they were all very similar just with different bosses and the 2nd level boss usually takes me down each time. Looking at the Steam Achievements looks like only ~15% of the players even made it past Level 2 which just shows you how punishing and difficult this game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024923878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1603886436}
review:
After playing this game for 2,5 hours, countless questions and bugs, I thought I give everyone my opinion about this game.
It
is
bad.

You pay 10 bucks for a full game, that gives you 0 motivation or exciting gameplay. While the beginning is boring and you often die to bosses, the end just slaps you in your face and makes you run around, shooting everywhere at the same time, hoping you hit enemies.

Countless bugs occur during this time, such as getting stuck in walls or having a constant 5 FPS when there is too much stuff on the screen. ( I run Black Ops 3 on ultra settings, so no, it is not my PC ).

After uninstalling the game and wasting over 2 hours on it, I cannot reccommend this game at all.
The gameplay is boring and repetitive, the Wiki unfinished, thus leaving you puzzled when picking up items and the balance is non existant.

Oh and the soundtrack will drive you insane after 1 hour.


Have fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198016658705', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1458350127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198147612184', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1512955939}
review:
Paranautical Activity Review

For me: 7/10 For others 3/10

Let's just be honest right off the bat: you might not like this game. It's not nearly as replayable as other roguelikes, maybe 20 hours at most. it's very repetetive, which is something I personally am okay with, but many people aren't. The power ups aren't interesting, the gameplay is pretty good, even if it's just strafing in a circle for every boss or room, dodging is annoying especially with homing shots. for homing shots, the only way to dodge it is cling against the wall so the bullet flies into the wall. There are some things in the game that make it very laggy, making me rush to kill the boss before it lags too hard ( talking about the snail boss ). it's not well optimized for sure. But it's fun to play in my opinion! Like, it's almost literally binding of Isaac in FPS form! If you are fine with all these cons, then this game should be plenty fun for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152899150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1455915982}
review:
I can see the logic behind the negative reviews. This game is not for everyone. It requires patience, reflexes and somewhat grinding for achievements - therefore the items. 

Now if you are not a fan of rogue-like, action genre, this game wouldn't be the best match for you. If you are, however and want to have some fun, this game suits your needs perfectly.

I will start with saying that the game is really hard. This doesn't make the game frustrating though. After you get the grasp of the mechanics and familiar with the items, it will be only a matter of time to finish the game. 

David Bowie (RIP) is a playable character in this game (Though I don't think he would appreciate the choice of soundtrack.). 

Gameplay is fast-paced. That means there will be times you won't even understand how you died or took massive amount of damage. So never rely on your health being full. You always need to be alert and keep your reflexes up because the ways to die in this game are just too many.

Like most of the rogue-like dungeon crawlers, RNG factor is significant. Game has six different characters with a huge item pool. There are many things that could make reaching the end a piece of cake. You can get the most OP items on the first floors, you can pray to RNG gods and get some ridiculous stats with the passive items,  you can find the boss room without too much wandering around the rooms and these thing also could make the runs really hard vica-versa.  

Simple, pixelated, yet colorful graphics makes the game charming and kind of fits the style of the game itself, in my opinion. 

Music is... well, it is dubstep. Depends on your approach to electro music. Although I don't like dubstep myself, it fits the fast-paced theme and makes you randomly jump and shoot to everyone and everywhere, because the groove is real. 


Gameplay: 8/10
Graphics 7/10
Music: 7/10
Replay value: 9/10

Overall: 7.5/10, a good game for dungeon crawler or dubstep fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074952403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1456973853}
review:
I cannot reccomend this game. I love first person shooters like Quake and Doom, and rougue likes such as Isaac a ton, so when I saw that this game was a mix of those with a cool art style, I eagerly purchased it. I regret not refunding it.
This game [i] isn't[/i] fun, and, my god, is it slow. Games like Doom or The Binding of Isaac are fast paced, with constant action mixed into the strategy of play they demand, but this game, is [b][i] not that.[/i][/b] Every room is a chore to get through, as it takes a few seconds to get into the action, which boasts a combat system with a [strike] wide variety[/strike] limited choice of weaponry that gives little diversity in game play. The combat itself is clunky and isn't satisfying to attack. Killing enemies is satisfying, but only in the sense that you'll be thinking "thank god I finished this room, I can only hope that the next isn't the same thing", and are slightly relieved to be done. Speaking of next rooms, they might as well all be the same. I feel as if I am not exploring or getting through an adventure, as I am doing nothing but repeating the same mundane gameplay of the last challenge. This game can be summed up in one word: [i][b] boring.[/b][/i]

Do not buy this game. Do not support it's jerk of a developer who wants to kill the guy who put his game up for sale. Do not encourage games like this to be made again. Do not waste your time or money. Buy The Binding of Isaac. Buy Doom. Buy Ziggurat. Buy Tower of Guns. Buy Devil Daggers. Buy almost any other game and you will have a better experience. Fuck this game.

[b] TL;DR[/b] Don't buy Paranautical Activity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129332113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1446794450}
review:
As of now, I find Paranautical Activity to be lack luster if anything. A rogue-like FPS could have been really intuative, yet the controls feel clumsy and the difficulty feels to brash.
It tries to play on an "Items to make it easier" system like Binding of Issac yet going room to room is unpredictable and ends up biting you in the ass. Sure Binding of Issac can screw you over if you explore but that's usually in later levels, Paranautical Activity does this on the first level!
As I said the controls feel clunky (At least it does on my 360 controller) and the game tries to be too fast paced for it's on good. Doom was great as a fast paced game, but yet Doom didn't have unpassable rooms because you didn't defeat all the monsters (not all the time at least from my memory.) There is a sprint button, yet it completely fucks with your aim. Doom also had a sprint command but in Doom you can't look up or down and your weapon "auto-locks) on the enemies you aim at. 
Over all Paranautical Activity is taking too much influence from other games too the point where it is completely miss using what concepts it's taking. Difficulty in a game is fine when presented in increments, but I haven't even made it past the first level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989240599', 'num_games_owned': 2058, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1459928042}
review:
Paranautical Activity is a dungeon crawler FPS with arcade elements, it shares trashy dubstep music and voxel graphic with Dead Bits, the level construction and power ups with The Binding of Isaac and the fast paced gameplay with DooM and Unreal.

Just like in The Binding of Isaac, this game plays on several different floors, each with rooms that have to be cleared before proceeding into the next room, each floor with two bosses, one of which is optional and rewards the player with an additional power-up.

The graphic is quite simplistic, yet is nicely colourful and blends well with the very arcadish sound effects and the not-deplorable dubstep soundtrack.
Regarding the soundtrack... I can't abstain from admitting that the quality isn't great: it's dubstep, raw, crude, pumping and absolutely "videogame-like". The final product is an OST that is hardly playable outside of the game, but if you let it run on background as you play, if you can bare with it for a while without getting an headache, it becomes a fantastic soundtrack that only makes you more and more eager to keep playing this apparently mediocre videogame.

Paranautical Activity isn't for everyone, it's an hardcore game that will surely faze any casual gamer in matter of minutes: this game is unforgiving, it requires fast reflexes, great aim and ability to adapt to the new. The dozens of power-ups and the repetitive yet different level design can offer a new experience each and every new playthrough; on top of this, the player can choose up to six different characters, each with its own stats (such as health, speed, power, etc.).

As final note, the customisation in terms of graphic and sound options is minimal, however, it is possible to modify the FoV (Field of View) from 30 to 150.
If you need ratings:

Graphic: 6/10
Sounds: 7/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Longevity: 8/10

Overall 7/10

Buy this game if you're an hardcore FPS player who enjoys dungeon crawlers and/or arcade games. Skip it if you don't have experience with FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019775185', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1680552732}
review:
I'm strongly conflicted on this game.

It can be great fun a lot of the time, but you will find yourself dying for stupid reasons more often than not... not once did I die and think that it was my fault, but instead usually down to some stupid item I picked up not knowing what it did and completely killed my run. For example;

The "Eye of Dubbbz" item. I got to stage 7 and picked this up. It made all of the rooms completely pitch-black (until the end of the game). I literally just quit. Why is that even in the game? That's a stupid idea for an item, especially when rooms become more cluttered with obstacles so you run into walls like the Kool-Aid man and die

+ Skill-based gameplay which is fun
+ Movement is spot-on 
+ Music is AMAZING (Produced by MACAskill) 
+ Weapons are fun for the most part and each have their different gimmick
+ Punny names for weapons and items which is cool

- Classes are basic and just have different health & armour, weapon, and speed.
- Nazi levels seem out of place
- Bad items that are there just to be bad and ruin your experience
- Gameplay isn't addicting like other rougelikes
- Exploding enemies can spawn in front of you as the enter the room

Paranautical Activity is mostly a game about movement, and I love how a lot of the items such as the Recoil Rifle allow for some top tier gameplay, To make the classes more unique I think each class should start with a specific movement item (Such as dash, double jump, small etc)

The aesthetic of this game is also confusing... it's like a nazi, pirate, demon shooter? What?

TLDR: It's a fun game, but I recommend you get this game on the cheapest sale and give the rest of the money to MACAskill (the music producer), as they shafted him out of payment and basically took his music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034127589', 'num_games_owned': 1103, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1443801671}
review:
This wasn't not as good as I thought it would be... but it's not THAT bad.

The game devs said that it was inspired on Doom and Quake, but I have not really seen that (some character design and/or gameplay maybe).

Also, the game is poorly optimized, and will drop from 80 to 20 FPS every now and then (my experience, with an AMD APU)

I really can't recommend this game: only if you can get it on a (good) offer or via T-r-e-m-o-r-G-a-m-e-s (as I did), or if you really love games like Binding of Isaac w/ dubstep music.

73/100, but I still won't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093345705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1445816746}
review:
The enemys for this game are usually pretty easy and often involve just simply moving left or backwards to get away from most of their attacks but there are other enemys like the skull and the moth that you need to look out for and the skulls are pretty easy too but if you have low speed (and you often will) they can sneak up on you and deal massive damage. The moths are what you need to look out for because there shots home in on you and these shots WILL hit you and the WILL lower your health to zero eventually if you don't concentrate on dodging there shots these two enemys aren't that bad but they're the only really difficult enemys in this game.

Bosses are strange some bosses are easy and basically the only way to get hit by the easy ones is if you stop circle strafing around them.

The only bosses you need to look out for are the ones with homing shots because they fire a lot and if you aren‚Äôt glued to a wall and moving fast your dead for sure. The other hard bosses are the ones that melee you because those ones fly right at you and deal damage and if you aren't moving fast and jumping constantly your dead for sure. However if they aren't FLYING towards you and are just something like a skeleton or something they aren't a problem at all.

So bosses and enemys are alright just might need to change a few of their attacks to make the easy ones harder (recommended change) or the hard ones easier (not recommended change)  to stop making the easy boss fights feel like a circle strafing chore.  

Now lets look at the bad part. The items often horribly unbalanced and some items being flat out jokes that do almost nothing is AWFUL.

There is one item in this game called Doxxy that will put me off this game until it gets removed completely. The item changes the sound that you hear when you get hit. That‚Äôs. It. You went through an entire blue skull room boss fight where it was that moth with homing shots and you barely made it out alive? Well here‚Äôs this completely useless item! You saved up all your money to buy an item in the shop? Well this item is free! It's also useless and takes up 1 of 3 slots in the shop! You only get to items in the shop this time! Should have gotten lucky and had a random dice power up drop so you can reroll this item. 

There are so many items that just plain suck. The one that flips gravity when you jump (makes the billion jump upgrades useless cuz you can't really jump anymore)
Doxxy 
The one that permanently lowers your speed for a couple of very temporary armor pieces (speed is essential if you aren't going fast then you WILL easily get your health gradually lowered to zero by moths and stuff. See above where I mention that speed is important to fight the bosses and enemys.).  
Rage which is a damage up when you kill enemys! What could be wrong with that? Well, it's also a damage down. It is many damage downs. Every 10 seconds or so it lowers your damage by 0.083~ I think and when you kill enemys it increases damage by the same amount lowered so if you aren‚Äôt constantly instakilling enemys then you are losing damage. You can't insta kill with this item because its lowering your damage. 

Not to mention the item pickup tip for rage simply says "Damage up for killing enemys" and doesn't mention this damage down I'm glad I looked at the pdf file supplied that explains items. If I hadn't done that I would think this item was good!

Same with Fool, an item of which simply says "doubles damage" on pickup and doesn't mention that enemys deal double damage too! I could imagine myself spending hours ingame with the fool item dying quickly and not realizing it was fool's fault. (Fool is a good item because of an item called kamikaze which turns those normally useless bombs your carrying into armor and deals damage to enemy that melee you. The downside to kamikaze is that it completely removes your health so if you don't have any bombs and you get hit you die. The whole idea behind kamikaze is that if you now spend health to shoot bombs but bombs require so many upgrades that you wouldn't be shooting them even if you didn't have kamikaze. 

I would often find myself getting kamikaze and running around with 40 bombs that I wont use because I have 40 health and it would take so long to get me to zero that the final boss is a cakewalk. I could even take fool to insta kill everyone and it would STILL take a long time to die. bombs are more plentiful then hearts as you can blow up explosive barrels get a 3 hp up at almost any time. 

The other way of getting health is to take some health upgrades. The two I found were this one that doubles your health but lowers your speed. Because your speed is lower you are going to get hit easier and speed ups are so rare that this is never worth taking. The other just gives you two health and some armor which helps but both of these are nothing compared to kamikaze.  

I would say that kamikaze=win and if you don't get it you will have so many awful items thrown at your way that it's basically restart for kamikaze.

I can name a lot more if I look at which item does in the little pdf file that says what every item does but that would be boring to see me explain why almost every item you find is bad. 

So a few items are good and the majority are bad.


The point of item systems in roguelikes are that these items change gameplay and keep it interesting and a lot of these items have potential but are so imbalanced that they aren't worth taking and it turns the game into a restart early to get good items fest which is bad because this means that all your runs are the same because your taking the same items every time. This run is the same every time feeling is magnified by the low number of rooms the made for each floor. The number of rooms they made are so low that I found myself memorizing enemy spawn locations in only a few hours of playing.

Because of the sheer amount of bad items in this game the devs have a lot of stuff to fix. I heard that they are spending most of there time right now adding net co-op but I'd say if you wan't to fix this game then ditch the co-op idea for now and spend all your time on balancing these items and removing doxxy. 

I got this game on sale for 3 dollars and it's so bad because of the item system. I don't think this game is even worth 3 dollars as pressing the restart button over and over again isnt fun. If I wanted to press the same button over and over again I would just play cookie clicker.

TL;DR \/\/\/\/\/

Pros
+FOV slider goes from 30 to way to high
+music is nice

Cons
-enemys are easy except for one or 2
-bosses are either easy or really hard and there's only 2 or 3 hard bosses. 
-The items are so bad that it encourages restarting 
-music is nice but it isn't tied to floors or rooms or anything it's litterally like they just took some youtube playlist and put it in the game. There is no boss fight music
-I met the system requirements but expereinced harsh lag on lowest graphics because when you kill things the fall into a million cubes some times on later levels these squares become so plentiful that it becomes unbearable
-game sounds are underwhelming. I looked at the credits and it had links to sites like freesounds which makes me feel like they just searched a shotgun sound . mp3 in google  and downloaded the first thing they saw
-item pickup tips are helpful sometimes but other times don't mention a that an item has a secret bad effect. This encorages reading the pdf guide that comes with the game which means playing this game blind is a bad Idea
-speed is essential for dodging and so many items lower this stat that most of the items become useless the game does have good movement but this good movement is gone if you take too many speed down items 

Yes, the only good thing about this game is the fov slider and maybe one or two of the enemys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003690319', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1442772883}
review:
Disregarding the controversy with the original dev: Is this a good game?

Yes, one of the first to explore the Roguelite FPS this game still stands up to other games in this sub genre. 

I had to fiddle with the FOV till I found something comfortable but once that was sorted out I was having a blast.. Sucking terribly but still. Pretty fun. For me the real selling point is the soundtrack, nothing beats rocking out and blasting something to bits.

Definitely worth picking up on sale. 

https://youtu.be/rOF23ouNhe8

author: {'steamid': '76561198050374170', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1523552419}
review:
Ok, I got this for free on Tremor Coins, and when I got it I said to myself "Oh goddamnit I wasted some precious Tremor Coins for this Dipshit? Well It has trading cards so I can sell them on the Market."
You already know the "OMG I REGRET SAYING DIS XDDD" clich√®.
So it's an Arena First Person Shooter heavily inspir by the Binding of Isaac.
Random Items 
Random Doors
Random Enemies and Bosses
Random Weapons
[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Fast Paced Gameplay from the good ol' Arena Shooters (Serious Sam, Quake, Unreal Tournament)
[*]Smooth Controls
[*]TONS OF CONTENT
[*]Replayable to near infinite
[/list]
[h1]CONS[/h1]
[list]
[*]The difficulty is insane even in the first floors
[*]Somenglitches ruined the gameplay :being stuck inside a boss is not good :\
[*]The Minecraft style graphics pissed me off 
[/list]
[h1]Final Score: 7.5/10[/h1]
Buy it on sale and you will not regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960478145', 'num_games_owned': 2349, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1428858308}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124023743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1430956675}
review: As someone who has spent most of his life playing DOOM and listening to Drum & Bass in the background, I can say that this game is just what the doctor ordered. It's a room-by-room, fast paced FPS with kind of silly looking voxel graphics, but I think it hits the dark atmosphere just right for a run and gun first person experience. The weapons are a bit tough to get into the swing of, but all-in-all I find this game rather addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042225625', 'num_games_owned': 6555, 'num_reviews': 448, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1440483135}
review:
With it's lightweight physics, toy guns, high motion speed (stop = die), claustrophobically obstructed random rooms, grotesque looking oversized enemies and general lack of sense it didn't appeal to me much.. It's brutally hard and you need to study all the enemies' patterns to achieve victory. Withal i'm not a fan of classical Doom, nor a rogue-lite fanatic, for those it might be ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094286575', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1516639748}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035896324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1485345267}
review:
If this was the pre-death-threats-to-GabeN version of this game, I would tell you to buy it immmidately, but that is no longer the case. The game at some point had an update that added two things that ruined the game for me: Slipery movement, and cringe-worty in-game achievements. 

By slipery movement, I mean that when you let go of the movement key, you keep moving about a foot untill you stop. 1 Foot may not seem like much, but being that platforms and catwalks are only about 6-feet accross in this game, it ain't a pleasant feature. Couple that with one third of the framerate of Minecraft (I can run MC at 60, this game at 25, dropping down into single digits) and you have a very rage-inducing combo.

Cringe-worth eh? Padded: Tampon picture, Heh Heh Heh: 69, ParaNUT, stupid pun, you get the idea. Now that I look at it, I'm nitpicking at the names, but answer me this: Why did the game need achievements in the first place? Is such a short (Per playthrough) game not interesting enough without them?

IMO; Get one of these instead, they both are far better games: http://store.steampowered.com/app/266110/

AND/OR

http://store.steampowered.com/app/211260/

author: {'steamid': '76561198020213340', 'num_games_owned': 1522, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1438704514}
review:
tl;dr: It's a bad game and it's not worth the price, buy Ziggurat instead.

This game is a FPS with fast paced combat and randomly generated maps.
The best way to describe the gameplay would be taking the the movement and gunplay from Quake and putting it in The Binding of Isaac, where you walk through randomly generated mazes constituted by many small arenas linked together.
It's a great idea but unfortunately this game sucks.

Even though the game is randomly generated it gets old really quickly since there isn't that many enemies or rooms. The lack of variety is evident ever since your first playthrough.

Most of the weapons in the game feel rather powerless or too slow. Even when they're actually effective, like the demoman's grenade launcher, they still feel unsatisfying and awkward due to the lack of sound effects and impact. In my opinion this is a huge problem since most of the fun you could have with the game simply vanishes.

There's not much to be said about the graphics and the sound either. It's pretty much what you see on the trailer, except not nearly as exciting.

I also get a terrible headache everytime I spend more than 15 minutes playing it. That doesn't happen when I'm playing Quake or Ziggurat. Go figure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971154053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1455741918}
review:
An FPS roguelike that takes a lot of inspiration from Binding of Isaac. There is far less depth in terms of item synergy, item creativity, and strategy, but this is a fun game. The level design is good, the graphical style is simple and effective, and monsters all have distinctive designs and attack patterns. Most importantly though, firing weapons in this game just feels really damn good.

In conclusion: If you ever wanted to see The Binding of Isaac done as an FPS, this is the closest you can get as far as I know.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984723321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1437739066}
review:
Muy buen juego, para mi gusto esta bien pero un entorno que aveces puede marear debido a la velocidad de movimiento y los colores tan llamativos, por lo demas esta bien:

Pros:

- Graficos decentes y esta chulo el haberlo echo en plan cubos.
- Buena banda sonora.
- Buena eleccion de hacerlo en habitaciones para ir subiendo niveles.
- Puedes comprar mejoras en algunas habitaciones.
- Si te tomas tu tiempo es un juego bastante largo y entretenido.
- Tienes diferentes tipos de arma y diferentes modos a eleccion.

Contra:

- Al ser todo cubos,moverse rapido y tan colorido en ocasiones marea un poco.
- Se echa de menos el que puedas elegir tu arma primaria y secundaria, no un pack como viene.
- No puedes hacer tu personaje.
- Depende el arma que elijas te dice as estadisticas y muchas te resta vida al personaje por cogerlas.
- Solo es accion rapida, no tiene para ir poco a poco.

Definitivamente es un juego para comprar  pero de oferta, por 3‚Ç¨ o asi mereceria la pena pero el pagar mas... lo veo que no lo vale

author: {'steamid': '76561197989199444', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1423810409}
review:
Steam description : "Paranautical Activity combines the classic FPS action of games like Doom and Quake, with the randomness and difficulty of modern roguelikes like Binding of Isaac and Spelunky."

Now where is the Doom part and the Quake part because I didn't see any! The game plays more like a slow paced modern shooter than a fast paced old-school shooter. The shooting feels bland. The randomized rooms feel repetitive. Also, strafing and jumping feel kinda clunky. Just on par with other crappy so called "old-school" indie FPS such as Rogue Shooter and Wrack.

Aside from that, there is at least one thing Paranautical Activity is good at : heating my graphic card like crazy...

If you're in need of some modern FPS with an old-school feeling made by indie developpers give a chance to one of these games :

-Hard Reset (2011)
-Serious Sam BFE (2011)
-Shadow Warrior (2013)
-Eldritch (2013)
-Tower of Guns (2014)
-Ziggurat (2014)

Gabe Newworld did a great job for getting rid of this atrocity from the Steam store. Too bad it came back to haunt the living as a "Deluxe Edition" because I am now experiencing "paranormal activity", not Paranautical Activity...

Rating :
2.0

[h1]My Score:[/h1]

review: Le jeu pr√©sente une interface moche, des graphiques pixel dans les tons noirs bleut√©s pas superbes, une musique aga√ßante √† la longue, pas de tutoriel, pas d'explications sur les objets qu'on ach√®te ni sur les power ups, l'utilisation des armes peut sembler √©trange...Bref ce jeu fait tout pour rebuter le joueur surtout que l'ignorance se paie cher d√©s le premier niveau et ce pendant plusieurs parties. Je comprends largement les joueurs qui ont abandonn√© et se sont tourner vers d'autres rogue-like plus "accueillant". Mais est-ce par masochisme ou go√ªt pour l'auto-flagellation mais on se surprend √† faire une autre partie puis une autre...Je ne peux donc que mettre une √©valuation positive √† ce jeu pour ce c√¥t√© addictif incompr√©hensible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041781010', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1484224800}
review:
[h1]Little introducion to the game and their developers:[/h1]

Very good idea and very fun game but sadly "ditched" from its developer due a discussion with Valve's CEO (Yes, Papa Gabe). After that discussion caused by Valve labeling the game as "Released" instead "Early-Access", the game got removed from steam and re-added 4 months after under "Digerati marketing" , a distribution company. But sadly since then (feb '15, and to be precise the last update it's dated Oct '14) the game hasn't been updated once.

[b]So, before further talking let's go on with the recension.[/b]

[h1]Appearance:[/h1]

[b]Graphics:[/b] 2/5
Menu appearance it's not one of the best. Also in-game huds are way too "simple" in their appearance despite their "Cubic 32-bit" style. A graphical enhancement would be really appreciated.

[b]Sounds:[/b] 3/5
Not so much to say about sounds, the music it's really nice but sorta repetitive during the whole floor, maybe add a boss and mini-boss music?

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]

[b]Classes:[/b] 4/5
Paranautical Activity grants the player a bunch of playable classes that can get unlocked by completing achievements and each one of them it's really different in their weapon and stats.

[b]Movements:[/b] 5/5
The character it's really easy to control thanks also to items pickup that grants you the ability to double-jump etc.. Watch out for snowy levels and falling platforms! ;)

[b]Longevity:[/b] 3/5
Not so much to say here neither, the game it's really fun but after a while playing it becomes slightly repetitive.

[b]Bugs:[/b] 2/5
As already said in the introduction the was supposed to be an Early-Access instead of a release, it has a lot of bugs and glitch like Monsters getting stuck under staircases, double doors, glitch with powerups etc... But despite that i won't give a lot of weight to this voice because the game it was and still is a beta. 

[b]OVERALL: 3/5[/b]

Would I recommend this game? Yes. Would I recommend it for 9‚Ç¨? No.
It's a really fun game but developers ditched it by not updating it anymore, It's a really nice mixture of Fps and Roguelike and definitely fun to play if you enjoy both genres. But still.. in its conditions it's not really worthed 9‚Ç¨ if you want to get it, i suggest you to wait until it'll be in sale.

[i]~Matt[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198004535810', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1434924635}
review:
Its a decent game which is an alright investment of ten bucks. Mostly a time waster though. Some of the weapon effects are cool though, for example, the item "han's chainsaw" which causes a large chainsaw blade to erupt from the floor when one of your bombs explode.

A few complaints I have though are:
-I wish it was a bit faster. It feels like I should be faster.
-occasionally, youll get hit and it isnt really clear that its happened.
-obvious disparity between items, leading to a point when you actively avoid certain items because grabbing them will completely screw the run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088002207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1434400879}
review:
[h1]Brief review[/h1]
A first-person rogue-like voxel indie game. I have [b]NEVER[/b] seen anything like it! Overall, it is amazing. There's not much to say about it.
[h1]Rating[/h1]
8/10
Personally, I chose 8/10 because I'm not that much into rogue-like type games. Even though I know the game in general is worth a try.
[h1]Pros[/h1]
In-game achievments showcased over your HUD
Voxel-based graphics style that will drop your jaw in Oculus VR
[h1]Cons[/h1]
A lot of weapons
A lot of enemies
Difficult
Rage-inducing

author: {'steamid': '76561198052831583', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1433905404}
review:
Pros:
- Decent music
- Decent enemy variety
- Items and other stuff to find through out the dungeons
- OK boss fights

Cons:
- All of the weapons suck, usually difficult to aim or use, lack impact and are never multi-purpose. Trying to use any of the 4 main weapons to fight most of the enemies is a real challenge. 
- Classes are pretty useless. They all seem to be extremes with only 1 balanced class. Other classes include, guy with 1 hp, guy who moves slower than a rock, guy with ultra useless weapon.
- Extremely repetitive locations. Every room is the same as the last and it's the same shade of blue most of the game. 
- Floaty controls, the movement just feels wrong. View bobbing is annoying too.
- Colliding with oddly placed staircases and other pointless structures.

Overall:
I don't recommend this game. Each play session is so damn short it's ridiculous. No matter how many times i try and with any of the classes, I rarely make it to the 3rd floor. Often getting hit by things I can't even see or are unable to dodge with the slower classes. It lacks content, isn't very fun and gets very repetitive very quickly. Unless you like shooting the same enemies in the same rooms with the same 4 textures using awful weapons, stay away from this game. There are many better shooters out there. The roguelike elements aren't used in any interesting way here either. Just another excuse to stretch out a game's length when it otherwise lacks content and substance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982074343', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1432263352}
review:
This is a game with a lot of struggles. It was originally denied access to Greenlight, then it was allowed and greenlit and released, then it was pulled from Steam and then it was put back on Steam. I originally got the game at launch. But let's put that aside and talk about what the game IS and not its troubled release history.

Paranautical Activity is a first person roguelike. From a gameplay perspective it borrows a lot from The Binding of Isaac, notably the room grid approach where the player needs to defeat all enemies in a room to progress instead of moving freely in a continuous level like in other roguelikes. And like Binding of Isaac, each floor has a boss at the end as well as optional minibosses. The first first person perspective alone and the three-dimensional design of rooms makes the game very action oriented and keeps you on your toes. There are also multiple "characters" to choose from, each with radically different weapons, so there is variety in gameplay. The presentation of the game is pretty neat, making use of voxels to render everything. And I can honestly say I had a lot of fun playing this game. If you want a very action oriented roguelike with FPS control, then I say give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046080406', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1470746392}
review:
So I'm on a mac, and I buy this game, and I open the game, play 5 minutes and then I get an achievement and the game dies. I open it up again and it goes to the loading screen and freezes, I've tried many thing to fix this. So I don't know other peoples experiences with this game but in my opinion, if it freezes and can't open from me getting an achievement this game sucks. Thanks Paranautical Activity.


EDIT: Although what I said here is true, I'd like you to ignore it. I was able to fix the problem with not opening. It still for some reason on macs it seems, freezes whenever you get an unlock in game or a steam achievement. I'm not sure how to fix it. I find that the game that you can actually play itself is really fun and interesting and amazing. But I keep crashing so until I either 100% it's gonna keep doing this. If you're not on a mac like me I recommend this. If you are on a mac. If you're able to fix this problem. Well better for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000824354', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1431179528}
review:
A bumping soundtrack and fast paced, hard hitting weapons with cool particle effects, a selection of weird bosses and a handful of surreal supernatural atmosphere all come together and make Paranautical Activity a make a great fast paced FPS Dungeon Crawler with roguelike elements that I still have fun blasting out a quick game or two in here and there.

Paranautical Activity began to pick up traction within the Steam community, but then went off the rails after one of the two developers went on a childish twitter rampage against Steam and had [url= http://www.vg247.com/2014/10/21/steam-gabe-newell-death-threat-paranautical-activity/]the game pulled after a comment about killing Gabe Newell[/url]/
Much like Fez, despite all the nonsense and bad publicity because of a developer, Paranautical Activity is still a pretty unique, adrenalin pumping fast blast of a game.

[h1]Highlights[/h1]

* Excellent timing/pace and very quick off the mark
* Unique enemies and design
* One helluva Soundtrack

[h1]Mistakes[/h1]

* There's a sentiment from Steam gamers to avoid this title because of the twitter comments and attitude of the former developer. While I personally think the former developer was a childish idiot, I separate my choice to purchase a product from any attitude or conceptions I have on people involved with the creation of a product. For some people the attitudes of people working for a company go hand in hand with their choice to purchase products from that company, and may take issue. However the the developers are no longer involved and the title has [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/250580/discussions/0/611698195153627563/]now near-completely changed hands[/url].
* There are noticably too few enemies, and arguably a lack of weapons, which means gameplay becomes repetitive after long stretches.

[h1]Recommendations[/h1]

Available on Steam for ¬£6.99/8.99‚Ç¨/$9.99 at the time of review, which feels very fair. It's very replayable and I often find myself coming back to run through a quick few floors. It's often available cheaper via various Indie Bundles, so search around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054140240', 'num_games_owned': 1361, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1431400469}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052049395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1443617239}
review:
The game contains tons of references to nazism and satanism(and also bright flashing colors for epileptic people) and there is not a single warning or censor option ?
Now i understand why one of the developers said things he wasn't supposed to say to Gabe Newell on his Twitter(and same for the controversy the game had).

At the exception of that, Paranautical Activity is basically your average rogue-like FPS that just get the job done but lacks of general game feedback(that was really too hard to make the screen shake when the player take damage ? but no, it only shakes when it's too late and you can try again, also the weapons have literally no feeling and it simply destroy 80% of the fun you could get).

author: {'steamid': '76561197977069906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1423281063}

author: {'steamid': '76561198158075287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1443834475}
review: I wish there was a "yes.....but" option, because I don't think this game is for everyone. If you like the type of games like Binding of Issac, nethack, other rougelikes, this will feel right at home for you. If you enjoy FPS's, go play any other game. Really, it is basically a first person version of Binding of Issac, which is bad/good (good imo), depending on your opinion. If you only like games like Skyrim that have you playing for thousands of hours at a time, skip this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039395140', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1413866384}
review: Not a lot to say here.  The game is out of the hands of the malicious dev and the drama has shifted a bit.  I am glad to have seen an update, maybe more will come in the future.  By principal alone I can't turn my thumb up, at least not until its had some time to cook properly.  If you already own it, it can be fun for a 15-30 minute romp now and again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009304313', 'num_games_owned': 6949, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1414972667}
review: Paranautical Activity was obviously intended to be some mixture of a 3D Binding of Isaac clone with Painkiller, and for the most part it succeeds in that. Player movement is fast and fluid, there's an interesting variety of weapons, and it offers a nice challenge and degree of skill-based gameplay. It lacks enough enemy and room randomization to have huge staying power as a roguelike, but what content there is definitely justifies the sale or bundle price if you're into the roguelike FPS subgenre. It's not as good as Ziggurat but better than heavy bullets. Voxel graphics look decent, soundtrack is pretty crappy but easy to ignore or mute, I haven't encountered any major bugs, overall I'm pretty pleased with it. Paranautical Activity may not be a great indie game, but it's a solid one, and for the reasonable price of admission I think that's enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977703126', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1430675100}
review:
-Poor mouse handling
-Movement acceleration (aka you have to get up to speed, something typical in more realistic games... and yet you can move faster by jumping/pressing two directions at once????)
-No sound except except your attack sound
-Terrible dubstep soundtrack
-Minecraft artstyle
-Every room is just a square with randomly placed stairs and walls

On top of that all the enemies are pretty tedious to fight since there are a ton of suppression type ones that just fire until you move out of sight, or home in and track to you, or just explode in your face... You don't get a lot of health either, so just taking a hit is never an option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146889213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1569170701}
review: Secondo me √® un ottimo gioco e sapete cosa mi ricorda? The Binding of Isaac solo in prima persona! Questi due elementi combinati creano un gioco impossibile, il mio record √® il sesto piano, su otto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117357275', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1466859657}
review:
- Very poorly optimized
- Some rooms are exact duplicates of another, monsters and their starting locations included.
- Seemingly no goal, just go from room to room killing monsters.
- Little challenge. The monsters aim with the fireball things is poorly designed. It seems like they just shoot in the direction you are at the moment they fire it. It is easy to avoid being hit by walking in a circle around the room and shooting the enemies while doing so.
- Poor options design. The only way to change screen resolution or graphics quality is by closing the game and changing the settings in the launcher which opens when you start the game. You cannot view/edit the controls in-game (You must change or view them in the launcher).
- Non-standard weapon switching buttons or [Use] key, so you should look at the controls before you play.
- Poor special effects.
- Colours are dark and dull. It seems like very few different colours were used.

I would not advise buying this game at all. I can not comment on a reasonable price as this seems like it is incomplete for a modern game. I feel like I have experienced everything this game has to offer in the 12 minutes I have actually played as it is fast paced (Which is one of the only good things about this game) and had forced myself to continue playing it past the 6th minute in order to be able to feel like this review was justified, in those extra 6 minutes my opinion of the game only worsened.

I got this in an Indie Gala bundle, this not being the reason I had bought the bundle so the price of this was not being taken into consideration for the review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987910606', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1430596943}
review: Practicly unplayable.  Tries to use it's stupidly high difficulty to cover up it's poor design, bad art, ugly UI and uninteresting gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055668110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1430520535}
review:
I'm having a hard time liking this game to be honest, but I'll try to give it the benefit of the doubt.  

Despite that notion from myself (Mostly because I paid for the darn thing), I still don't recommend this game.  

><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><

Pros:  
> interesting graphics

Cons:
> None of the classes seem very significant and are all hard to control
> There's no storyline
> It's hard as balls to get play
> There are other reasons, but other reviewers seem to have covered them pretty damn well

><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><

I admit that I haven't played all that much of the game, but from what I COULD all I discovered that it is immensly easy to die and is almost insanely hard to get even a single power up.  Also most of the "Abilities" you can get have no explanation and don't seem to affect anything upon use.  There's not even a stat menu to see if any of the power ups have changed them.  

And did I mention how easy it is to die?  Most of the beginning weapons barely have any effect on the enemies sometimes and it's almost like you lose health way too fast in some encounters.  You can survive for a much longer time in the Binding of Isaac compared to this game.  Not only that, but everytime you die it doesn't even feel like you've accomplished anything.  I know the point of a Rogue-Like is that you only have one life to do everything, but this game takes that aspect way too seriously that it feels pointless to even try.  

As for the storyline... well... WHAT STORYLINE?  

I don't know who I am, where I'm going, or what I'm even doing this for.  There's really no point in doing whatever "Mission" I'm trying to do if there's no real goal in mind.  I'd say to get this game if it had a great storyline despite the weird and often annoying gameply, but since it doesn't even have THAT then I don't recommend that anyone really get this.  

The only redeeming feature are the graphics, and while I admire that, it takes a bit more than fancy creatures and pixel guns to make a game work.

3/10 Would only play again since I paid for it
