author: {'steamid': '76561198001482341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1430108156}
review:
Oh boy this game. Originally taken down due to shitty  devs, and reuploaded for god knows what reason. I purchased this game when there was a rouge-like sale going on, and even though it was only about $2.50, I regret it. Now, before I go one, I have to preface this by saying that I played the Tank 99% of the time. I greatly enjoy heavy characters, and From the stats I thought I would enjoy playing as him the most. I did, as the others were shit. However, whenever the Tank fires his shotgun, theres a full second of the game registering the damage or if it hit or whatever, where the game entirely freezes up. This mostly happens on larger enemies, but it makes the game utterly unplayable due to it. You stop, and the game doesnt. Id be fine with this if it was purposefully implemented, but its clearly not as when you attack smaller enemies or hit with fewer pellets, the game doesnt freeze. The cannon on the other hand is completely worthless even without a glitch, not that it doesnt have one. When firing the cannon, sometimes there will be a visible projectile but sometimes there wont be a charge up time OR a projectile, just immediately dealing damage to whatevers in front of you. It makes the gun entirely unpredictable, which is not a good thing in a game about avoiding death. Bomb's usefulness varies from very good against slower enemies, to absolutely worthless on bosses and slightly faster enemies. A major MAJOR problem in the game, however, is the fact that not every class can beat every boss. While playing as the slow Tank, I encountered a snail-like boss that immediately curled up and unrelentingly rolled at me, much faster than I could move out of its path while it immediately snaps to wherever I run, making the entire fight a DPS race which is NOT A GOOD THING. It might be that I just didnt figure out some secret strategy of beating it, but that's a moot point. There is no point in making a game unplayable just for the sake of difficulty. 
There's some good things about the game, for as much as Im harshing on it: The concept of an FPS Roguelike is a very fun one that has tons of potential, of which they use none. The graphics are very adorable, giving even what are supposed to be hideous monsters a very huggable and blocky appearance. It is an overused artstyle, but I have a weakness for it and enjoy when it is used.
Also the music is fucking terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966548041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1429562386}
review:
I wanted to love this game.  I wanted to so badly.

Roguelike?  FPS?  Cool voxel graphics and that 'simplistic but awesome' lighting system reminiscent of games like Quake?  Multiple classes to choose from?  It's just too good to be true, it seems... and sadly, that's the case.

It COULD have been good, could have easily been fixed and polished and balanced just a bit to create a fantastic experience, but in all the months and months I've had this game in its early access phase and even now after this 're-release', it's failed to address any of these issues.  In fact, all it seemingly HAS done is added a couple new enemies, achievements, and made shop prices even more impossibly high.  Great.

The main issue is that it's simply too difficult.  No, NOT "haha hardcore fun!" difficult like your Dark Souls or Binding of Isaacs out there, but cheap, excruciatingly painful and unforgivably frustratingly difficult.  From the beginning of the game most rooms are PACKED with unreasonable amounts of every variety of monster and there is little strategy beyond  moving around wildly and hoping dearly that you don't lose too much health (which is generally far too difficult to come by, besides) as you struggle to fight back.

If you're not lucky enough to be wildly powerful by the 3rd or 4th floors you're likely screwed, and by the 5th floor?  Forget about it.  I've never, ever been able to pass the 5th floor of this game in the tons of times I've attempted it, no matter how perfect my drops were, and this is coming from a guy who Platinum God'd the original Binding of Isaac and did all but the Lost achivements in the Rebirth version of that game.  I know FPS skills =/= overhead shooter skills, but I'd like to think my FPS ability is at least decent considering how many thousands of hours I've put into that genre over the last 15+ years and it proves I know how to weigh options, gauge danger, memorize enemy patterns and tackle various situations in action-roguelikes as a whole.. but no, I've never gotten past floor 5.  And I've only gotten TO it like three times ever, for that matter.

The problem is, by the time you get there, so many enemies are... well, they are very fast, charge you, and deal damage so fast that there is NOTHING you can do about it.  No matter how fast you kill, they're coming from all angles, many types, and with traps on top of that.  And if they get to you, one of these melee enemies, from the sharks near the beginning of the game to the skulls and imps later to the chainsaw boss that you're almost certainly screwed if you ever fight?  The damage is so rapid that it's going to be all over, no matter HOW much health you have.  The game sorely needs a 1-2 second invulnerability period between taking damage, especially with how low the health values are, how much damage you'll invariably take simply exploring the dungeons, and how few and far between health restoratives are.  But no, once you're in the jaws of one of these melee enemies it's ALL gone nearly instantly, even if you're a tank with 15+ health and 10+ shield which should be an incredibly beefy amount -- it'll all be gone in about 5 seconds and you most likely won't be able to kill them in time to escape it even with tons of damage boosting passives.

And did I mention they (aside from the sharks) are FAST?  Like, so fast that you won't be able to outrun them without loads of speed passives.  And did I mention that these passives only drop from bosses and shops, most the boss passives are jokes and you won't be able to afford 90% of the good shop passives by the time you get that deep even if you clear out every single room in every level up till then?  And that you'll DOUBTLESSLY have to buy some of the lesser passives as you just barely scrounge up the money to do so if you even want a vague hope of REACHING that floor to begin with?  Yeah.

So there you have it.  An exercise in frustration in which you're going to be suffering through gauntlets of way too many enemies per room in such placements and combination that it's virtually impossible to avoid damage no matter how good you are, difficulty restoring the damage you took, and the knowledge that it's quickly going to become too overwhelming to even have any hope of moving forward no matter how good you are or how good the items you find are.  And no, it's not something you're going to learn and get better at despite the excrutiating difficulty like a GOOD action-roguelike; you're just going to suffer.  Period.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970406584', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1427381781}
review:
This game fails on pretty much every level.

Firstly, the concept: It's basically a bullet-hell game in-first person, giving you an incredibly poor idea of where you are in relation to all the projectiles that are incoming from every angle and making it distressingly common that you sidestrafe into an obstacle, get stuck and eat a face full of projectile salvo.

Secondly, the graphical/UI design: Pretty much everything that isn't a projectile is the same colour of shadowy gray-ish mess, meaning that about the only way to spot enemies is their glowing eyes(when they have them), which are obscured by the helpful volleys of glowing projectiles all over the damn place.

Thirdly, it's a high-paced, dodging-heavy shooter... in a game where every single area is a cramped cube often further obstructed by stairs and similar. This one should speak for itself.

And then there are just all the gameplay issues. For instance, on the third level I encounter a melee-attacking boss who moves so fast that even at constant sprint away from him, even bunny-hopping, he constantly catches up with me and hits me. There's literally no way to avoid damage, hitting him doesn't slow him down, Nothing does. Your only hope of beating him is that your damage output and soaking ability beats his, which is entirely down to what pickups you've been lucky enough to get.

Did anyone ever playtest this? Or did they just slap a bunch of things together and go: "FAST-PACED MUSIC. PIXEL ARTSTYLE. IT'S A WINNER."?

The music's pretty nice, though, so there is that.

(Also why would you saddle one of the playable options with a melee weapon when every single enemy is either charging towards you to make its own melee attacks or constantly vomiting bullets? It's impossible to use it without taking damage.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087367727', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1431220110}
review:
This game looks so good untill you play it for more then 2 minutes. I really did try to enjoy it as i can ee how it could be fun, but sadly the game is just way to difficuit to be fun! Here are the pros and cons:

Pros:
[] Fun pixel design
[] Great music
[] Lots of rooms and weapons
[] Classes

Cons:
[] Enemy attaks you can't avoid
[] Boss attacks you can't avoid
[] Rooms are very dark
[] Hard to earn coins
[] VERY easy to die on a great run, no matter how much health!
[] Game is just way to hard in general 

In my opinion this game needs more work and should still be in early access

author: {'steamid': '76561197972810956', 'num_games_owned': 872, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1427246949}
review:
Disclaimer: I love roguelikes of all types, and even I couldn't even enjoy this game.

I thought maybe I'd give this game a shot, considering the hype surrounding it because of that dude.  Was hoping it'd be some kind of gem, something truly magical where I could understand why he was so upset.  I always try to refrain from crapping on other games because I KNOW how much work and love and time goes into them... but this game is bad.  The UI, the artwork, the generic electronic soundtrack, nothing meshes well, or feels like it belongs in the same universe.

Gameplay wise, the movement speed is wonky and floaty, not in a good quake 3 sorta way.  There's almost zero weight or feel to anything, no way to tell how big explosion radius are, melee weapons are nearly useless, weapons dont feel good to use; I'm looking for redeeming qualities and I can't seem to find any; This game is an idea, it should still be in early access because it lacks zero finesse, polish, character or even just reason to play it.

There's an entire steam store full of roguelikes and roguetypes that are worth your money, Tower of Guns  does a better job of what this game is trying to do, go play that instead. Do not buy this game, it's passable at best, do not give in to the hype.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993742278', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1423845072}
review:
Let's neglect the fact that the original dev was a huge dick to everyone.  Let's neglect the fact he raged like a child for a simple fixable reason and said some messed up things on twitter.  Let's neglect the fact he outright cheated the original music composer out of pay, after he put personal pursuits on hold because he was told he'd get paid.  Let's neglect the fact that the game got taken down off steam, bought out by a new publisher, and brought back to steam.

Its still an obsolete version of Ziggurat.  While there are differences, in just about every regard Ziggurat is a superior game and your money would be better spent on that.  This game was enjoyable for the nonexistant price of a humble bundle game, but I can't recommend spending any more than $5 on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006244202', 'num_games_owned': 3398, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1423823060}
review:
This is an abuse of Early Access system. It is not polished, it has many bugs, it has really poor optimization. And the devs first mocked with people, then mocked with Gabe. then got kicked out, then sold the game to a different publisher in its unfinished state.

Yeah aim of the developers is not reached since they lack basic courtesy. Anyway, what was that aim? It was simply replicating BoI in FPS setting. Shops, bombs, most of the skills and upgrades were designed on this. This is not bad, since BoI is really fun, but this does not add anything original to the genre either. Every addition came from some other roguelike, e.g Ghost from Spelunky. It is good knowing that developers also like the games I like and many likes, but a collection of features from some well known very well executed games to build a buggy, unfinished mess is completely different thing.

What is the original side of the game? To be fair it has two. First, its art style. User interface and menus are poorly designed, and game plays like the worst possible Unity example once can imagine, so expect stutters when passing through different menus. But in game voxel art is not that bad, and it feels unique. Also the soundtracks are not that bad, and distinct from other roguelike games. But being unique is not always a good thing, check some gameplay videos first, you may not like dubstep at the end.

I am not a good FPS player, so I did not reach past floor 3, but it is not necessary to finish the game to see that this game is abandonware. Any obvious no brainer bug will be there until eternity while new publishers find publishing the new version with a gameplay video and a pdf file rather than some content wise and bug crushing patch.

If u LOVE FPS and also LOVE binding of isaac, u may enjoy this a little, if u also are good with ignoring its bugs. If your feeling towards one of those two is more mediocre, u are advised to go and play some other FPS-roguelike. I can also advice you some other FPS roguelikes, since I have tried many:

- Ziggurat
-Tower of Guns
- Fancy Skulls

author: {'steamid': '76561198055694600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1461511758}
review:
This is one of those games in which you play for 30 mins and get adrenaline for next 2 hours.
Balance- good (though I havn't played for a long time)
Music- amazing
Controls- good (make game more about skill with almost no poor-control damage)
Graphics- moderate. I like pixel art, as long as if it not confusing. In this game explosions are confusing and you cant really tell the sizes of explosions. Some other moments also need to be improved.

Overall I want to give this game 7.5/10
Deducted points go exclusively for graphics, sometimes making it diffictult to understand wtf is going on and how big explosions are.

Reccomend for rogue-like fps lovers who want a game as fast as quake 3 or smth

author: {'steamid': '76561198022967407', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1424473166}
review:
I really want to reccommend this game, but the bad just ended up outweighing the good. Is it a fun game? I'd say so. It's fast paced, action-packed and the graphics are surprisingly unique. However, there's just too much I personally don't enjoy for me to keep playing. I'm all for hard games, but in some parts, the difficulty spikes in unfair ways. I'm not even talking about the bosses, which, while cliche (flying skulls? really?), are fun and pleasantly challenging. I'm referring to enemies like the land sharks that are nearly impossible to hit and can grind your health away in seconds after noiselessly charging you in packs of 5 or 6. Another issue I had was the item system. Some items, when activated, seem to do absolutely nothing. I'm sure they were performing some function, but some feedback or even a short bio displayed when picking up the item would have been appreciated. Also why does the sword use ammo? That's nitpicking, I'll admit, but something just seems odd about that to me, especially since it appears to be just a standard medieval sword. While fun, Paranautical Activity doesn't really enough to keep me playing for more than half an hour or so.

[u]Score: 5/10[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996501124', 'num_games_owned': 7812, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1424228808}
review:
If you‚Äôve paid even the slightest attention to games in the past few years, you‚Äôre now very aware of what a roguelike is. Even games that have little to anything to do with the traditions of the genre have introduced randomness as a mechanic in order to take advantage of the buzz the term now generations. However, as ubiquitous as roguelikes have become in the last few years on PC, there have been few to try it in an FPS, and fewer still that succeed when they try. Paranautical Activity was actually one of the first as it went through Early Access, but controversy stemming from the game‚Äôs original developer delayed its full release to just recently, when a new publisher bought the rights to the title. It‚Äôs a good thing too, because Paranautical Activity feels like Doom made in a different age, and certainly deserves recognition for setting the standard of what a procedurally generated shooter should be.

Want to know more? My full review has been posted over at my new home, TechRaptor.net ! http://techraptor.net/content/paranautical-activity-review-explosive-turtle-action

review: unbalanced, mismatched, and unfair game, i bought this because i love old school shooters and rouglike games so this game was an easy choice but when i started it up i died within 5 seconds. Okay... ill try again and realized that this game can be incredibly unfair espicially with the shark enemies that not only travel faster than all the characters, but the fact you literally have to stare straight down to shoot them kinda takes away the fun. This game does shooting and movement very well similar to quake 3 but its rooms are crammed with so much stuff  i cannot freeley move 3 feet without knowing EXACTLY how the room is set up. The weapons are also poorly matched with the stats on the characters, are not fun to use, and frankly useless with more interesting characters locked behind ridiculous challenges that only a die hard fan of a $10 arcade game ( probably not common ) can achieve, developer is also a jerk so yeah, don't buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002504698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1601356462}
review:
It's back, and Now I shall review it. it's a rogue-lite fps with multiple characters that determine starting conditions, many items to att abilities or change gameplay, from the simple goodness of faster fire-rate to the absurdity of vvvvvvv style gravity flipping. That said, it suffers from the same things rogue-lites all suffer from, such as repetitive gameplay and fiendish difficulty, but then again, games like this are supposed to be taken in bites.

every floor ends in a boss, and there are several unique bosses requiring different strategies, and then you move on to the next floor with an item belonging to that boss.

All things considered, I recommend it for the price tag and fun gameplay, so long as the game's rather troubled past doesn't spoil things for you. I had fun playing it, and if you like rogue-lites, rogue-likes, and other such ilk, you'll find this easier to enjoy than many others in that category.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001833599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1433605270}
review:
I should probably have seen the Early Access reviews before purchasing it, but this is where you get a bit more savvy about positive reviews than negative ones.

And frankly, this game isn't too bad. It's just not... fun and doesn't feel too interesting. Think Doom and Binding Of Isaac, but with a worse Health system, weapons that feel powerless at times, and surprisingly bad frame drops.

Paranautical Activity (Deluxe Atonement, for its re-release after the whole "threatening Gabe Newell" thing), is a rogue-lite FPS game. It takes notes from Doom and Binding Of Isaac, yet it seems to do it in ways that work against the game. While it does use its inspiration in a decent manner (fast paced shooting, randomized rooms and floors, varying stats on each character), it also just... doesn't.

Weapons feel decent to use, although some of them are absurdly weak. The shotgun, from my point of view, felt like the biggest letdown of all the weapons, with the bow being powerful at one or two-hitting enemies.

Power-ups feel nice too when you find out what they do. With next to no context as to what they do, you're basically gambling your run (just like Isaac).

Enemies are... alright. Mostly tedious to deal with, since some range from simple "fire a bolt, wait for a while, rinse and repeat" to "Is this Touhou?". Surprisingly, the most annoying enemy I faced was the floor sharks. Why? Tank-y characters can't dodge well and with the floor sharks, I've ended up being juggled by them, shooting them with a shotgun that did abysmal damage, until I either died or survived with a massive chunk of health gone.

Levels are pretty much the same square box with randomised preset props and enemies are dumped in when you enter. Nothing to write home about, except for what could amount to some problem with moving under staircases. Ended up getting stuck there and the AI seems to have the same problem. And I mean stuck in a way that feels like when your clothes gets stuck on a door handle and janks you back. There also seems to be some odd dissonance with the enemies that spawn in some rooms? Sometimes you get enemies who spawn in that get stuck in parts of the level geometry and just kinda... sits there... like the aforementioned stairs.

The characters have different spawn weapons, health and speed, meaning that you have some variety in what you can do and can't do. And by variety, it boils down to how far you can get with the fast characters. I mentioned above that the tank-y characters are slow. They got extra health to offset the lack of agility, but that trade off is imbalanced. Along with some of the characters getting weapons which would be ideal for fast ones, since they promote "attack-retreat" tactics. However they work against the character, requiring them to take risks that never really pay off due to the weak weaponry. Compared to the bow or the sickle, the shotgun feels like that Penny Arcade comic about videogame shotguns, except the shotgun is shooting gumdrops at pointblank.

The bosses are... okay. They look interesting, but their design and looks are pretty much meaningless, since most of them just shoot at you non-stop, until they spawn enemies or do some third thing that makes them marginally different. And,honestly they could be interesting if most of them didn't feel like a palette swap. They just move around the area and shoot, not really doing anything else, than maybe a specific animation set to the model. Which sucks, cause the bosses I fought looked really interesting and were creatively designed (aesthetically, anyway).

Is the game itself worth it even after all complaints and negatives? If you've run out of rogue-lite games it could be. If there's some more tweaks to the game, such as a revamped health system, characters and weapons being buffed, as well as some changes to make bosses less dependent on luck or power-ups along with making them more mechanically interesting, it could be a decent game. Also the menu font is atrocious. And the menu looks really amateurish, like stock Unity asset bland.

Was I satisfied with the product? No. I felt like I bought a game that could've benefitted from more time in Early Access or even an extended time or open beta or even a massive overhaul. Hopefully, some patches since this review was written has made the game more fun to play and less annoying to deal with.

Edit: What's this, an edit for a half a decade old review? You bet your dumpster diving butt it is. Made the review less of a chore to read, removed the overuse of commas, fixed some spelling errors and removed redundant text. Some habits die hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970313625', 'num_games_owned': 1420, 'num_reviews': 484, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1425374691}
review: First impressions (2.5 hours played):  One of the better rogue-likes on Steam.  It's pretty much Binding of Isaac mixed with first person shooter.  Fast paced, intenese, and hard as fuck.  It still needs a bit of work and more things to do though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041114445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1424227991}
review:
Voxel FPS with Quake-y movement and randomly generated rooms.  

Movement is good, but shooting is unsatisfying.  Rooms are randomly generated, but there isn't a lot of variety and floors/runs end up feeling the same in the end.  Menus look rushed/unfinished.  In the end, it's a shallow game that is alright for the first few goes, but fails to introduce any real variety.

Don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036696805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1686289842}
review:
An epic FPS roguelike, that is definitely worth your time.
The bosses are difficult enough to be challenging, but not overbearing, 
the weapons, and items make for an entertaining bit of chance, (some items suck, some rock,)
the randomly generated levels give tons of replay value, (as does any roguelike that's worth it's salt,)
and despite one of the devs saying he was gonna kill Gaben, and losing his job, and the game being removed, etc. 
the game is back on Steam, and updated, and better than before! :D Yay! 
The devs have kept up on this since Early Access, and it shows in the finished product. 
Definitely worth $10, let alone the sale prices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976597780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1412907870}
review: "IT'S BACK BABY~!" Paranautical activity is a Rogue-light FPS game not unlike Binding of Issac. It was removed after the dev got pissed off at Gaben's Miss labeling of it's release... it was listed as early-access when it had just finished it's E-A cycle. now it's back and better than ever. play as one of about 5 (technicaly 6) Characters as you attempt to defeat Dhalia, a ghostly child that only wants one thing... the death of all living things. you, a sailor who happened to sail next to a deserted boat arives on the scean. the boat you where on suddenly dissapearing into the mist behind you, you go into the boat hopeing for shelter or some way to get away from this acursed ship, only to find adversity waiting for you... will you survive?... or will you become the newest crew member to join the Paranautical Activity on this boat?... there's just one way to find out. shoot, Bomb, and pewpew all that stands in your way, get the loot, and make it to the next floor before the "ghost" catches up to you... but Dhalia is not alone... and you can't help but feel the grudge filled stare of something much more sinister........... good luck~... and... do be wary of the holes... you wouldn't want to go back to a previous floor... would you?

review:
Apart from the idiot who made the game threatening to kill GabeN, the game is also not very good. 

If you want a functional, boring, kind of samey looking rogelike FPS, buy Tower of Guns instead of this. If you want a fun exciting engaging roguelike FPS, buy Ziggurat. 

No reason to buy this one at all, unless you want the baby crawling through fire steam badge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991741160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1465707084}
review: First off big rep to Mike and Travis for this thrilling fast paced voxel shooter, everything i enjoyed from the music, to pace of the game, and even the feel is perfect for the content it has. Glad Steam brought it back it deserves it. I say it is worth the money it is priced at but I myself like sales so I waited for a great deal on it. Dont just listen to all the haters reviews because if they took a second to take the game for what it is instead of staying up Gabens ass, then maybe people would see it is a very enjoyable experience for the casual and hardcore fps player. Kudos again guys and look forward to other projects from Code Avarice. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060220924', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1458263658}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005154483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1381657696}
review:
This game is by no means a terrible game and to be honest, the price isn't unreasonable either.  But the reason I can't recommend is simply because while the game's over all mechanics are fairly solid it just feels very...well, soulless. 

The rooms are random and yet despite this fact due to their basic architecture you'll still somehow feel like you've been through the same dungeon a thousand times over.  While the voxel graphics aren't terrible the enemies still come feeling like they were designed using the most bare minimum of artistic design. 

Essentially, after pouring in an hour you're going to feel like you've seen almost everything the game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1415590655}
review:
[h1]In short it is the binding of isaac in 3D[/h1]
The game is based on the same assumptions - you land in the starting room each subsequent room is randomly generated - to this a mass of finds, weapon upgrades and bosses at the end of each floor - each subsequent floor implements a stronger and stronger monster to the rooms. Plus good music and thoughtful character classes.

From me it gets ten out of ten - it is a piece of good game!
[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ[‚òÖ]

[spoiler] Yes this is the game whose creator taunted and made death threats - to steam founder Gab Newell - who banned the creator and removed his game from steam, but as you can see after time, they reconciled and the game is available again[/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198049845837', 'num_games_owned': 1805, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1495425214}
review:
Paranautical Activity is an interesting little game. Similar to games like Binding of Isaac, only a first person shooter, with voxel graphics.  Never thought I would enjoy this, but it's a fun game. It is fairly hard, and the guides on steam are ?outdated? so some items will be a mystery until use.

Happy to see it return on steam. Here's hoping for more guns, rooms, loot, monsters, updates, and much more hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972891201', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1423797113}
review:
This game is for a very niche audience. If you are skilled at twitch FPS play and love a challange, this is a good game for you. It is very challenging and you feel great when you succeed because of it. But you are going to die a lot. The dev which caused all the drama that many reviews talk about is gone and an entirely new developer has taken over.

I have not experianced any bugs like others have stated. I have a very midrange rig and it plays fine on max settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056366107', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1680165865}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042602090', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1668412164}
review: A decent game, to be sure, but there are other projects (Heavy Bullets, Fancy Skulls, etc.) that do the FPS roguelike in a more ambitious way; Paranautical Activity is essentially just a less loot-centered (which I find rather boring, frankly) Binding of Isaac FPS. Plus we were promised multiplayer but didn't recieve, which could be a testament to the Devs's ability to follow through on promises in future updates. All-in-all it's an entertaining game that I would recommend to players who enjoyed Doom, The Binding of Isaac or other games of that ilk, but aren't expecting anything truly pioneering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132918735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1407522115}
review:
Okay, I'll be honest: this game was dissapointing for me, but not because of the game itself. I got this on a Humble Bundle and when I saw the name "Paranautical Activity" I imagined a artistic indie horror/mystery type game....which is NOT what this game is like: it's a fast paced FPS. 

That being said, I learned to appreciate this game. Boatloads of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980206308', 'num_games_owned': 3968, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1438208791}
review:
This bland shooter has one distinctive feature: music in this one is so awful it could start another holocaust.
Ha, like it's a bad thing. Other than that it's playable rogue-something-fps that tries hard at being something without actual talent involved, just like it's music. Still rogue-something-something-something works as always, you may find some randomized bits of joy among it's facepalm inducing design. Though there is better things to spend some cash. Like lube or something else good to your health.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043010865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1415108242}
review:
Pros
- Fast-paced, bullet-hell gameplay
- Easy to set up and play
- Tons of replayability
- Lots of unique items
- Variety in classes and weapons
- Fun to figure out what items do
- Procedurally generated floors (no two floors are the same)
- Multiple bosses
- Can easily induce One-More-Run Syndrome
- FOV slider

Cons
- Enemy vartiation lacking
- Dark rooms do not provide enough light
- Flying skull enemies gang up on you and take chunks out of your health. Can make you feel cheated.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980054291', 'num_games_owned': 2267, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1585221790}
review:
Paranautical Activity is a very fast paced roguelike shooter. The combat feels like Quake on speed in much smaller, but well designed rooms (with enough room to bunny hop around while dodging enemy fire and shooting back).
The enemies are nice and varied, and weapons are fun to use.
In a nutshell, this is a mixture of the shooting mechanics of quake with the roguelike elements of Binding of Isaac.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027585752', 'num_games_owned': 2168, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1443226421}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004806937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1491242417}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009890414', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2557, 'last_played': 1607122274}
review: If The Binding of Isaac was a FPS it would be this game. Paranautical Activity is a procedurally generated, "Rogue-like", shooter. It's fast paced, similar to old Doom or Quake games, and has incredible replay-value, as probably expected from a roguelike. Especially the last patch, which added a progression system and 3 different play modes, added a ton of replayability. It's absolutely one of my favorite games ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110971331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1423805132}
review:
Despite the friction between people of the community and people of the development team, this game is quite good.  Steps have been taken to make it what it was set out to be by the developers. 

The game on its own merits is very good: Gameplay isn't super unique but it is an enjoyable, fast-paced first-person shooter style rogue-lite.  While the item list at a glance is relatively small the variety of weapons makes it an interesting play.

I wouldn't say it is infinately replayable as the number of item combinations and their affect on your gameplay isn't large, but the game is enjoyable for many hours and is well worth a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024073874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2564, 'last_played': 1691369928}
review: This game is basically the FPS version of Binding of Isaac but it's also on steroids. It is so addictive taht you won't stop til you get to the 7th floor and beat the game. There are so many power ups that you wanna get just so you can see what they do. So many weapons, enemies, bosses, upgrades, and tons more. This game always has me on the edge of my seat no matter how many times I play it. And this is a warning to all of you who buy this game. As soon as you choose your character and click that select button and walk out of that elevator, you never know what you're gonna get from this game. Good Luck to you all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077227151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1617214396}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119310389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1516154175}
review:
Paranautical is a highly addictive game of chance,skill and on the run strategy.
If I were to use another game to describe this one, I would say that Paranautical Activity is a 3D Binding of Isaac like FPS.

This game provides you with a varied selection of starter characters (each with different stats and weapons) so it really caters to the individual's play style. During a runthrough the player can pick up so many items that they will become a personal class of their own, with no resemblance to what they started as.

The player is provided three modes, two of which can be unlocked by completing the standard mode. Paranautical Activity becomes more difficult with each level you complete. Though items you pick up along the way will help you stay ontop of the next levels enemies.

Each playthrough will be a different experience due to the complete random generation of this game. Differently sized levels, spawning different bosses, dropping different loot.

If you are considering buying this game, the answer is yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004663985', 'num_games_owned': 2730, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1413481014}
review: Paranautical Activity is a game that combines Doom with Binding of Isaac. Which is a good concept in theory, but it's execution is disappointing. The problem is that it removes most of what makes Doom and other twitch fps so good. It misses cool weapons and enemies. Also the level design is bland. It's basically Binding of Isaacs boxes attached to each other where you clear a room to go to the next one until you find the floor exit. So no keycards and secrets. The room design is really bland. Same goes for the presentation. It's voxel style graphics just don't work for this game. Also the music is annoying. Hopefully in the future some company picks up the concept and does a good execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1413230162}
review:
Got this pre-steam and enjoyed it a lot. Mainly bought it for the advertised co-op, but the dev decided to cancel that. And the recent update forced a "Ghost" on the player, where it spawns if you take too long, forcing the player to speed run rather than plan ahead. If the Ghost get's altered to where it's optional or get's moved to some sort of Speed-run/Hardcore mode, I'll remove that complaint, but the advertised co-op canceled is a big slap on the face,

I personally wouldn't recommend it out of principle, but in the interest of fairness, this is a nice fast paced action game with permadeath, though the Ghost is annoying.

[b]Edit 1:[/b] In a post on the forum, the dev claims he will be putting out patch that will make the Ghost only appear after you beat the game once, THEN it's forced on you with no other option than to delete your save(and cloud), to start over. It's not like there's some sort of progression system, but it's an annoying hurdle. Dev said that new players hate it, but 'veterans' love it, which I think is big assumption  thinking that only vets love it and noobs hate it. Whatever, this post will be updated when he updates and I'll add on details on his choice.

Oh, and by 'no progression system', I meant progression that carries over between games. There's plenty of power-ups that make you stronger or have more health, speed, etc.

[b]Edit 2:[/b] Firstly, I was wrong about the progression system. There's an 'unlocks' menu that shows a bunch of things you can do and it'll unlock various things like weapons, characters, powerups, items, new starting/findable items for specific characters, and game modes. I think it's a very nice system.

For the Ghost part: There are 3 game modes. Classic has no Ghost and you can't reach the 8th floor. Hardcore mode has both the 8th floor and the Ghost. And Infinite mode, which is basically Hardcore mode, but when you complete the 8th floor, you loop back to the first. Not sure of all the details for Infinite mode, but thats the basic gist of it.

[b]Edit 3:[/b] Your 'thumbs down' arouse me, keep them coming.

Leider ist die Performance noch nicht die allerbeste, weswegen ich es ab dem 2. Level/Floor dank zuvielen Partikeln (wegen einem bestimmten Mob) kaum spielen kann (liegt leider auch an meinem nicht so guten PC). Desweiteren sollte es mal einen Coop Modus geben, der anscheinend aber nun doch gecancelt wurde...
Ich h√§tte mir, wenn das Spiel 'ne bessere Performance gehabt h√§tte, schon vorstellen k√∂nnen das das spa√üig werden k√∂nnte.

Trotzdem ist das Spiel in meinen Augen f√ºr Fans von The Binding of Isaac eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

review:
The game is great and all that, but it has a couple problems.
 -I don't know if anybody else has this problem but I do and it is to do with the performance. It's quite poor on my PC which is a large amount above the minimum requirements yet if I want at least 60 fps I need to turn the game down to either 720p or fastest.
 -Lack of multiplayer! Seriously! With all those classes you would think that there would be some form of multiplayer, yet there isn't. Huge wish for it to be there.

Apart from that, the game plays great with the fast-paced shooting and the randomly generated levels make it just a bit more fun and give it a bit more replayability, however I don't see myself playing all that much up until the performance issue is sorted out or a multiplayer mode (One suggestion for that, have it so that you can play with random people, not just friends because I don't have any.) is made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995746033', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1413791520}
review:
[First of all, let me just admit that I know the programmer of the game personally. I talk to him online all the time, and I've hung out with him. This does not affect my opinion of the game in the slightest. If I thought the game was bad, I wouldn't be writing this.]


Paranautical Activity is a first-person shooter roguelike set on a nazi U-Boat. If you like shooters there is plenty here to enjoy, if you like roguelikes there's even more, and no two runs will likely ever be the same. Being a roguelike, each of the eight stages is filled with procedurally generated rooms. These rooms are filled with an increasingly difficult selection of enemies, along with a boss, a sub boss, a shop, and bonus rooms with various bonuses and challenges. Each floor is also a race against the clock to beat the the boss and progress before an unkillable phantom comes to hurry you along under threat of murder.

There are several playable characters, each with unique play styles. Some, such as Gorton, require precision but do crazy amounts of damage; and others, such as Dy-No-Mite, allow for a more loose play style at the cost of self-destructive splash damage. There is a selection of super weapons that range from a ninja sword that wrecks shop up close, a cannon that demolishes most things, and a gun that uses its ammunition to create more health, bombs, and armor.

There is a wide selection of items that can help you along (and more than a few that will make your going much tougher). Some can make you immune to explosions. Some can basically remove the cap on your rate of fire. Some can give you much more health at the cost of your speed. Some can make all floors dark. Some can do nothing other than change your character's injured sound to a selection of girlish "Ooches" and "Ouches."

The varied enemy design ranges from rocket-propelled turtles that fire missiles, glowing monkeys that jump back and forth between the floor and ceiling, and sharks that hunger for your feet. Bosses range from a pair of flying eyeballs that divide themselves when they die, a battleship with kamikaze planes circling it, and a nazi scientist that can resurrect the dead.

Though the game doesn't officially release until around halloween, the final content patch just went live a few hours ago, so I feel comfortable finally officially recommending this game to anyone who enjoys the concepts behind it's design. If you like shooters, I recommend this game. If you like roguelikes, I definitely recommend this game. If you like games that marry the two concepts, then I can't imagine why you wouldn't love this game.

review:
Paranautical activity was gifted to me by my brother from a humble bundle. It is totally worth the 10$, since it's a small amount for a game that lasts this long.
i played it whenever i had nothing else to do during my summer holidays, and still play it when i am bored in my weekends.
I do recomend this game, it is worth buying even though everyone else says it is not.
I would recomend it however, to wait until it is on sale or on another humble bundle to avoid spending too much for something that isn't your taste.
This is an indie game, which is one reason why i like it. It is also a non-ending type game, which means the story (or game) keeps going on.
I surely hope they do add multiplayer of some sort to this game, it would really become a great success if they do.
Good luck on your decision, if you are considering purchasing this game.

review:

This is unfortunate, because I really wanted to like it. The idea of a fast-paced roguelike FPS with random levels and permadeath sounds like a mixture of everything I think is awesome in gaming. Yet, somehow it completely fails to be fun. Hopefully the next studio to try this will do it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980502721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1512487527}
review:
Firstly, I'd like to point out that this game is still getting more content added to it gradually. So this review is to reflect -current- gameplay and content.

I have greatly enjoyed Paranautival Activity, and it has probably frustrated me about as much as Binding of Isaac has with regards to finding hard bosses, picking up bad items for my build, etc.
If you like games similar to Binding of Isaac or Tower of Guns, this one is a great middle ground. The weapons all have their own advantages (Personally, the sickle is the best weapon in the game hands down) and each item is useful in its own right and can add interesting or frustrating abilities. For example, one item gives you the same jumping mechanic as VVVVVV has, that is, switching gravity and standing on the ceiling instead of jumping. It's cool, but can be a huge pain sometimes.

The enemies are all interesting and difficult in their own right, and certain builds will find some enemies easier than others. I'd give the graphics, gameplay and amount of current content a good 8/10. I'm extremely excited about more stuff being released when the time comes, as I'm sure I'll come back to this game more.
You should give it a try, seriously!

review: I bought this a long time ago when it was very different from what it is now.  It has come a long way, and sadly co-op isn't making it into the game.  Other then that downside this game is great! Grab your prefered gun and pray to RNGesus, you might make it to the end.  It's fast pased old school strife jumping and alot of running backwards firing like a mad man!  There is a nice variety of rooms and monster types, the boss fights are interesting, and there are tons of buff and debuff items.  Overall I would give it a 6/10 (I was really looking forward to co-op), however it is still a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044599065', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1424306207}
review: I really want to like this game, I really do, but in it's current state and at it's current price, I can't. Paranautical is a rouge-like first person shooter, think Binding of Issac, mixed with Bioshock, which is a beautiful idea, and the 3D pixelated graphics give it a lot of charm, but that's about where charm ends, being a first person shooter, Paranautical Activity is very unforgiving, to put it in perspective I have beat The Binding of Issac multiple times, with multiple charcters, but with Paranautical Activity I'm lucky if I can make it passed the first floor. A lot of the trobule is you are constantly surrounded by enemies, which normally is'nt so bad, but like most FPS when you take damage there is usually a damage indicator, so you know which direction to turn and shoot, not with Paranautical Activity, so you figure that you'll use explosives to handle everything, well that's where another game breaking flaw shows it's ugly head, when you kill an enemy it burst into red pixels that skatter onto the floor and stay there for a few seconds, not bad right? Well every explosion also has a particle effect to the same degree, just orange pixels, so if you kill a group of enemies with an explosion you're in for a lot of particles, and unfourtately the game can't take all the pixels on screen, so it starts to lag real bad, and I know it's not my computer, because I can run games like Skyrim, and Dark Souls with no problems. So there is a lot of good in this game, it's got a great idea, all it needs to do is fix some bugs, but it seems like the developers don't want to fix anything, and until they do, or until they lower the price, I can't reccomend this game, however, if you can find the game for cheap, and you wanna kill a hour or two, pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076426409', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1436458531}
review:
Paranautical Activity ist ein Shooter, der in einer Rastergrafik √§hnlich der von Minecraft gehalten ist. Das Spielprinzip ist relativ einfach: Losrennen und alles was sich bewegt wegholzen. Das Spiel √ºberrascht trotzdem durch einen Schwierigkeitsgrad, der normalerweise nicht zu erwarten w√§hre. 

Alles in allem ist das ein sehr einfacher Egoshooter und ein typischer Indie-Titel, der - meiner Meinung nach - so schrottig ist, dass er schon wieder gut ist.
Wems gef√§llt, ich habs √ºber Humble Bundle und w√ºrde es nicht wieder kaufen. Deshalb keine Kaufempfehlung von mir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097675823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 3033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2651, 'last_played': 1573433784}
review:
Paranautical activity is a fps hybrid with rng levels, as you can see I have played this game a lot, because I really like voxels, but whatever, the game is unbalanced, soundtrack is good and I like the graphics like I said before, I don't recommend for casual players because the game is too hard for its own good, powerups that don't help with nothing, dying restart the game from the first level, dark levels are too dark and you can't save your progress roguelike style.

+amazing soundtrack
+cool gameplay
+awesome enemies
-rng crap

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040157303', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1685010445}
review:
-OH WOW THIS REVIEW HAS HAD MORE ITERATIONS THAN FINAL FANTASY MAYBE YOU SHOULD READ IT IN ITS ENTIRETY-

Developers are rude and insulting to their customers, and the game is slowly picking up bugs when it should be losing them. 

The game itself is really quite enjoyable for people who're into fast-paced arena-shooter type games, although it doesn't have the replay value of most action-roguelikes such as The Binding of Isaac. 

I'd give it a 7/10, although considering the attitude of the developers, the lying about features, and the increasing incompetence of the game's coding, I would regrettably have to advise against purchasing this.

EDIT: As of October 2014 the dev team seem to be stepping up on taking community feedback and listening to the playerbase's concerns. I may change this review to recommend the game if this continues.

EDIT the Second: I'd advise you to not buy this game as of late October 2014, as you literally cannot purchase it any longer. Thanks SpooderW.

EDIT the Third: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand it's back, let's see where it goes from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990672230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 8443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6463, 'last_played': 1453074761}
review:
Fast, frenetic, quick play roguelike-styled FPS. Luck is fun!
Sure there's not much depth to this game and the final update for it will be coming out soon, but what's here is a lot of fun regardless.

It's great to just load it up, blast through it for a while, seeing what awesome combinations you can get, and seeing how fast you can destroy everything in your path. It's not a stupendously good game, but I don't regret kickstarting this either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026324107', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1408836691}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086744574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2414, 'last_played': 1471603503}
review:
Paranautical Activity is a fast paced FPS Roguelike. It has a difficult learning curve, and the game will kick your ass. But kick your ass like your mistress would, you'd come back begging for more.

I initially did not recommend the game, at least for it's price, but recent updates have really fleshed out the game. While still early access, the game is looking at lot more finished now.

The most recent update added a plethora of new items, a new floor, new bosses, and most noteably achievements/unlocks.

I would wholly recommend this game if an FPS Roguelike sounds like your cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011275042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1541955202}
review:
So I gave this game a review during Early Access and it was bad. Really bad. I have reconsidered my position after retrying the game a few months later when the game had more updates, features, achievements and now even cards and secondary weapons (ninja-to, bitches!). It seems like devs are actually working on making this a better game.

It's not as bad as it used to be BUT I still dislike it. However, it do deserves a nice grade, this is just not my kind of game. The few classes you can choose are super unbalanced and it's a miracle if you can find a weapon that shoots actual bullets and not colorful balls of slugness or mega slow darts. Don't even let me get started on how super fast you die with any class that is not the heavy. I understand the mechanics of rogue-like dungeon crawlers and I have played a few, yes, but this one? You just die too fast.

If you have the patience for fast paced, rogue-like, one hit death, dubstep themed games, do give this a try. It won't hurt your pocket and you can even kill Poseidon! I just did!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115461516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1408576119}
review: It's like the disabled love child of Minecraft, Doom, and Rogue and that totally impossible platform game I Wanna Be The Guy. Basically the developers of this game should consider pitching their ideas to Michael Bay - that's how bad this game is. Of course maybe you like Michael Bay films and Micecraft graphics, Doom-1-but-far-worse-ish gameplay, random rooms with no point and a difficulty level that rubs the death screen in your face over and over. I've got good news! This game is for you! P.S. I only played as long as I did because I had to play >5 mins to review this garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064673186', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1460841307}
review:
The game in it's current state, to put it lightly, is a mess. There is a great concept buried under piles of poor execution and broken promises. The developers also take out anger on the buyers by angrily typing about how our expectations are too high, and how they couldn't possibly finish in time for the deadlines they set for themselves. They also publicly stated that the game was being abandoned. Many promised features aren't going to be included, and they will be putting a 1.0 label on the game.

The game itself is repetitive, glitchy, unbalanced and unpolished. I'd say you should avoid this game like the plague. 2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111951796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1462154156}
review:
I must say, if you are looking for a game to play on the side of other game while thay are doing an update or whatever, this is your deal. I dont roam game forums or post bugs and glitches alot, but the point of the review is to rate the game not the forum. Even though I have heard bad things about the forum, i still think this game has alot of potental. 

And now, a little bit about the game.
-adrenaline pumping music
-great boss fights, 2 per floor, one is optional
-very helpful post-boss fight rewards
-5 classes with different weapons and stats
-several power ups
-a couple refrences to other games
-action!
-in-game gift shops, one on every floor with different items
-and last, but not least, giant flying sea turtles with mounted rocket launchers

I hope this refiew was in the least bit helpful.

review: Like a first-person Binding of Isaac meets Quake's emphasis on mobility and shooting, Paranautical Activity is non-stop shooting and dodging from the start. Varied enemies and room layouts keep the pressure on, and the rogue-lite elements incorporate a steady stream of powerups to help the player through the constantly increasing difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128609096', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1434119493}
review:
Okay, bought this last night just before going to bed hoping to fight away my sleep deprivation and my train of thought was "okay i'll put this on download and go to bed.. wait, it's only like 100 mb? okay, i'll play like 10 minutes" it's now 3 in the morning. Amazingly fun. the thing I hate about this game though is when you progress a certain amount it is made harder by enveloping the map in complete darkness... do not like, ples halp. still, heartily recommend this game, it is brilliant.

Edit: I do however support the negative reviews in their complaints about the devs, they are horrible people and unless they start to support the game and support players, this will be another potential indie dev that has crashed and burned, of their own accord.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034199687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1413606680}
review:
The description on the store page mentions "Doom and Quake", "Binding of Isaac and Spelunky".
I suggest you get those instead of falling for big names getting thrown around.
I own all those games (and know doom and boa intimately) and I can tell you they're not here.

The game itself plays like a randomized room shooter with voxel graphic. There is little variation and a few minutes tell you all you need to know.
You can find the same concept with good execution in "tower of guns".

author: {'steamid': '76561197970434608', 'num_games_owned': 2530, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1397284186}
review:
This game has never really seen love. Just as the developers have never really shown love and in the middle of this conflict between the players and the developers is a game that had unlimited potential. It's a sad sight to see it die over something as lame as the dev's folding on the co-op support. For me personally, no biggie, yeah it sucks but that just means devs need to step up and deliver something spectacular to their backers for their own short commings on their promises. 

I understand the trials and tribulations that a developer goes through to see their vision come to life, another reason why it is sad to see it die but this is still no reason the devs need to go on the offensive or even the defensive as the backlash should have been expected from the community. A more inteligent tact would have been to go back to the drawing board, like maybe consider scrapping their developed engine because of it's short commings and using an outside engine, as there are a lot of free ones to choose from. The point is that, there were alternatives to how this could've been handled, but instead of putting their energy into fixing it, their efforts went into some kind of 'fight the community' damage control and broke it so bad that it is now unfixable. Thus, the world is less one good game. 

In all, the game wasn't half bad. It's a great idea but it needs a lot of polishing, the random generating algorithms need fixing and even though, technically that this game is still in early access (of which my review is based on) at this point, needing the polishing and fixes is not a good thing, as I have felt the heart leave this game a long time ago. 

I hate saying these words but "I cannot recommend".

review:
Paranautical Activity. Oh, boy!
In the history of gaming there has probably been 6 people at most who didn't like Quake or Binding of Isaac and those fuckers where assholes, I bet you!
Well that's what this game is. This is like Quake and BoI masturbated while playing Minecraft and some crazy scientist very nearly having an epiphany via heavy drug usage with the gift of reanimating dead beat horses decided that making this game was much more important than delivering the news of The Second Coming not happening to people. And the gods smiled upon his chosen path. 
Thank you mister computer science guy! You are the prophet of the Old Ones! Let your cups be forever full and don't ever stop upgrading this game and I'll never stop playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135089051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1405907945}
review:
Apareces en un cuarto donde te dan a elegir entre 4 puertas,cualquiera de ellas de igual porque al entrar apareceran monstrous que tendras que matar para poder seguir avanzando y llegar a un boss de nivel donde una vez mas tendras que matar todo lo que se mueva para avanzar al siguiente nivel, donde una vez mas elegiras entre 4 puertas que conduciran a cuartos repletos de monstruos donde una vez mas ,dispara a todo lo que se mueva...y se repite la mecanica.

Lo bueno: 
*Unas graficas retro ,coloridas, que dan un toque caracteristico a este juego, me encantan 
*La musica es buena aunque repetitiva
*variedad de enemigos y armas

Lo malo:
*Mecanica de juego repetitiva hasta llegar al aburrimiento
*Fuera de la musica y el leve sonido de tu arma, NO EXISTE MAS SONIDOS, ni tus pasos, ni tu respiracion, y lo que es imperdonable ,ni los enemigos hacen sonidos, todo es musica musica y mas musica.

Deberia ser Free to Play :/ no vale la pena comprarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561198056967285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1515464389}
review: Well, to be honest I am a bit divided about this game.  I really wanted to reccommend it to everyone, it looked and functioned for the most part how I expected it would.  A simple, pixelated shooter with Rogue like elements.  That being said..the developers promised multiplayer multiple times.  I bought into this game rather late into it's development.  However it was promised on Steam, and judging by various Forum posts it was promised elsewhere as well.  However, it is not just the Multiplayer that detracts from this game for me.  It's just not that fun..well, at all after awhile.  The challenge overides the novelty of it all and even though a rogue-like seems fun..it doesn't quite add up.  Progressing a level or two, getting killed and then reset all the way back to the beginning can be a bit annoying.  Not just that though, I mean there is no story to the game which for the most part is barebones as it is.  The developers have also been agressive towards player criticism in the past..never a good sign when you can't take criticism.  2 out of 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998803197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1405602107}
review:
I generally do not write a review for a game that I have not played at least five hours, but I made this an exception due to how easy it is to experience all there is within the first thirty minutes.

I purchased [i]Paranautical Activity[/i] out of curiosity during one of the Steam sales event.
I obtained the game under the impression that it could be a nice pass time game allowing me to go on a rampage;
the game definitely delivered in that aspect, I was given an environment and monsters to shoot at.

The problem with this game, however, is the fact that the entire game seems to be just a showcase of an idea.
Due to this very fact, I was no longer able to endure this game past the 25th minute mark.

I do realize that this game is still in early development, but I would in no manner consider this a game.
The definition of providing early access is to allow people to purchase the game and test it for the developers,
with the fundemental qualification for an early access game being having most, if not all, of the core mechanics present.
This was not the case.
This game feels like it is showcasing the classes and the monsters, with overly simplistic menus with very lacking choices.

This game delivered a functioning showcase, as I have yet to encounter a debilitating glitch,
but other than the above point, there are several other problems I would like to point out:

1) The game does not receive updates frequently enough.
Out of the some eight months of owning this game, the game has yet to receive major function and mechanics update.
The update frequency can easily rank just below the notorious [i]Cube World[/i].

2) The classes are extremely unbalanced, for future update reference.
I have been playing tanks most of the petty amount of time I have endured this game, 
as I was shown time and time again in the game that tanks somehow have amazing advantage in both offensive and defensive capabilities compared to many others. I could mow down all mobs regardless of the distance with just the shotgun.

3) The game still does not have multiplayer functionality.
The developer's blog did mention encountering problems on December of last year with creating the multiplayer function, but that was seven months ago.

4) Despite randomized, the game has a very limited amount of mobs, rooms, bosses, and items.
As such, the game was not very engaging, as within twenty minutes, the player may have already encountered every single possible instance. Hence why I could not hold my attention onto the game for even 30 minutes.

Until the game performs a major update with multiplayer capability, and also have far more variety in its instances,
I do not recommend purchasing this game.

TL;DR:
Ranging from instance variety and mechanics, the game is too lacking in too many manners.
Until this game has a multiplayer function and an expanded library of instances, this game is not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141887434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1405168923}
review:
About 10 minutes of gameplay tells you that there isn't much to this game. It's trying too hard to be The Binding Of Issac from the Quake mindset but lacks of the soul of both of those games. 

I should state that I have sunk about an hour into a DRM free copy and I have done a few levels but there really isn't anything to this game it states "Early Access" but it really feels like the devs aren't adding anymore to this game and it may as well be out at this point. Maybe I just enjoy real "rogue-likes", where some thought had gone into this game. This feels like an poor XBox Indie Game and nothing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097588955', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1497569916}
review: CREEPY

author: {'steamid': '76561198000520915', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1480173759}
review:
Originally advertised as eventually containing Co-Op play. Devs stated due to a coding oversight co-op would be impossible to implement. Game is okay but falls short of its sources: more haphazard than Doom, and less depth than Binding of Isaac. The kind of compromise I was planning on overlooking when I bought two copies expecting Co-Op to be implemented ever.

Getting promised a prominent feature and then having it cut on the grounds that early access games may or may not change significantly makes me feel like I paid money for Carmageddon and got Nascar, and was expected not to mind the difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000542106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1403331425}
review: Fast paced game, but bought it for the future multiplayer which they promised. They trashed that concept so will be careful about buying early access/greenlight games again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067162920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1424653226}
review: This game is a rouge like FPS its fun to jump on and have a go at it! The bosses are interesting and there are several classes for you to choose from with different weapons in each. The game is still technicly in "Beta" but it's prety much finished. The only thing that isn't in the game is Co-Op which is kinda dissapointing because I had it for a while and they promised it and it hasn't come yet. Either way it's verry enjoyable for some fast paced FPS action and I reccomend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039804062', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1515053480}
review: i love this game, the reason i first found out about this game is from a man on youtube named bisnap, and i loved watching him play it, i finally got it for myself and wow did i spend the best $10 on steam, great game 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067053029', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1513722872}
review: This is a very fun, but very unfinished game. Just know that going in. The game is difficult, close to Quake's "nightmare" setting, and‚Äîtrue to the roguelike ethos‚Äîrarely gives you a fair fight. Bad runs are still fun, and good runs are exhilarating. On downside, the multiplayer coop has been cancelled (which sucks but it's not for the developers' lack of trying). Two more patches are planned before it's complete; but your money gets you solid, hard-as-diamonds old school FPS gameplay. And that ain't bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032868512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1505952737}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013477101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1379642652}
review:
Well..... The game is ok, though it rarely gets any updates. The develpers also see it fit ban posts reporting some bugs in the game and in some cases constructive criticism. All in all the most annoying thing which the developers and the moderators of thier community hub have in the past, was give positive confirmation of multiplayer getting added, claimming for months that it would be in the "next update".  However this never happend because of a "Technical issue" even though they had been "working" on the game for almost a full six to eight months without a single update, bug fix, or patch. After which they claimed they never prommissed any such thing, instead of appologizing to thier customers. They have been one of the best examples of how a game development company should not be run. Ignoring feedback, false advertising, and, one of the worst things to do in my opinion, acting as if it isn't thier falt and not taking any blame about thier short-commings in thier developement. 


I Do not recommend this game to anyone, because nobody should support people like this and feed the ego of a delusional game developer. Especially one who can't even make a game that looks and feels like one a proper dev could make in the seven day fps competition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007752732', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1422867176}
review:
Mola dentro de lo que cabe. 

Est√° bastante entretenido pero es el t√≠pico de pasar sala tras sala sin mas y cuando te matan vuelta a empezar.

Pros:

Contras:

author: {'steamid': '76561197961539340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1425819663}
review: Unfortunately, I can't recommend this game. The developers advertised the game as having certain prominent features upcoming for several months after they had cancelled development, leading to people buying the game under false pretences. Of course, early access games are always a risk, and things can change, but to continue promising a feature long after they have given up on it is not something that should be accepted or encouraged, even for an Early Access game. That isn't part-and-parcel of what we should accept from early access, it's outright misleading, and an abuse of the Early Access system.

review: I got this game with a Humble Bundle some odd months ago, so for the dollar I paid for this game, it is entirely worth it. No co-op is rather disappointing, but that doesn't take away from what the game already has. It's fast paced and easy to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993747533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1411857176}
review:
Very fun! Intense action, highly reflexive shooter.
If you like quick reflex shooters where you move all crazy-fast (think Unreal Tournament) and you like rogue-likes such ad Binding of Isaac or Risk of rain then you might really like this. 
However! Do not be fooled by the early-access label, as it has become quite clear that updates are no longer planned to be implemented. 
So watch the video and expect to get what you see, this is a great get-in-play-get-out game that you can fit into just about any timeframe.
