author: {'steamid': '76561198020359066', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1688097198}
review:
[h1]While others dislike this game because of the lack of updates and the poor feature discontinuation of the devlopers, I personally enjoy this game, although I am very very disapointed at their discontinuation of the multiplayer (Thats why you don't announce a feature until AFTER you confirm in your ability to be able to create it). From the very excellent gameplay to the fun and varied bosses that you encounter.[/h1]

NOTE: This review will change as the game changes, this review is as of 1.8

[u]PROS:[/u]

+ Classic FPS gameplay that you've come to love including Doom and Quake, with over 10 upgrades and fast paced action that many people crave, and NON REGENERATING HEALTH! YES!

+ The game is randomly generated and thus there are thousnads of possibilities for level layouts which is actually done really well, with every corner you turn being completley surprising. With over 50 differnt room enviroments its hard to see the same rooms twice on the same floor.

+ There are many different bosses that you encounter with over 10 in the game, each with their own moves which are pretty insane to watch, with balls of glowing lime green light flying everywhere as you attempt to dodge them with precise movement, just hoping it will die shortly.

+ Variety is a strong point in this game, with many many enemy types and each room having a random layout of enemy in every room, each enemy has its own attack patterns with ninjas that teleport to you in a blaze of white voxel blocks to sharks that dive into the floor leaching up onto you after they swim.

[u]CONS:[/u] (Unfortinutley this game)

+ The music is boring a repedative with only a small handful of tracks that all sound the same.

+ The game has its fair share of glitches (Doors closing before you walk into them causing you to be stuck) But it is early access so I can cut it some slack

+ The developers have no clue what the hell they want in this game, from discontinuing multiplayer to saying updates would come quickly and sadly have come at a crawl.

+ The level's appearance doesnt change often enough (the first 5 levels use the same wall texture and gets bland and tidious after a while) And the bosses aren't really seen as bosses as nothing happens when you enter the room it just spawns and a health bar appears, a nice boss spawning track or some sound effects would really help.

+ Movement doesn't feel right, the lack of bobbing correctly to the very slow walking speed at the start doesn't work well with a game that depends on fast paced movement

[u]OVERALL:[/u]
This game does have plenty of falws in it from glitches and the lazy developers but I keep coming back to this game, why? Because, its fun gameplay, great level layout and enemy variety really makes this game fun to me. I recomend only getting this game if it goes on sale in its current state, because currently it is a very fun game but there isn't enough variety from its very huge variety to make it worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085082903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1389741160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002518788', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1413009067}
review: Fun game, it can be a bit frustrating sometimes, but it's pretty enjoyable. It would be better with 2 player co-op, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013842905', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1414426937}
review:
Paranautical Activity is a tribute to rougelike games, such as The Binding of Isaac. Weilding numerous items to find and several unique "characters"/starting loadouts, there is a wide array of ways to play the game which makes the game fun and the music makes it far more enjoyable.

However, being that the developer is underfunded and has some poor PR skills, I warn you to take caution when buying this game and (possibly) from this developer. Why? Well, the seemingly important feature of multiplayer has been cancelled (and aware that it wasn't going to happen around [i]2 months after 1.8 patch was announced[/i]) with no official announcement on the community hub or the official site (Code Avarice), instead announcing it through Twitter and streams (Source - 5th comment with replies: http://codeavarice.com/post/85125508953/by-mike-paranautical-activity-will-be-receiving-2#disqus_thread). 

This, combined with the long list of hostility towards the game's players due to impatient people demanding updates to the game is why I am giving this game a "No" recommendation. I look forward to the finished game, but the devs have a few things to learn.

Il gioco √® un misto fra The Binding of Isaac e un gioco FPS arena.
grafica pixellosa ma devo dire fatta bene, npc creati abbastanza bene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046276854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1695151829}
review:
This is a wonderful, devious game, made to emulate old school shooters like Quake Arena and Unreal Tournament. The setting of a sunken(?), haunted(?) Nazi ship is very unique, one which I've never seen before, and enemies are bizarre and in some cases disturbing. 

I have yet to beat the game due to it's difficulty. It starts off nice and slow with giant demons and landsharks, but eventually you're fighting ninjas, flaming skulls, and numerous other creatures, each with their own attack patterns and annoying things you have to deal with about them.

There are 5 characters to pick from, each offering a different suite of pros and cons, and each with different playstyles. There's David Bowie, with his powerful crossbow and revolver, Dy-no-mite, with his short range arsenal of a grenade launcher and a katana, Giliad, with his fast firing machine gun and laser, my personal favorite, Gorton, wielding an immensely powerful sickle and a gun that shoots homing explosives, and finally the tank, who deals with how slow he is with massive amounts of health and astonishing firepower.

The gameplay is adrenal, not as much as something like Hotline Miami or Super Hexagon, but still very gripping and exciting, and I found myself physically tense several times while playing. Take this as a good or bad thing, but the game is intense for sure.

The powerups are many and varied, although it does not tell you what they do a lot of the time, and the enemies, as I stated before, can be simply chilling, especially the bosses. Going through that red door, I have faced everything from a floating skull with spiders pouring out of it's mouth to a nazi chainsaw murderer, all of which were tough in their own way. Some bosses have special items that you get when they die, and it makes you really happy when a boss with the item you need comes up. This being a roguelite, that might not happen often, as the levels are procedurally generated.

The game will throw a variety of non-enemy obstacles at you, making the game far more intense. These gamechangers include swinging blades, lava floors, and low light levels, which might not seem very hindering until it happens.

The voxel graphics may be a turn off for some, but I found that I liked them a lot most of the time, and it added a level of uniqueness in it's visuals, along with the amazing lightshow caused by the projectiles and some of the enemies in the darker levels, that made the game all the better.

There are a few things I dislike about this game, from getting stuck under stairs, some glitchyness, and a few annoying enemies, but this being an early access game, I expect that those will be ironed out at some point.

10/10 as an early access game, 9/10 as a full game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064998681', 'num_games_owned': 2308, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1413457698}
review:
This game is everything that's wrong with "Early Access."

The sounds are largely lifted from free sources, game-ending bugs go unfixed (spawning in a room with no exits, anyone?), and the co-op mode that was promised for over a year was canceled.

I bought three copies of this game specifically for the co-op... so that didn't help.

Save your money. I really like "Early Access" as a concept, and I will continue supporting developers who are trying to make solid games on a low budget.

But this was deceptively marketed, and under-developed. Run away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075145279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1447792877}
review:
I have this game on Steam, and I really enjoy it. Here's a breakdown of the short while I've been playing it.

PROS
- Fast-paced do-or-die action gameplay
- Variety of weapons and classes (recently updated and balanced, every class now also has a secondary weapon)
- Variety of enemies (recently updated with a rocket turtle :D)
- Recently updated "free weapon" door (you'll see when you play)

CONS
- You can get stuck under stairs (a pain, given you only have a few hits and no recovery time between hits)
- Some boss doors have pentagrams (a moral preference)
- Some bosses seem unbeatable based on your class (some you need to outrun, like the Snail Skull, but the Tank class is too slow)

NEUTRAL (Pro or Con based on preference)
- Unoriginal cubed "Minecraft" look
- Can't change the music (I happen to like some songs. I've heard by others that they are obnoxious)

TIPS
- Don't stop moving
- Try out all the classes for their weapons to see if you like them before you buy replacements in the gift shop
- Don't underestimate those little dudes... they are surpisingly accurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059558307', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2491, 'last_played': 1424515476}
review:
This game is pretty dang good for some of the best reasons

1.High replayability due to level and loot randomization

2.I herd you liek Boss fights 2 bosses on every floor main bosses marked with a red skull door optional minibosses marked with a blue skull door Main bosses have small variation as to what Loot you get whereas the minibosses can drop just about anything

3.who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned Powerup? just a couple examples are the Heart of gold and the Assault powerup Heart of gold is an instant full health powerup just press q and all your worries disappear unless you only have a max of 3 health then well I'd be worried The Assault powerup gives a HUGE boost to the fire rate of your weapons for a time

The only thing I dislike about this game is... the map but that is only when the level is to big to fit in the zone for the map otherwise its pretty good

author: {'steamid': '76561198069045811', 'num_games_owned': 2441, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1394663801}
review:
From a mechanics standpoint, I cannot recommend this game. It's like they took a good control scheme and deliberatly made it worse. Your character controls awful, and while normally the retro atmosphere would be enough to do it for me this game feels... clunky, I guess?

The boss fights are terrific, but the lack of variety is the real killer for me. I guess the plan was to try and let the randomly generated content make for lots of replayability, but the game is to short to get any unique experiences. The roguelike mechanic just ends up feeling like a padding technique in the end. Nice idea, but poorly executed.

Then there's the elephant in the room - The Public Relations.

These guys are terrible at PR. There have been allegations of censorship, insilts made to the gaming comunity, and several instances of trolls provoking negative responses. It's my personal belief that this is the reason this game was "finished" early - It's not a case of the goals of the developer being met, it's that they just want it to be done with.

I would suggest picking up the games it was inspired from - you'll get a lot more gameplay, for substantially less cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991054974', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1423805870}
review:
Despite the great music and interesting visuals, this has not been a fun game for me to play.  

It should be called Bunny-Hop Activity, because if you're going to survive you will be jumping around way more than is either fun or comfortable.  

The concept of a bullet-hell FPS with perma-death, randomly-generated floors and item drops sounds great, but the execution here is really rough.  The bullet-hell is way too difficult to be fun for anyone less than a pro FPS player.

Also, I they might think they're being cool by not telling you what the items do, and experimenting to see what is what would normally be okay with me, but it is totally unfeasible when you can almost NEVER get enough money to buy items, making experimenting really slow and unrewarding.  That, on top of the fact that most items have nearly un-observable passive effects that make figuring them our nigh-on impossible.  Couple that with the "usable" items and "super weapons" being unable to use until you go to Google to figure out which key does what, because you're given NO INSTRUCTION OF ANY KIND EVER.

I understand learning by experimentation, and games not taking you by the hand, but it has to be fun and worthwhile, like a Binding of Isaac or Dark Souls.  This game is simply not fun enough, rewarding enough, or well enough explained or made to be worth it.

We'll see what happens when it's finished, but unless you have twitch reflexes, and absolute precision I would avoid this game if I were you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963831883', 'num_games_owned': 5245, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1413301691}
review:
Steam's "Early Acces" is about giving you early acces to a game to see it in developement, until it's 100% done, for your early support to the developers. And for your money you should get a product with all the features they promised.

Steam's "Early Acces" isn't about buying a half-made game and be happy after that anyway, no matter if the devs abondon it or cut out important features they advertised.

"On Steam, developers make their own decisions about promotion, features, pricing and publication. However, Steam does require honesty from developers in the marketing of their games." - Chris_D - Valve Employee

Many of us bought extra copies of this game cuz the devs advertised it with a co-op function arriving soon and we all got scammed.
They arrogantly refuse to settle the situation and ban people from the Community Hub who complain about it.

Valve, please protect your customers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977500468', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1387861001}
review:
They advertised co-op as a coming feature to get sales from people looking for a fun co-op game, and then they drop support for it. You can get a little fun playing this on your own for a while, but it gets boring very quickly. Remind me to not support this dev in the future.

Edit - Steam says I have 0 hours on record for this game, but I only played it for 20 minutes because I wanted to save the game to play with friends when co-op is released. That's the way it goes though I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069244438', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1444842734}
review: Meh.  Paranautical activity is...fun, but so so shallow.  It's a roguelike FPS, which is a great game idea, but there just isn't enough content to make this worthwhile.  There are very few different enemies, the rooms all feel pretty much the same, and the bosses are far too difficult.  I know it's meant to be hard, but the difficulty curve starts 100 miles in the air.  Also, the devs say they've abandoned co-op mode, which is disgraceful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993673688', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1416608642}
review:
Take Doom. Now turn the health into hitpoints, turn the graphics into blocks, turn the background music into dubstep, partition the levels into rooms, generate those rooms randomly, and toss in some upgrades you can buy in a shop, and I think that's Paranautical Activity in a nutshell.

If this sounds like you'd love it, I urge you to check the forums, since the game is essentially "finished" according to the developer, which not everybody agrees with. I have no opinion on that -- what I do have an opinion on is whether I like PA, and the answer is no. Playing it just reminds me of better shooters I'd rather be playing, better roguelikes I'd rather be playing and better music I'd rather be listening to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027875462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1499691729}
review:
I wanted to love this game, but there's no "there" there.

Not fun, pointless, no controller support, no multiplayer, and games are generally over in seconds. It's a completely empty experience.

All it has going for it is a retro vibe - but even retro games are more thought out than this train wreck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064206331', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1452660988}
review:
Never mind my old review.

Pros:
Quake-like fps
Challenging game
very little artificial difficulty
Lots of items
Most items have unique affect
Lots of levels
Each character is interesting
Fantastic electric soundtrack

Cons:
Tough learning curve
Vague item descriptions
shop items cost a lot, even on the first floor
some bosses are a bit annoying to fight
the electric sound track may get annoying to some

Over all it's a fantastic game for those who like rogue-lites and quake-like shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963220052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1387768362}
review:
The game had lots of promise, and planned features that won't ever see the day. The developers, in the steam store page, say "We're planning to add multiplayer co-op in the very near future.." and now they have scrapped that feature entirely without any sort of compensation to the people who bought the game for this exact reason. 

Do not buy this game. Do not support Code Avarice (the developers) in any project they choose to move on to. They've taken our money and they've abandoned their game.

As for the actual review:

Pros: Rogue-like FPS.

Cons: Very shallow. Clunky movement. Everything feels the same after playing for 5-10 minutes. There is just so very little content that it is insulting to call it a Rogue-like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035654467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1452556714}
review:
Disclaimer: This review is for an Early Access game, which has changed since this review was written. I have no interest in reinvestigating the current situation, so take it with a grain of salt. The developer has released updates since this review was posted. 

The game itself is not bad. I've found it decently enjoyable. Not a huge amount of replay value, but I got to the end once. The problem with Paranautical Activity is the developer.

The developers have continuously insulted and mocked people who bought their game. In addition, they have been less than honest. The game was marketed for over a year as having co-op incoming (and as of this review, the store page says the developers are still working on it), yet that feature was suddenly canceled. The developers insist they have been working hard on bugfixes and content updates, yet have not released anything, even missing a promised deadline by over two months (patch is yet to be released as of this review). Furthermore, the devs have been silent on the forums (when not aggresively insulting the people who bought their game) and insist you should visit their website, where they will keep people updated; visiting their webiste reveals no new news in two months, and the last message was just an apology for a delay (that has still not been resolved). And when fans have the nerve to say they aren't being treated fairly? The devs say people are "entitled." Do not buy this game, do not support this kind of rude immaturity from developers, do not support Early Access games that are deceptively marketed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045055550', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1537484193}
review:
How do I start? Paranautical Activitiy, currently still in Beta, is such that if someone said "Oh, first person shooter roguelike - wanna play one?" I would tell them "No, are you crazy? I'm awful at first person shooters!" But then this game came out, I saw Bisnap playing it on YouTube, and I literally fell in love with the game. Honestly, I think this game will actually make me somewhat ok at first person shooters, and not the failure I was before I started playing. I've put in a little over 2 hours at this point, as of now I'm loving it, and I would recommend it to everyone - especially since there's multiplayer coming up (as a definite thing the devs are working on), and more content as well (I'm assuming). This game is SOO good and is literally an homage to Edmund McMillen's The Binding of Isaac, one of those games that will forever have a spot in my favorites section on Steam. As a result, this game will, too - for sure.

As a side note, if the devs see this, I just want to mention that there are a couple of bugs I've noticed. First of all, when you start as Tank, you don't have a secondary weapon, and as a result when you press shift the game switches you to the weapon you already have (the shotgun) and resets its shooting timer. As a result, one can manually keep pressing shift to shoot, making the tank an extremely exploitable character. Something else that was actually pretty isolated (only seen once) was that when one of the small people that shoot orange balls of light at me fell down from a higher platform, and it shot at me immediately after, the shot was fired from midair, above where the little guy landed, shortly after it fell. (I apologize if the terminology is off, I don't know any of the character's names except the playable ones and the Gileads.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013378894', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1623930401}
review: This game is quite unique. It has a terrific soundtrack, retro/modern graphics combinedwith the rpg elements of choosing a character. The difficulty increases each time you move up a lvel in the elevator, which is good. Some of the enemies look like something out of doom, but then you have these random Jawas shooting fireballs at you and exploding dinosaurs. The bosses are even better, some so strange that you'll wonder where the inspiration for them came from. Another ineresting element to the game is the money system, in which you collect coins to buy various upgrades that can alter your speed, health and jumping abaility among other things. This game is great as it stands, but if you get it, somewhere along the lin co-op will be introduced, might be a long shot, but would only make it more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055506023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1530276960}
review: It's a strafe fest dungeon grind. Great feeling weapons.  Boss fights are fun and death isn't rage inducing (at least not to me). Highly recommended for a quick fps fix, but it's basically a one trick pony. Get it on special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094868399', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1522018550}
review: Very fun intersting game, which you mostly depend on mobility to survive and dodge attacks. With 5 interesting and balanced classes you are sure to find at least one that you like. The game offers a challage, and can be compared as an easier version of binding of isaac, once you get the hang of the controls. It has interesting and eye catching rooms and models, If you decide to buy it, it will offer a nice looking, entertaining, 3D block, indie, action packed game that will provide hours of gameplay. So I highly recommand you buy this game it is worth the money, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004053899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1397288789}
review:
Great idea, poorly executed. Sure, it's an Early Access game, but it has a long road ahead of it, mostly in usability.

The controls feel very floaty; you have momentum as you move, which is never a good thing in an FPS. There's no descriptions saying what any of the items in the game do; you have to figure it out for yourself if you can't guess. It's incredibly dark and difficult to see, which may well be deliberate. It's very repetitive, mostly due to small variety in the monsters. I'm not sure why there are two bosses on each floor since you only seem to have to fight one to move on.

It's confusing and difficult to play, with nothing to really draw you in to stick with it. If you want a realtime roguelike, there are better entries in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976402798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1396374203}
review:
Game lacks polish. Mouse acceleration is terrible on all settings.  Like old school Doom but without the fun.  Limited weapons, limited rooms, occasionally limited doors allowing continuation of the game.  

Terrible dev support.  Promised multiplayer (and more!) patch for Feb pushed back to March 15th now pushed back indefinately with no ETA.  Do not support this game.  You won't want to play it anyways...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996635677', 'num_games_owned': 2368, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1604522541}
review: One of the first early access games i bought, and I was hyped! I love rogue-likes and I love old school fps games. To start off im not particularly a fan of the graphics but thats not why this game dissapointed me. While the movement feels great, bunny hopping around and dodging bullets are smooth and fun, The shooting isnt as great. The weapons just feel ok (like most pixel fps games) . The devs are also pretty slow in updating the game. I would wait for the full release

author: {'steamid': '76561198059136274', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1559952042}
review: I wish I could rate this game up. It seems like it has potential, but this game just throws you into the game and says "Fuck you, good luck!" Wanna know what would be great? A controls screen! This game has a rediculous learning curve, and this is coming from someone who enjoys play Risk of Rain. This game gives you 2 choices: Either be tank, move slow, and do little damage, or die after 3 hits but be super fast. This game seems like it (I HOPE it) will be better later on, but at this point I cannot hesitate any more to suggest you to NOT get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074944400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1637200735}
review:
This isn't a run and gun game. Its run, gun, and try not to die game. This was as if Dark Souls, Doom, and Binding of Isaac were thrown into a blender and this is the outcome. Its a really great shooter, it reminds of retro shooters where there is no regenerative health. The graphics are really cool, they have voxel like graphics which is really creative. It's also worth mentioning that when the enemies explode into items and red voxels which gives you the satistfaction of killing an enemy, and gets you pumped for more action (along with the door sounds opening when you clear a room). There is a HUGE variety of enemies and bossess as well, so won't get generic grunts all the time. The music is very awesome, it makes you pumped up and ready to kick some butt. The only problem is that there is barely any sound effects, the only sounds are doors opening, collecting items, and your weapon noises.

Overall this game is really great and I highly recomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995183033', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1424102582}
review: Super jeu oldd school pour hardcore gamer, vivement que le coop arrive ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065190836', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1413873834}
review:
It has a fairly large balancing issue where you're always better off as a tank than any other class and you suddenly get swarmed if you make it to the fourth floor, it has a fair few bugs a few alone related to the doors between rooms.

It's a fun idea and all but it lacks any balance and requires a fair bit of bug fixing.

The idea is good but the execution leaves a lot to be desired so you're probably better off spending any money you planned on putting into this elsewhere at present since it is far from a finished product.
Other roguelike/lites are a much better use of time as it stands but if it ends up being made into something a bit more complee I'll be tempted to pick it up again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998951816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1427597593}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070046596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1394336543}
review:
If you like Binding of Isaac, you'll notice a watered down BoI feel when it comes to gameplay. It really suffers when you compare it to said game.. (Top down view will be missed, power ups feel very unneccisary, etc.) However, as its own game, it feels addicting, yet buggy. Controls sometimes fail when loading, classes feel very unbalanced at times, and the bosses either feel underwhelmingly eerie (rather than scary), or straight up punny (Note the nautical in the title.) 

Yet, when I got behind a class I liked (The Tank), I felt like a total badass Hershal. If you look past the flaws and accept that it IS a beta game, and ignore the blatant straight from BoI concepts... It's still addictingly fun.. It has issues, for sure.. but I'd still say give it a chance..

author: {'steamid': '76561198061884881', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1492424656}
review:
Meiner Ansicht nach ein hervorragendes Spiel, mit viel Potenzial, das noch lange nicht ausgesch√∂pft ist.

Der Grafikstil und vor allem die Musik gef√§llt mir sehr, auch wenn in Sachen Grafik ein wenig mehr Abwechslung sch√∂n w√§re.
Die Steuerung ist getreu dem Motto: Easy to learn, "hard to master", und man kommt nach kurzer Zeit in einen regelrechten Adrenalinrausch, der einen erst losl√§sst, wenn man stirbt.
Dieses Spiel kombiniert Rogue-Like und First-Person-Shooter hervorragend.

Mein einziger Kritikpunkt ist die abwechslungslose Grafik.

review:
Quand les vieux FPS (Doom, Quake, ect...) rencontrent les Rogue-Like, cela donne un m√©lange parfait qu'on n'y aurait pas cru au d√©part d√ª √† notre scepticisime avant d'y jouer. Certes, le jeu est difficile √† approcher mais une fois qu'on comprend la strat√©gie des boss et des monstres, tout va bien.

Sinon, si vous avez la trouille d√ª √† un boss trop coriace (Voire √©nervant comme la baleine qui est accompagn√©e par des papillons), essayez de vous couvrir avec l'aide de la porte d'entr√©e de la salle qui, si vous faites la manip correctement, la porte servira de bouclier anti-√©meute. (A condition d'avoir la Gatling comme arme principale sinon, √ßa sera tr√®s difficile de combattre le boss via cette solution qui peut prendre du temps selon le nombre d'ennemis trop mouvants.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994706812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1421785017}
review:
How this got onto Steam is beyond me, every sound effect sounds like it's either been lifted from TBOI or a freesound site and there's seemingly 10 items tops and I managed to go into the exact same room layout (and enemies) 4 times in one level.
 I'm glad I got it with the Humble Bundle because if I'd actually paid money for it I'd feel a lot more cheated.
 It hopefully will become worth playing over time but I don't know why games can't just be worked on and basically finished before being thrown out, the entire thing screams first-game-made-in-Unity and is trying way too hard to be The PainKiller Doom Binding of MineQuake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970441688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1425667684}
review: While in dire need of a difficulty slider this random dungeon crawler/shooter will keep you dying and dying to try again. Still in Alpha, with many features left to go, this ones a good value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040885625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1404903259}
review:
At first, the biggest thing that put me off the game was the name. It's a really lame almost-pun, it just kind of gives me the feeling of "ugh, another crappy indie dungeon crawler". But, after legitimately giving the game a try, I've found myself really enjoying it. It's fast-paced, yet has some depth with different stats, items, and powerups. I find it very fun and it keeps me interested with procedurally generated levels.

At this point in development, there really aren't many different items and powerups, but it is an early access game after all. After reading the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/250580/discussions/0/540731691298129556/]update information[/url] in the community discussions, I was really encouraged.

Overall, at this point in development, I'd give the game a 6.5/10, with certain potential to rise to a 9/10 by the official release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981307801', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1459603299}
review:
The developers are apparently not very friendly towards their player base, insulting them. They also have no professionalism whatsoever, choosing to communicate only through a twitter stream that is cluttered extremely with random off-topic comments. One of the devs seems to care more about streaming than development. They are hypocritical, being annoyed when being called diva devs while they have no issues insulting a portion of their playerbase for using a certain OS or making very unprofessional comments. If they encounter issues, they choose to blame everyone except themselves and not to inform the community through widely read sources nor easy to find back places.

I wouldn't trust them with any money and I'm glad all money I paid through Humble Bundle went to charity rather than them. Let them prove themselves first before spending money on this.

The game itself has potential and has decent game mechanics. That's the only good thing going for it at the moment...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991515318', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1659672900}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039348838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1418498347}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972126747', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1420976436}
review:
FPS Roguelike. It is hard and it will punish you. But it is possible. It takes time to see what items suit your style, personally I love when I get really fast and have the sicle to throw around. Just throw it and run away to see the enemies bump into it. No need to watch behind you so that makes it easier to dodge some random mobs in front of you.

Some friends have said that this is way too hard but I'm loving it and it's getting co-op soonish so it will get even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061167460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1425158231}
review:
This game holds the same characteristics as Binding of Isaac. Rooms randomly generate. As rooms generate, a small map generates at the bottom of the screen. You have bombs and a weapon. There is a shop room where there are three random items you can buy.

All in all, it is just like Binding of Isaac, but in a 3D voxel, techno, FPS style. 

It takes a good computer to run though. Even though the game is small, the voxel art takes up a lot of power. It really slows down your computer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980010740', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1392068187}
review:
You'll like this game if: You like FPS and Rogue-likes, and want to see the two combined with fast paced action and techno music. Even if this sounds remotely like a combination you would enjoy, I recommend following it's development on Steam. 

Read my full review on my blog here: http://bigdadgamer.blogspot.com/2014/02/3-days-ofparanautical-activity.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198020259943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1563759319}
review: Good game to kill time, and also very addictive :P Its like fast paced FPS with combination of Quake and Binding of isaac. Game musics are great too, it's just that there is like 3 or 4 different looping songs, so those will eventually get boring to hear... Would be great if this game had option to add your own music to the playlist :) The way you can move your character, is just awesome. you dont get the feeling like in some fps games: "damn, i could've dodged that but character is just too slow and clumsy to do anything -.-". Personal favorite is that fastest class with thrown boomerang like sickle xD It's just OP against bosses, and another enemies when you just learn to use it right :D Aand yes, the game doesn't lack of fun either, with the good variety of items with, even ridiculous abilities makes your character better killer machine ;P So, the game is good as it is now and playable, but some bugs still exists... but it's what you should except from early access game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015104170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1569017118}
review: this game is awesome

author: {'steamid': '76561198043997367', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1427789237}
review:
would have expected more content from this game after 10 or more tries the rooms just feel the same, hasnt been a memorable update to the game if there even is one. only thing that sames to keep you going are the boss fights plz give some other incentives
ways that would improve the experience as follows;
- Make the main menu more presentable just looks quickly hashed right now.
- More weapon variety and costumization with weapons than the 4 you can use now.
- Give the world of Paranautical Activity a personality e,g charm, character instead of a dark dreary boring rooms even binding of isaac has personality not only through it's art style but through menus/enemies/environment etc.
- Don't ever resort to normal text font for the shop items or anything other than your own, if it isnt worth it to you it isnt worth it to people to play.
- continue with the funny name approach with the guns
- update more regularly atleast month to month bases if it cant be done weekly or alternate weeks.(more reason for people to play everytime there is an update)
- maybe even the option to play with friends online/local co-op through the game (easier said than done i know)

at this place in time i hope it gets improved but right now it isnt really worth it to play
the points are coming from a fellow artist and game developer wishing better for this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198052274740', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1651051987}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038975571', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1417821680}
review: If you're bored, or don't know what to play in your massive Steam-library with games you never touched, just click this game, "play" and select class, and you will thank me. This games fits every cycle of your mood, and when you start playin', you're gonna have a good time. A lot of fast-paced jumping, dodging, running, shooting, fighting, buying, bombing, exploring. And when the multiplayer comes out, it's a must-have!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984115919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1404879656}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032049873', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1414715841}
review: MINECRAFT+DOOM+BINDING OF ISSAC=PARANAUTICAL ACTIVITY. BUY IT IF YOU LIKED DOOM. BUT JUST WANTED MOAR TO SHOOT.  very catchy soundtrack, and it's actually addictive as fuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046454953', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1653276122}
review:
One of the best games I have ever played. The gameplay is mostly inspired by the Binding of Isaac but in a twist with a First-Person View instead. Where do I start with this one? Fantastic graphics, exciting gameplay, and there are so much creativity with this game.

The music however, is what makes me really into the game. I'm not a fan of Dubstep or DnB, but the music in this game is just wonderful, they have that "Pendulum" feel to it. (Favorite track: MACAskill - (Down In The) Trudgemank).

The bosses are pretty bizarre and fun to battle with, some of my most favorite would have to be Poseidon, Dobee (or "The Flying Whale"), and Speiga.

There are 5 characters to choose from when you start a game. These 5 characters include:
Gilead: All-around average character equipped with a Gatling gun.
Gorton: Wielding a sickle that can be thrown, this high speed character takes a while to master.
David Bowie: Above average stats equipped with a crossbow.
Dy-No-Mite!: Hands down, best character in the game (In my opinion of course). Wielded with a Grenade Launcher and a Katana, this character reminds me a lot of the Demoman in TF2. One of the main reason I love this character, is of the massive amounts of bomb upgrades that makes this character very powerful.
The Tank: And last but not least, The Tank. This character is equipped with a Pump Shotgun which is easy to use and very powerful. The only downside of this character is of his speed being very low, hence the name being The Tank, but to counter that there are many upgrades for speed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039277051', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1654271875}
review:
Time for a review with what I call "The hierarchy of what matters in a game" the first being the most important and bottom the least important

~Story: The game doesn't seem to have any story, or perhaps it's less of a spoken story and more of a "your guess is as good as mine" story, but the feel of the game and the environment as you climb higher and higher is great.
~Gameplay: Smooth controls, great aiming, sensical spread to the damage and the enemies remain difficult despite your improvement at the game, ensuring that every game is fun and interesting
~Sound: The audio is simply amazing, the music is addictive on it's own even worth listening to on it's own! The guns have a nice sound to them making them feel quite real
~Replayability: I can see stacking up voer a hundred hours in this game before I grow bored of it and that's if the game doesn't get more content through updates. With the updates I forsee 300+ hours.
~Graphics: Greatly stylised old-school look, taking in the old pixelated guns and making it the style to make this game quite beautiful and always pleasing to look it. The dark theme keeps everything intense in feel and makes sure your eyes focus on what is moving.

All in all: Despite my love for a great story and this game lacking an obvious one, I don't typically expect one out of shooters or most games I buy to lose a few minutes here and there. Adding that to the rest of the game simply being this addictive I can't say much more than it is a must try, the game is lots of fun and can even startle you at times and despite some of the enemies feeling a tiny bit cheap I associate that to my innability at aiming than the enemy itself being cheap.

I do recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043765841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1391388070}
review:
I feel somewhat silly for writing a review for an early access title with less than an hour spent on it, but I'll go ahead and put my thoughts out there anyway. I think I've cleared enough floors and played enough to really judge my experience.

This title aspires to be a throwback to the '90s with an emphasis on constantly moving, strafing around enemies and shooting from the hip. You go from room to room, kill all the enemies within and make it to the boss of the floor before taking the elevator down to the next. Repeat this many times over, with the rooms that you fight in seeming very much the same and the annoying music blaring at all times.

That is Paranautical Activity in a nutshell.
A rougelike take on Doom/Quake this is not. In fact, with all the open seeming environments I was stuck in, it felt more like a grossly simplified voxel take on Unreal Tournament with much less mayhem and enjoyment. Needless to say, I don't quite like this game at the present. It may change for the better due to it being early access, but I think the core designs are already in place and the devs won't flip turn them upside down anytime in the future.

At the very least, I didn't pay full price (a whopping $10) for this. I might be a touch more upset in writing this if I did.
But it WAS the thing I was most looking forward to in the bundle, though...

In closing, I wish the devs the best in improving this...experience and will give future players some advice.
Do not stop strafing, ever. Pick the Tank class if you want a glorious boomstick. The David Bowie class does not have an ultimate move where he transforms into Ziggy Stardust and shoots lasers from a guitar.
That is all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016859256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1391220325}
review:
FIRST IMPRESSION, I WILL GIVE IT ANOTHER CHANCE AND MAY CHANGE MY MIND DRASTICALLY:

The game is advertised as being a roguelike version of Doom/Quake, but ironically Doom and Quake actually feel more dungeon crawl-y thanks to their intricate maze like level designs and emphasis on strategy and resource management. 

Paranautical Activity is basically just a first person Binding of Isaac, in that it just lays out some square rooms at random, populates them with enemies, and calls it a day. In essence, there's really no reason to brag about this game being procedurally generated, because all it really does is switch up the order in which you face the games small pool of monsters while throwing slightly different stats at you.

PA also locks you into every room once you enter it, and won't let you out till you kill every monster inside.  This might have worked for Binding of Isaac since that game was essentially just an arena shooter pretending to be a roguelike, but here it just makes things more mindless. Unlike Doom and Quake where a large part of victory was not only reflexes but picking your battles, escaping at the right time, and thinking strategicly, PA instead reduces things to a guessing game by forcing you to blindly pick which room you enter and than not letting you leave if it turns out doing so might be the smarter strategy.

The controls feel a bit clunky also. I think you have to move for a bit before you accelerate, which feels like shit in a game where moving and turning fast could be the difference between life and death. The enemy designs are decent, but nothing special and are never put to much interesting use thanks to the arena based structure of the game.

Aestheticly it's of course as bleh as it looks. Same not-memorable chiptunes you've heard in a million retro indie games, same cuby graphics you've seen in a ton of Minecraft rip offs. I also have no idea why they thought it was a good idea to name their game a pun based on some dumb horror film people will have forgotten about in a few years.

I think the point of all these action roguelikes is that people want a game that feels like a dungeon crawl but with enjoyable skill based combat and that feels new each time. The combat here may be be skill based, but it's rather bland and the games structure doesn't make it feel like a dungeon crawl at all, it also starts to feel repetitive even on the same playthrough. Doom and Quake did every aspect of this game better, and PA doesn't bring anything worthwhile to the table.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997118766', 'num_games_owned': 2042, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1413535796}
review:
Is there actually any other game where you fight a whale boss? If so, please recommend me one, because thus far no other game has pulled it off other than Paranautical Activity, that I know of.

This game is spectacular, in my eyes. It's not just because of the shiney voxels, The Binding of Isaac-inspired randomly-generated rooms, the way I gasp in joy as I receive a pile of gold from a slain enemy, the wobbles and wabbles of the dubstep soundtrack, or the fact that there's a David Bowie class -- no, I'm being serious.

Despite being denied the previlage to be put on Steam because of the whole adultswim business, Parantautical Activity proudly pulls off what you would call a Binding of Isaac FPS, if you just add lots of shiney lights, weird but freakishly cool creatures, dubstep and voxel-based graphics.

Definitely try this game out, it's truly an experience, indeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040348222', 'num_games_owned': 1011, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1413883071}
review:
Mix a rogue like level exploration, "RPG" elements and permadeath with doom's gameplay mostly focused on dodging incoming projectiles with a minecraft minimalistic aestetic and a nice electro soundtrack and you have Paranautical Activity : A fun and unforgiving shooter you'll pick up here and there to have a blast.

The early access version is perfectly playable and has a quite a lot of content, and since the game is included in the current humble indie bundle along with other great rogueish games its totaly worth picking.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988281857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1390661564}
review:
Twitch shooter fun.

Paranautical Activity is a throwback to the 'old-school' FPS where your reflexes determine your success moreso than your utilization of chest-high walls. Enemies come at you fast and furious from all angles even from the first room you step into, and the increasing variety of enemies each with unique attack patterns keeps you on your toes. Combine that with a dash of random from the procedurally generated layouts along with all sorts of randomized items that can fundamentally alter your playstyle and it makes for an original, highly replayable game.

Though the ultra retro graphics might be a turnoff for some, in reality it goes along way towards making the combat manageable. There are no particle effects or fancy frou-frou textures to distract you, meaning you can easily identify where everyone and every game-ending bullet is, and because of that the game rarely feels like it cheated you. Rather than trying to surprise you with gotcha moments it presents its challenge openly, leaving it to you and your skills alone to survive.

The only major disappointment is in the room sets. While the layout might randomize, each individual room pulls from a fairly limited pool with static monster locations, allowing you to anticipate exactly what you're walking into before the door closes behind you. With any luck, expanding this room pool will be part of the 'more content' the developer is looking to build in before final release.

I greatly enjoyed playing it, and recommend it to anyone looking for a change of pace to the more routine FPS experience. If the lack of overall room and monster variety disturbs you I'd wait and see how the game evolves on its way to a formal release. 

Here's a video look at the gameplay:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wg_xxNn3LE8

author: {'steamid': '76561198066359761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1391980381}
review: Paranautical Activity is a crazy blend of dungeon crawler and first person shooter. If I had to use other games to describe it I would end up using The Binding of Isaac mixed with Borderlands. With that being said the setting of this game pits you against every increasingly difficult enemies and bosses depending on the selection of your rooms. To mix the game up the rooms always have a random enemy spawn rate making it impossible to really prepare for what you will be facing. The bosses offer a great level of difficutly in exchange for an random item that will help you in your journey to clear all the rooms. Eventually you will find a elevator room that will take you to the next level of insanity increasing the spawn rate of enemies and the stats of boss characters. The fast paced action mixed with the frantic dodging of attacks mixes into a great rogue-like formula. The variety of items keeps you wondering what the next thing you pick up will do. Keep on your toes because if your not Paranautical Activity will suck you in and make you press Restart way too many times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058752062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1387852100}
review:
It sounded like such a great concept from the summary

Take a pinch of Doom-esq run/gun, some Spelunky random levels, and the often used basic rougelike elements in order to get the end product of Paranautical Activity

however... once you get past the hype... its pretty dull for a game

it plays like a 3D "bullet hell" game with avatars in the "cube based design" that has been done to death


You die a lot in this game, even for a rougelike its to the point of frustration. Not the good "gah, I was so close" of other titles like Spelunky. But the "ugh, i died. Again." repetitve slog that makes playing this game seem like a chore, more than some recreational gaming


When the enemies are not busy spamming endless projectiles at you, or just swarming you, their combat stratagy shows a decided lack of polish and sophistication... In laymans terms: they are idiotic

You go behind even the smallest of corners, with a small bit of your (unseen) avatar obscured... and its like you never existed. Or failing that, they will just spam a projectile at the wall in vain hopes of breaking it down (which will never happen)



LONG STORY SHORT

It seemed like a good idea, but is nothing more than a disapointing money sink that you will play for a little bit and then uninstall.

Do not waste your time or your money on this game unless you want all the fun of Calculus homework with inflated 16bit graphics

review: One of the best "roguelikes" out there on Steam, if you wanna call it a roguelike. Its random elements keep the gameplay alive, and switching up the classes makes for a new experience every time you play. My only problem is that I play my games on a laptop, and from the second level on, I get SERIOUS framerate issues, a result of the ninja enemy (they generate a ton of voxels when they disappear). It would definitely be nice to get some more optimization options for low-end gamers. Otherwise, this is a fantastic game so far. Keep up the good work, SpooderW!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067594083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1440715137}
review:
Paranautical Activity is a great rougelike that focuses on fast-paced gameplay, as opposed to the calculating style of FTL. Were I to categorize it, I would say it is a combination of a dungeon crawler and a 3D take on Risk of Rain. The progressively harder difficulty keeps you from ever feeling you have beat the game, especially since every playthrough is different.

The character selection is also excellent, with several very different characters. All in all, I find the game to be very fun. It is definitely one of my favorites so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087364678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1418872091}
review: If you like intense shooters and don't mind minecraft-style graphics, you will have fun with this game.  It wraps elements of Doom  and rogue-like together to make a dungeon crawler fps.  You basically run from room to room, strafing about to avoid projectiles from various enemies while trying to elimate them.  You collect loot from enemies and clear out rooms until you find the mini-bosses and bosses of each level.  Each room is optional to explore except for finding the boss room which holds the elevator for reaching the next floor.  Each level has a gift shop that randomly generates 3 items to purchase with gold received from enemies.  The only major downsides to this game is that health is hard to come by at times and you cannot save your game when you quit.  This game is still in beta so improvements are being added all the time, possibly saving will be added later.  One huge plus is that they intend to add Co op in the near future.  This game is fairly hard at times and gets frustrating when you die but it is very fun and addictive.

review:
This was on sale during the holiday sale but I didn't get it, luckily it came with the humble bundle I just bought, and I have to say it is pretty awesome.  I am not a really a big fan of shooters but I love roguelikes and this is a nice combo of the two.  Other reviewers are right, it is definitely a hybrid between Binding of Isaac and Doom! It is pretty difficult at first but once you get used to the fast paced it is very fun.  There is also a giant flying whale in it, need I say more? 

Recommendations:  Make sure your volume is up because the music is great and definitely adds to the fast paced experience,  Also if you are having trouble at first choose The Tank as your character since he moves the slowest and has the most life.

review:
It's about as far as you can deviate from the typical roguelike formula and still be considered a roguelike, and still fun nonetheless. It plays a little bit like Quake, but less reliant on twitch-reflexes, and a little bit like Binding of Isaac, but with less depth.

Still, a very fun game, and with a lot of potential as development continues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961493020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1390684324}
review:
Wow, I really did not expect this game to be so fun! If you like Quake, Doom, TF/TFC/TF2, or any of the faster paced twitch shooters, you will absolutely love this game. The music and fast paced action tie in very well together especially when you're dodging bullets left and right on a killing spree! I can't wait to see more of this game!

One annoying bug was when I got out of the elevator to level 5 -galley, there were no doors anywhere yet the map showed 2 adjacent rooms. Not sure if it's because the content is not created yet or just a level generation bug. I'm leaning towards the latter since the trailer has the developer fighting monsters on that same level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058324910', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1390682022}
review:
Well, take this recomendation with a pinch of salt, the game is still early access (in a very advanced stage as devs say, though). I can't say I totally disliked the game, but there are too many things that wouldn't allow me to raise my thumb for this game. Here's some:

- The overall presentation and menus look very rushed and unpolished, even for an early access game.
- The music, oh god, the music.... 
- The total lack balance overall. Not only between classes, not only between enemies and you. 
- Dying feels often unfair and frustrating. I won't say how many thousands of times I've died in tons of other roguelikes, and yeah, there's a difference between dying by lack of skill and dying because the game is poorly balanced. The second option doesn't make a roguelike good, hard or anything, it makes it an unnecessary pain in the ass that any sane player should avoid.
- No sense of progress at all. TBOI, Rogue legacy, etc.... they have a sense of achievement after each run. Doesn't happen in this game, and that's a no-go for me.

So, I hope you find this list useful, and I really hope the devs work really hard to make a great game, because there's potential.  I haven't been playing too much, so some things could be missing. 
Anyway, the game is on Humble Weekly sale for 1$, if you feel curious about it just go and get it, it won't hurt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967626510', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1621367415}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988312514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1636432629}
review:
What happens when you combine The Binding of Isaac and Quake? Apprantly whales. Paranautical Activity is pretty much exactly a voxel-graphic first person shooter with roguelike room randomization and slight RPG elements in the form of items.

This game plays almost exactly like The Binding of Isaac: You go through a series of rooms arranged Zelda-style and have to kill all enemies in the room before you can proceed. The enemies drop coins which add a dollar each to your total cash which you can use to buy items from the shop on each floor. There are 2 bosses per level, a sub boss and a main boss, each of which give you an item when killed. Beating the main boss allows you to goto the next level. Room locations, enemies, bosses, and items are randomly generated on each level.

Despite this being nearly the same game, it still remains a very fun experience. Being controlled in a first person manner adds some depth to the control scheme, playing very much like old school shooters like Doom or Quake. The music is amazingly catchy, although the sound effects are a little terrible (they sound almost exactly like The Binding of Isaac too). You have a choice of 5 characters to choose from, all with a different weapon (shotgun, crossbow, machine gun, grenade launcher, boomerang hook?) , stats, and playstyles.

This game is still in beta, so there isn't much content yet. There's enough for a complete game, but items tend to become very familiar, very quickly as there aren't many of them to find. The crosshair is a single dot in the middle of your screen which is almost too small at times and there's no option to change it, so hope you don't need one to aim. Mostly, the game just feels unfinished at this point, though still very playable. Get it now when it's cheap and give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960561169', 'num_games_owned': 10294, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1426057183}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049123630', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1390638751}
review:
At first, I was pretty skeptical about what this game might be. A game that claims to mix the gameplay of Doom and Quake with the roguelike aspects of games like The Binding of Isaac? There's gotta be some major patchwork to be done in this game. And it's true, there DOES need to be additional content to be added. Right now, at the time of writing this (January 2014), this game is very much still a barebones basic game (and I'm not talking graphically). 

The gameplay is very satisfying. The level design is random each and every time, so it's got one part of its description on the store page right. It IS like The Binding of Isaac in that way. The randomly generated levels and mix of enemies gives one a feeling of helplessness and unaware of what will come next. Bosses are fairly tough, and defeating one, depending on which character you play, is actually quite rewarding. For example, fighting a boss as Gilead is very different than fighting that same boss as The Tank. 

The character stats, however, are not very balanced. At least all the characters have similar stats, and there's no real pros and cons to choosing one over the other. Out of the ten times I played, I chose Gilead 7 times and The Tank 3 times. Now, while this doesn't exactly seem like a good sample size, you can just look up the character stats online. All of them are fairly even and not balanced at all. I suspect this will get fixed in future patches and updates, and I do hope it does, because if these are actually the final character stats, I can't see myself playing this game much longer. 

Back to the gameplay, the FPS integration is absolutely wonderful. A slightly minimalist HUD, simple weapons, great gunplay. These are the cores of any FPS game in my opinion if you want a good mix of immersion and good gameplay. There's nothing really much to say on the guns and the FPS aspects themselves other than I AM very much reminded of Quake and Doom in the level design, specifically with the wide open spaces you often encounter in the many rooms you'll be running and gunning through. 

Overall, I give Paranautical Activity a 7.5/10. For an Early Access game, it's actually pretty well done. The level design, gameplay, and integration of two vastly different genres are definitely what I found to be unique about the game. However, as with most Early Access games, be wary: developers can just stop updating at any time they please. Vote with your wallet and read reviews like this one first before you purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027213638', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1701447952}
review: Very approachable, You can set the FOV from 60 to 150. Bosses are as difficult as expected. Nice range of weapons and enemy types. I enjoy the art style, very dark and moody yet voxelated. When I think of voxels I think of 8bit type games which reminds me of childhood, so the adult (dark) contrasts the childhood (voxels, fun, light) aspects very well. Gameplay is fun, everything is straightforward, nothing confusing at all. Every room and playthrough is different. Well worth my $1.

review:
Overall, this is an extremely well made game.  The graphics are very reminiscent of doom, especially the view bobbing.  Incredibly enjoyable game, infinite replayability due to the randomness.  The only thing I could suggest is to add more levels.  Right now, there are only about 5 possible rooms, and I have seen them all multiple times.  Perhaps even generating levels on the fly would be a nice solution, however this is a lot to ask for.  More classes might also be nice.

Great game, my money was well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1413891034}
review:
Edit 2: I actually beat all the bosses a while ago on the first try, but stopped there because the game just didn't feel like much fun.

What could be a great game is ruined by class imbalance, difficulty in aiming with certain guns as you dodge enemy bullets and lack of information on boss attack patterns.

Heres a small example of why this game sucks:

You are playing with a 3/3 HP class, boss has a lot of health, you haven't got upgrades or double jump because the game is just starting, you already used your few bombs on another boss. The boss spawns 5 spiders that quickly come at you while the boss keeps shooting fast travel speed bullets at you... and it keeps doing that until you are dead. So you have to move and aim around a small room with hill-like object placement, forcing you to stay rather close to the boss, but because the boss shoots with fast moving bullets, you can't dodge all of it because you also have to focus on evading and killing spiders, ESPECIALLY if you are using a single target, slow weapon

http://paranautical-activity.wikia.com/wiki/Skullito

Here's another frustrating example:

You complete stage 2 and pick up a powerup that decrease your speed but increases your damage.

The next boss you meet hits you for 5 damage (5x1 quick hits because he's so fast) every time after he casts his special attack because you are too slow to run from him, even if you are running from one end to another, or around the walls.. it takes you 20 hits to kill him, but before you can do that, he's already killed you in 3 combo attacks. like, wtf seriously

http://paranautical-activity.wikia.com/wiki/Hanz <---

7/10, would not recommend at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036313409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1474160406}
review:
What can be said about this game that hasn't already been said. When I first saw this I rolled my eyes and said great blocky graphics.... again! Now let me say that i am not a graphic whore. I enjoy 2d games over all and I am nuts for roguelikes. So I saw this game on the Humble Rogulike Bundle and said, "Hey, why not?"

This game is absolutly amazing. It combines the fast paced FPS of classic Doom with the randomized dungeon crawling of Roguelikes flawlessly and the visual style is mind blowing! It is unforgiving and should not be played by someone expecting deep story and lore. This is simply going room to room killing... monsters of some sort for loot and coins. I don't think i've gotten past four rooms before getting slayed. In Paranauutical, it's never been so fun to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024505824', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1430957019}
review:
Ok this game is INSANE, and I MEAN INSANE IN A GOOD WAY! This has to be the most toughest and yet addicting games I have ever played in a while.

You start out with a selection of people to play as and then off you go, no explaining, no story, just go out there, kick some @$$ and DON'T DIE. The monsters are weird as hell even as voxels, and the Bosses are a BIT.CH to kill, but once you kill them, gives you that really good feeling that you kicked that boss real good in the @$$... But it gets worst from there. More and more of those bloody bast*rds get more crazy, more strong and what not. When you die, you don't want to quit, you just want to keep playing to get to a higher level than last time you died. The use of RPG elements is actually workable as well. Gives you a bit of those other games with RPG Elements like Saints Row 4, Wolfenstien, Bulletstorm and so on.

Music is amazing, mostly the song that plays in the trailer. When I heard that, it made me scream "DIE DIE DIE YOU F***ING BLOODY BAST*RDS!!!" with a side of Dubstep with that. 

Quality of the game is like that of Minecraft meets Doom, it just sounds awesome even saying that... well when I think of it.

So overall, it's a blood bath orgy of fun. Music: Awesome. Graphics: Nice. Monsters: @$$holes... But still fun. Game in general: Awesome Sauce Overload.

The one thing I would like for them to add is some Achievments, some sort of leaderboard to show how far you got, and some Steam Trading Cards, just for the hell of it. Plus the game is still in a Early Access so I bet the company that made this will add some stuff like that in the late future.

Yes Or No Verdict? F*** Yes, get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013758093', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1414277672}
review: Un juego del tipo "Binding Of Isaac" de partidas generadas al aleatorio, fren√©tico y magn√≠fico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037208606', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1415851406}
review:
At its current state it is really boring.

BUT DUDE IT'S A RETRO DOOM-CLONE, IT'S A RETRO QUAKE-CLONE.

Okay, if you wanan play DOOM buy it off of Steam/GOG and put the .wad into the downloadable ZDoom application, bam now you got DOOM. Want Quake? Go to Quake Live's website, it's F2P, minus the P2W. They both do the emphasis on movement so much better. Also, if you call this a DOOM clone, you're being an idiot and I'd question if you've even played DOOM.

The enemies are really dull, and are just hitscans. Yeah strafing is fun, but why not just play strafing in the game that does it best, Quake? i.e. why play shitty Quake-clone mechanics when I can just play Quake?

Okay, what about items?

Oh good luck finding those. Binding of Isaac was a lot nicer about giving fun items. The items are dull. You might as well be playing Quake with a few mods, as this is basically Quake + Binding of Isaac, but being shit at either.

Mechanics are uninspired, dull, and level generation is really dull too, AI is horrid.

tl;dr it's a shitty Quake clone, with less fun guns, ugly visuals, and dull levels. Why play this when you can just play Quake?

author: {'steamid': '76561198025363556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1392569880}
review:
Ich habe mir dieses Spiel gekauft in der Erwartung, eine Art Serious Sam in anderer Grafik zu erhalten.
Diesen Anspruch hat es auch gr√∂√ütenteils erf√ºllt.

Das Gameplay ist aktuell recht unsauber und f√ºhlt sich nicht ganz perfekt an. Da gibt es noch Optimierungsbedarf.
Sch√∂n ist die Levelgenerierung (wie auch in Binding of Isaac z.B.), die jedem Spiel einen individuellen Touch gibt. Am Anfang wird eine Auswahl an Waffen angeboten, mit denen man k√§mpf. Anschlie√üend betritt man die R√§ume, woraufhin Gegener spawnen, die bek√§mpft werden wollen. Erst danach √∂ffnen sich alle T√ºren des Raumes wieder. Ist ein Level clear, geht es mit dem Aufzug weiter ins 2. Level, wo neue Gegner warten, die den Spieler t√∂ten wollen.

Fazit: Ein nettes Spiel mit einer (in meinen Augen) schicken Voxelgrafik. Leider ist die Steuerung und Kontrolle (aka der Skillfaktor) nicht ganz rund, [b]aber es ist ja noch ein Early Access Spiel[/b]. Auf jeden Fall einen Blick wert!
