author: {'steamid': '76561197964009814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1389697344}
review:
I am excited to see how the finished product turns out.  Even though this is an alpha/beta build with a good number of glitches.  I had a good time with the 6 hours I played it.  

The basic idea is that each level is sort of square built like Zelda on Nintendo (or more recently Binding of Isaac) where you get randomly generated levels, collect power ups, fight random bosses, and move to the next floor.  The twist is that it is a first person shooter with a lot of water based monsters/weapon/power up ideas.

In its current state it is fun, but flawed as the monster curve through the levels generally out paces your power ups.  Most games end not through skill but an unfair situaiton, but I imagine those will be worked out over time. 

Anyone who played it during this alpha/beta phase knows that if you have a grenade launcher/no speed upgrades and you fight the chainsaw boss... just restart because your dead anyways.

The power ups were fun and creative - at times I felt like I was playing a strange Quake Mod and other times it just funny.  The music is also energetic.

A pretty cool game for the price - as of 1/14/2014 - I will revisit once the game has been fully updated and complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965735144', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1459221651}
review: Classic run fast, shoot fast, think fast arena action.  Variety of weapons and power ups is amusing and satisfying to collect.   Plays precisely the way a first person Rogue-like-like should, and was pretty much everything I wanted the Doom RL to be.  Soundtrack is hella solid and endorses the deucing of demons properly.    Execution of concepts is excellent.  Just, plain, fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981614050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1577073191}
review:
Looking for a game that is challenging, but has similar feels to classic first person shooters like Wolfenstein, Doom, and Quake? Then this game is perfect for you. Paranautical activity takes on a perfect random level generation feel like the game Binding of Isaac mixing it with room textures of Wolfenstein (hence the Nazi flags on the wall) making every time you play different from the last. In this game you take on a wide variety of unique enemies, bosses and power-ups as you progress through the games ever changing levels. 

The game is as far as I know is still in the early access stage, but it has very high potential for being a very good game and is relatively cheap. So if you want something fun that will get you stuck playing for a while, I encourage getting this game.

review: The "About the Game" says exactly what makes it an awesome game. Having a twitch shooter element in a rogue is a match that might not work, but the devs have executed the combination with expertise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960453139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1408160851}
review:
Fun old-style shooter with random powerups which make each playthrough different. Gameplay similar to Quake2/Painkiller/Serious Sam, kiting is a must and prioritizing enemies is key.

Worth every penny, it claims to be in beta but is fully playable right now, and is plenty entertaining. Starts off easy in the difficulty curve, and ramps up as you go deeper into the dungeon. Personally I've found the first few floors to be a cakewalk and the later enemies to be much more challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061863902', 'num_games_owned': 1553, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1423979316}
review:
This game .........God.......Dam .......WERE HAVE U BIN ALL MY LIFE!
it mixes all the good parts of 90s fps with super random levels like in games like pixal dungeon<- (game for moble phones)
its fun and VERY chalanging i have a hard time geting to lvl 3 the game has a nice sound track that get u pumped up there are a bunch of starting classes that sport there own states and starting weapons but u can swap the weapons out by buying new 1s at the store witch spawns each lvl with a random selection of stuff the rooms aprear to be emtay intill u enter them then it spawns random monster for u to fight and kill or be killed there are a few items u can get off monsters  includeing coins<-money for the shop, bombs<-2ntary weapon for all classes, hearts<-healh, Shelds<-armor,and a possable powerups  witch u can hold and save 1 for later u can only hold 1 so make sher its what u need there are 1 boss and 1 mini boss each floor u need to only kill the boss to procees to the next floor thoe i HIGHLY recamend u clear each floor to get the permanat upgrades like extra damage or helth and all the coins all in all this game is totaly worth the few dollers is it atm 100% replayable do to the random nature of the game u never see the same stuff twice. 10/10 in my books

author: {'steamid': '76561198011516457', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1413952512}
review: Fantastic twitch based FPS roguelike! The pixel graphics and fantastic lighting give paranautical activity a fantastic original look but what really makes this game shine is the endless twitch shooting fun.  Enemy variety, weapon layouts, stat based characters, sweet soundtrack, this game has it all.  If you are looking for another roguelike with it's own twists on the genre than look no further than Paranautical Activity.  Whether you play it for 5 minutes or 5 hours you will find something new to love each and everytime you play it.  Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003552620', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1450794996}
review:
"Yes with an if, no with a but"?  I wish there was a "sort of" review recommendation option.  If you watch one single video of the game for more than 10 seconds - congratulations you have seen every single thing it will ever do.  What's good about it is actually quite good - the old-school movement and shooting - but it's so incredibly thin on content and doesn't quite nail the execution well enough to recommend it.  I feel like someone needs to sit these people down and explain three things to them very clearly - 

1.  Your game is really not interesting or varied enough to have the rogue-like No Saving Permadeath concept attached to it yet.

2.  If you are going to go shallow as a puddle, execute the living shit out of it - movement and shooting should be like butter, not kind just 70-80% there and rough as shit at times.   If you are going to go for random procedural stuff bigtime, you need an awful lot of it, not just the same rooms and enemies over and over again.

3.  Please go and play Robotron some more until you understand points 1 and 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039031228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1728, 'last_played': 1552948717}
review:
Takes me back to the days of Quake and Unreal Tournament. A wonderful game that takes some getting used to, but will definitely give you an adrenaline rush once you get the hang of it. 4.5/5.0.

As a side note, while this topic doesn't change my view on the game so far, it still needs to be addressed: The devs really need to get to work on this. Promising Co-op in "the next update" more than 6 months ago and still not releasing it yet isn't a good move if you want to keep your consumer base. Don't get me wrong, the game is still great; it is still an adrenaline rush to play, especially on the later levels, but the lack of love from the devs, from the promised bugfixes to the approaching vaporware status of Co-op, really hinders what this game could achieve. 

All in all, if you're a fan of the twitch-action shooter, than PA is up your alley. If you're hestiant about buying the game though, I'd recommend waiting until the Co-op update is released before purchasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027357843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1431634791}
review: Paranautical Activity is a game that is not unsimilar to a mixture of The Ace of Spades, Doom, and The Binding of Isaac. It is a pixelated, first-person shooter mixed into a roguelike game like TBOI. Each run is different, the levels are randomly generated, and there are numerous weapons to choose from. Also similar to TBOI, there are Shops in which you can buy powerups, new weapons, upgrades, etc. There are bosses at the end of each level, along with other mini-boss rooms that can be found on each level. Each of these give you a power-up, new weapon, boost, etc. that can help you throughout the game. Despite the game being rather Linear at times, it is a lot of fun to play, for it is both attention-grabbing, fast-paced and challenging. This game, if there were a star system on steam for players, would easily get an 8/10. I would highly recommend this game to anybody who likes fast-paced, roguelike FPS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259317', 'num_games_owned': 4297, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1421207379}
review:
Buy? Maybe. (Note, this reflects an Early Acess game that will likely change over time, potentially negating this review. Dec 23, 2013).
PA is best described as a rogue-lite FPS, where the gameplay mechanics are boiled down to the near most simple understandings of the FPS model. The goal is to reach lower floors, but I'm not sure if there is an end due to my constant dying. Nagivating each floor is much similar to the Binding of Issac and NES Zelda - Enter a rectangular room and clear the are of enemies before you can advance. The game controls near exactly like the original Painkiller and early entries in the Quake and Unreal Series - fast movement, circle strafing, and bunny hopping. The hook of PA is using your skill to stay alive with your limited health and advancing with a mix of your class weaponry, passive power-ups, and active power-ups. 

Classes include Crossbow user, Sickle thrower, Grenade Launcher, a Minigun user and a shotgun user (I forget the names of these classes, except Tank for the shotgun user). Each have their advantages and disadvantages in terms of weapon mechanics, secondary weapons (if any), damage output, range, and health. You can also get other weapons from gift shop if you are able to save up enough cash from them, which is often tough (Weapons seem to cost more than I have ever earned early in game, and when I do save up good funds, I'm usually on level 3-4 where I die). Enemies are varied, some which shoot a single a bullet or two every two seconds, some shooting a continuous hail of bullets, or even those that can nearly teleport to you for melee or enemies that can hop towards you and explode on proximity. What most shooting enemies have in common is that their projectiles aren't hit scan, so it takes timing, skill, and room knowledge to be sucessful. Each floor has a miniboss that usually provides a power-up, money, and sometimes health, weaponry, or items.

The art direction is much like 3D Dot Game Heroes with an interesting lighting selection - where there are very few lights but each projectile also emits projectiles. However, most players will simply say something like "DARK MINECRAFT VOXELS WITH GUNS". There is not much sound assets besides gun shots, door openings, item chimes, and the player's "Oof!" from being hit. Much of the sound is in the form of a nearly rave-like techno beats that reminds you of other "Futurisitcky" games like Wipeout, Extreme G, or Forsaken.

I actaully personally enjoy the base mechanics and idea behind the game - it's actually very easy to get a grasp of circle bunny hopping and learning when is a good time to strafe or sometimes stand still. You can skip the majority or at least the remainder of the floor if you desire, provided that you are able to find the boss room quick enough. The game is both easy since I am decent at shooters and because circle strafing the whole room though the entirety of a fight is almost always sucessful, but hard due to limited health, and the unprediticable nature of roguelikes (random enemies, random power ups, random room types).

My main problem with this game is once you reach level 3 or 4, you often encounter enemy flying skulls which are often hard to dodge, can gang up on you and "combo air juggle" you against a wall, and what makes it worse is that they can get so close to you that are behind the point where your bullet will spawn, leaving you literally defenseless (unless maybe you have a melee weapon). This is compounded when you have a group of skulls that for me, seem impossible to deal with unless I'm in a room with a floor plan that will block them or at least slow them down a bit. And of course, like Rogue-lites/like (and Adult Swim games apparently) it needs to be punishingly hard, so despite me doing well up to this point, I die and have to start all over again. Since I'd like to clear my massive Steam backlog, "Ain't nobody got time fo' dat". But unlike other rogue-lites where it seems like patience, skill refinement and a bit of luck will help you beat the game, I hit this brick wall to completion once I meet these skulls and my enjoyment of this game is wiped away, much like my progress once I see that annoying Restart or Quit screen.

Paranautical Activity is very enjoyable, but a fairly shallow experience, which is multiplied by having to constantly restart. If you are into the resurgence of rouge-like style games as well as old schoold FPS games, there's a fun and simple game to be found here. But I fear the skulls will kill many player's enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031725442', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1388483632}
review:
OK... this game is awesome

I really like this game. 
The gameplay and controls are simple, its not like other games where the game forces a tutorial at you so you can learn the game. The fun thing is to learn about the game as you play.
The game is also challanging at some points, but that is a good thing for a game like this.
The art style is cool with the glowing lights and the blockshaped world.
I like the weapons, I wish they would make more.
If you like the binding of Isaac then you are gonna live this game, there are very much alike
The soundtrack is also AWESOME!!

The issues that I have with  with this game is that it can be a bit slow at some points, because sometimes you have to go through many rooms that you have already cleared to buy items and get all the way back to the next floor
Also this is just a personal issue... my computer does not go well with this engine, but I found a way to solve it

I recommend this game to people who likes fun and challanging games. This game is addictive and has a lot of replayabillity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008276894', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1420071897}
review:
If you like roguelike games, you should buy it! I know I haven't got much hours recorded, but don't forget, that this game was firstly released on Desura. So when I got enough from The Binding of Isaac. I mean I got enough from dying, and failing, I looked up on Desura, and found this gem. It's basically a BoI in FPS view, but if you play it more, and more, you slowly understand, that this game, is different. And when you hear MACAskill's perfect soundtrack for this game, which drives you even, when you are not in that mood, you will realise, that this game is awesome!

Since it's in Early Access, bugs will occur, but it's already super fun! 3 words: BUY IT NOW!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985391745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1414196113}
review: Decent game as it currently stands in its phase of development. It's essentially an 3D FPS Binding of Issac in gameplay sense.  Apparently they are in the works of adding a coop mode and achievements, so that will add some more fun to the game in the future. However, currently there is not much room for replayability other than beating the game mutliple times with different characters.  All characters are unlocked at the beginning, there are no item unlocks for doing certain things, no unlockable bosses, one final boss, and no story.  Played it for about 5 hours and probably won't play again until they further update it. As it stands, great Early Access game and I recommend you getting purchasing it when it is on sale for ~$3 or less!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042557351', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1534431205}
review:
[h1] An older rogue-lite shovelware... [/h1]

[b]What It Is:[/b]
A relatively barebones roguelite from early in the days of the genre revival.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
You begin with one of several unique characters, shooting enemies and progressing room to room as you do in most roguelites. It has a very quake-like movement system.

[b]Difficulty:[/b]
Unbalanced at best, far too hard at worst. Item drops are near non-existent, currency drop rate is wildly too low, progression is sporadic rather than somewhat linear.

[b]Graphics:[/b]
Ranging from charming voxel based to absolute MS paint drool. Lighting is some of the worst I've seen, with no real way to improve it.

[b]Audio:[/b]
Grating, awful electronica.

[b]Replay Value:[/b]
High, but not relevant at this point with better titles available.

[b]What I Like:[/b]
It was a good game when it came out. The characters are unique and offer a lot of play style variety in the beginning of the game. Its bosses are some of the more unique I've ever seen, on the level of Enter the Gungeon.

[b]What I Don't[/b]
It never received the updates that it should have, and this was primarily due to the childish actions of the developer. Having your game pulled from Steam is one thing, but then to get it reinstated and completely blow off any semblance of QoL improvements is...sad...at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995823401', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1431914650}
review:
Great game, if it were being updated regularly. Slow updates plague many genres like this, and while I may have bought this game I do not reccomend this game for anyone who is fans of "roguelike-likes", as you may be highly dissapointed right now with the level of content (many alpha/beta roguelikes suffer from this) before finishing the game. There is little playability besides different weapons, which can (and should be) purchased from the shop on a playthough, and the enemies have little to no variation besides melee enemies, enemies with straight shot, and enemies with a slight homing shot.
 Needless to say, the devs need to change the, "We're planning to add multiplayer co-op in the very near future, as well as a ton more content, and of course some bug fixes and polish.‚Äù to "We're on Valve time only we're not Valve."

More seriously, promising content that trickles out very slowly (last update was in October, after I purchased the game) when being in the early access is little more than getting a functional beta with less than beta content. The game has nothing that sets it apart from many other alpha/beta Roguelike-likes either, leaving it barren, not to mention the graphics are currently (hopefully) developer art, and will be just a bit more developed, but I'm not holding my breath.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988745013', 'num_games_owned': 774, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1710105697}
review: If you like Binding of Isaac and you like FPS, you will enjoy Paranautical Activity. It just doesn't get more pick-up-and-play than this; it's fantastic for 10-15 minute sessions. There are bugs from time to time, but it's in beta still, so that's expected. There has been one time there was a bug that made me restart, but I'm pretty sure that's since been patched. My only gripe about the game is some item abilities are unclear, but aside from that it's great, mindless fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030055965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1413920551}
review:
Alright, now that is the best dungeon crawler/rougelike/generated-levels-arcade since The Binding of Isaac. A hybrid of that one and the classic shooters, it gives you a unique experience. It may be an alpha, but it is so playable I would call it the Steam's best Early Access 2013. It definetily is worth its money and I suggest you buying it for you and your friends right now.

The only downside is that the game's interface doesn't fit the 5:4 screen, but it can also be fixed by changing the resolution to any of 16:9 formats.

review:
Unfortunately in it's current state I cannot recommend this game. I liked doom and while this kinda mirrors that games concept it does not reach it's potential. It needs a overhaul in all departeemnets. I like the graphics, but they still need depth texturing and rendering in order for a decent amount of valid perception. The lighting however is great. The sound is what really disrupts it's plaaaaayability. The music is annoying and needs different tracks with ambience. Also needs gamepad aassimilation and a story campaign.

Basiclly the game needs a complete restructuring with the same lighting and graphics style with enhanced texturing and shadows.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991441179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1551576767}
review:
If you throw Binding Of Isaac, Quake and Minecraft into a blender, you would get Paranautical Acitivty.

Even in and early state, this game is a lot of fun but clearly lacking features.

You start the game choosing presets of weapons, so far I prefer the shotgun although you dont get a secondary weapon and it is slow, so it has its cons.

It uses a similar random room system as Binding Of Isaac which helps keep the game from feeling non linear, In its current state you will be facing the same type of enemy a lot.
So far I have seen maybe 4 or 5 types of enemies excluding boss battles.

It controls like a twitch shooter like the early days of quake, and gaining powerups to double jump etc. adds a lot of fun jumping and dodging bullets around the rooms.

The minecraft esque graphics look beautiful with a great lighting system. When you destroy enemies and explosive barrel's you will see a lot of 'particle' like effects which look great.

In its current state I would give this game a 6/10, I have not read about the upcoming features but this could easily be a 7 or 8/10 game when it is completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972230822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1425263828}
review: Paranautical Activity is one of those games I picked up during a Steam sale on the grounds of "it's three dollars, why the hell not?" It's pretty much an FPS version of the Binding of Isaac, set in an undersea Nazi fortress (?) populated with demons, mutants, and affiliated scum. Each floor is composed of randomly selected preset rooms, which lock until the player kills all the enemies therein. As you move down the different floors, more hazards are introduced, such as lava and bladed pendulums. Bosses battles are randomized, divided between mandatory (the room with the elevator to the next level) and optional, and an easy way to get free items. The game is fun, in an arcade-y "how far can i make it" sense, though it's not without problems. The dim lighting and voxel-based graphics sometimes make it hard to pick out enemies from the background, and getting movement powerups makes it very easy to run into something dangerous in the often cramped rooms. The different weapons are often more trouble than they're worth-the shotgun and the sickle are your best choices, hands down, and even then, you're at the mercy of whatever powerups are randomly generated in boss rooms or the store in terms of damage or firing rate. That said, the soundtrack is extremely catchy, and it's hugely fun dashing through the levels when you luck out and get the right upgrades. Though I'm not sure I'd pay ten dollars for it, it IS a fun little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041555483', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1638102512}
review:
A great rouge-like game. Mixes ideas from Binding of Isaac with first person shooters that has a Quake/Doom feel to it. The replayability isnt too great at the moment (This review is being written while it is in early access.) Also The devs have mentioned they are working on multiplayer co-op and are also going to be adding a ton of new content. I have yet to beat this game but it sure does provide a challenge in the later levels. (Things crawling on the walls, projectiles everywhere, etc.) I would say this game is worth buying. It's really fun and quite a challenge and i'm sure once the Multiplayer co-op with all the new content is released it will be even better. I'd give it a 8/10 because there are some minor flaws such as it needs more content (Items to be exact, maybe more weapons aswell. Not to mention maybe some more room layouts.) but other than that it's a great game and I highly reccommend giving it a go.

After Early Access edit: Well, the old developers went completely haywire and did some stupid stuff, but now there's a completely new owner and hopefully they take the game in the right direction. My old review still stands as it is still pretty fun to play.

2nd edit: The new devs have done absolutley nothing. This game is just a mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969396973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1387072855}
review:
In its current state, it needs much more work. This is an early release game so I'm sure it'll get better but, so far, the controls definitely need a bit more fine tuning. The action is not very exciting yet either. I feel that there needs to be greater feedback letting you know when you actually manage to hit an enemy. Another problem I ran into is the inability to bind any actions to my mouse. By default, Bomb is set to Mouse 2 but when I attempted to change the button to Jump, the game rejected the change. 

On a positive note, the visual style is fun and all of the colored lights takes me back to the days of Quake 2. The music is also very cool and fittingly frenetic to match the game. I love fast-paced shooter games and I'll be keeping an eye on this one as I wait for the bugs / polish to improve. For now, I cannot recommend purchasing this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059152864', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1451762202}
review:
Paranautical Activity is an excellent roguelike dungeon-crawling shooter, with simple humbling textures, and a charming implementation of voxels. This game's satisfaction, consisting of fighting off hordes of demonspawn, and cracking open phat lewts is only matched by that of the speed and finesse the player as they weave and blast their way through randomly generated rooms. All set to a spicy hardcore techno beat, valliantly played through the entire game.
In addition to promised future updates, Paranautical Activity is absolutely worth the purchase to support its development. I personally await anxiously to play this game again in the future when I have a computer with enough hardware capacity to play this game without strong lag. 

     8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060460564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1413256317}
review:
Paranautical activity is a rogue like game in a FPS format. the developer (accurately) describes it as "the binding of isaac meets doom". the movement feels exactly as those old school tittles. the movement is very important on this game, strafing and jumping are very important elements of the game. The rogue like-nes gives it change constantly the way you play and develop strategies while you advance on the levels. It forcies you to thing about how you want to build your character through the game even before starting.

Paranautical activity is aiming at all the right directions. It has a fast peaced gameplay and a handfull of items to keep it diverse. However, what keeps me from playing are all the unfair situations i encounter while playing. Being too slow and have a room full of homming proyectiles comming behind you or entering a room with only one hearth left and have a machinegun demon spawn on your back is horribly stressing, and makes me rage quit. But it has that refreshing thing to it's gameplay that makes you feel like a badass when you cleanup an entire room, and always keeps you wanting more.

This game has major bugs and broken mechanics, but the developer hears the community. these problems will be fixed over time, but i would wait until full release. This will be a purchase you will not regret at any moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009392461', 'num_games_owned': 2713, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1413334334}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019405086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1583616209}
review:
WHat do you get if you combine the Player movement found in Quake III, add Voxel graphics and elements of a Rougelike? You get THIS little pearl of an FPS-Shooter that plays itself what could be described as Binding of Isaac with Guns in First-Person.

While it is Early Access it already provides a TON of fun and a truly challenging difficulty that is made for those who seek an adrenaline-coaster of a shooter. You move and shoot very fast, but die even faster if you are careless!

A fair warning to those that prefer a more "easy-going" shooter where you do not have to pay attention to every moving pixel on the screen: This game is not for you. It is REALLY fast and can get ridiculously fast-paced and frantic, so those who cannot really take too much stress are better off with other games (Sorry, but this really is getting frantic fast and keeps that pace going all the time).

The shooter elements are incredible and have this "Quake" feeling, able to move and shoot in one fluid motion. The shooting seamlessly combines with moving, jumping and the enemies keep you going in many different ways (even though there are not a lot of different types). The item system is well-implemented and even though there are not too many of them they offer more than just an increase in stats, but also unique effects that are real game changers.

tl;dr: A game that plays like a mix of Doom and Binding of Isaac with Voxel graphics, clever items, fast-paced and challenging gameplay and just a handful of bugs to boot. Also Zombie Nazies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984338378', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1490844337}
review:
yay reviews i can finally stand on a soapbox and preach my opinions to nobody

I want to like this game, I really do. I remember playing the earlier (alpha) versions and thinking, "man this could actually be something with more active weapons and varied level design". I personally cannot stand the music at all (it's incredibly obnoxious) and plenty of people criticize it for using voxels because MINECRAFT, but I looked past those faults because I really liked the gameplay. However, the devs get so close yet end up so very far away from realizing the potential of this game with every update - add more enemies but don't add more attack patterns for already existing enemies, switch from random weapon spawn to classes but remove difficulty via adaptation in the process, add more bosses but don't fix the fact that bosses either spin around in a circle or incessantly +forward into you, finally add being able to hold a second weapon but make it a fixed "superweapon" that you can't switch out from, etc.

The game screams "I WANT TO BE A GOOD DOOM AND ROGUELIKE HYBRID BUT MOM AND DAD WON'T LET ME BECAUSE WE WANT PEOPLE TO BE ABLE TO USE A CONTROLLER (which completely defeats the purpose of the free movement currently exhibited in the game)"

review: At the time of this review, while the game is still in early access, there's a laundry list of issues with lighting, movement, sound, and how the level generator makes and populates your killing grounds. It has a lot of potential that will probably never be fulfilled because the devs are extraordinarily dismissive of critique to the point of abandoning their reddit and steam forum and designating 'lucky' volunteers to send them 'select' posts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016510845', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1379009348}
review:
DO NOT BUT THIS GAME.

this is literally one of the worst games i've ever played in my life.

the aesthetics are universally offensive. graphics are hideous, enemy and weapon designs are laughable, music is eardrum-bludgeoning garbage. the weapons themselves are horribly unfun to use, with no sense of weight to them and no sense that they are inflicting damage on anything you aim them with. every audio asset in this game is stolen. enemies don't even react when you shoot them, whether it be with a crossbow or a grenade launch. even wolf3d and doom gave you enough feedback that it felt like you were firing weapons that damaged the target, something that this title has completely failed to do. all of this might have been forgivable if the game was in any way enjoyable to play, but to top everything else off it also controls like steaming garbage. you move like a greased pig on ice skates and the limited field of view and terrible movement guarantees that you will get hung up on the slightest obstacle in your path.

the real crime here isn't that this game was yanked from greenlight, it's that it was ever allowed on steam to begin with, and i sincerely regret that even a single cent of my money has gone into the developers' pockets.

EDIT: since i have written this, this game has been taken off steam because Mike "SpooderW" Maulbeck threatened to murder Gabe Newell on Twitter. at this point this miserable software abortion was removed from steam and Maulbeck resigned from code avarice. except code avarice hired him again and sold this garbage heap to another publisher to get it back on Steam. do not pay for this game. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

DOUBLE EDIT: I have been permabanned from this game's forums lmfao.

TRIPLE EDIT: I have been unbanned. This game is still bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986929095', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1457663311}
review:
Take Doom, add some roguelike elements, some bosses, items, neon lights, crazy music, and you got Paranautical Activity.

For 10 dollars, it's worth the few hours you will put into it. If you like old shooters where you move fast, and roguelikes, this is for you.

Enemies are all unique, tough the limited content makes it a bit repetitive after 30-ish long playtroughs, given you get fairly far.

Still worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990744159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1477246835}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029603634', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1401429604}
review:
Gameplay is just like Serious Sam: Walk into room. All enemies either run at you or start shooting slow projectiles. Kill them all. Repeat.

One key difference is that the enemies are dead silent, rather dimly lit, and deal a lot of damage. When you walk into a new room, you can easily run backwards into a 12 foot high Satan and lose three hearts in an instant. You would think that this would make the game unplayable, but the number of different room layouts is so small that you will start remembering enemy spawn locations after a couple games.

Since the game is rogue-like, it is really tempting to play round after round in order to see new items. However, few items really change how the game is played. You are going to be running backward holding down your left mouse button a lot.

I only got as far as the floor where swastikas start appearing on walls and tiny fast moving raptors run at you (6th? 8th? I don't remember). That is when I realized I would have to memorize a whole new area of layouts, and that I had stopped having fun four hours ago. 

Could it appeal to some people? Maybe. Could it improve? Maybe. I would not recommend buying it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083252132', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1413323228}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983045874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1398557719}
review: I would describe "Paranautical Activity" as a mixture between "The Binding of Isaac" and classic first-person shooters. PA is extremely fast-paced, challenging, and sometimes terrifying. Like many other games of this type, you will find yourself fighting to clear rooms of enemies and eventually defeating the main boss. After the boss battle you will take an elevator to the next floor where the difficulty rises. From what I understand, you are on a Nazi ship with experimental creatures, and must fight your way to.. who knows where. The retro voxel graphics seem a bit overused these days, but it works fairly well. If you have had an urge to play this, I suggest picking it up to support development. If $9.99 is too much at the moment, go ahead and wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008228069', 'num_games_owned': 2305, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1560310492}
review:
Wow! I did *not* expect this game to be so addictive and absolutely satisfying. A long-overdue and well-executed fast-paced, circle-strafing, old school twitch shooter feel with a lot of elements very much like Binding of Isaac (a very good thing, and I mention the likeness only to its credit.) Different starting characters/builds with different stats and starting weapons to choose from, randomized/procedurally generated rooms and floors, health/armor/gold/bomb drops off enemies, shops on each floor, tons of unique personal upgrades to buy or earn at the end of each floor, etc. With even more content to come, and co-op multiplayer on the way (dear god yes!), I haven't been this pleased with and addicted to any indie title since FTL.

Most importantly, the core controls and mechanics are an absolute joy. The pace and precision of the controls and the action feel absolutely spot-on. This is something many games destined for mediocrity have overlooked in lieu of trying to do everything else. When it comes down to it, the core mechanics, the precision and pacing of the controls of any shooter are at *least* half of what we either enjoy or can't stand about them. And more often than not, we barely even consciously realize that, if at all. Paranautical Activity absolutely nails it in terms of *exactly* how a shooter like this should feel, and it's a feel that is too rare these days. As a pure gaming experience, this one is a huge breath of fresh air. Bravo!

review: Awesome Rogue "lite" game, I have owned this for a couple of months now bought directly from Code Avarice and I have had a ton of fun with it! Worth every penny, its a challenging and very fun fps-roguelike game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995235326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1505444073}
review: Buy this game.  Run, do not walk, to your nearest internet retailer and buy it.  Contrary to popular belief, it doesn't occupy some 'bloated market' for voxel-based shooters.  It was first, and did it best-- procedural generation, Roguelike difficulty curves, and the best item design I've seen in any game since Nethack make PA a must-buy without question or reservation.  It will kick your ass and you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991559364', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1507035827}
review: A first-person fast paced shoot-em-up mixed with The Binding of Isaac. It's absolutely fun as all hell. Pick it up, it's as addictive as The Binding of Isaac and as fun. The $9.99 asking price (at the time of this writing) is more than worth it. 4/5 this is a definite get.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971571062', 'num_games_owned': 3287, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1424805122}
review: 40 minutos son suficientes para pausar esta peque√±a joya y venir a escribir una recomendaci√≥n. Es imposible no nombrar "The binding of isaac" ya que la sensacion es muy parecida, pero con graficos basados en voxels y en perspectiva FPS. Niveles generados aleatoriamente, como en TBOI, bosses con drops especiales como TBOI y tienda de objetos. Podemos empezar con diferentes personajes, cada uno con un tipo de arma que se juega de manera bastante diferente. Por ejemplo una escopera de corto alcance pero devastadora, un arco que hace mucho da√±o pero que tendremos que tensar tras cada disparo, o una hoz arrojadiza con efecto boomerang, que hace da√±o pero que nos deja indefensos en algunas ocasiones. Como punto negativo, a√±adiria que al ser beta con acceso anticipado, la cantidad de enemigos es limitada (aunque he jugado poco y seguro que no los he visto todos). Planean a√±adirle modo cooperativo en breve y muchos parches de contenido. Creo que es un juego imprescindible para los fanaticos de "the binding of isaac", para los fanaticos de los rogue-like con contenido generado de forma aleatoria y porque no, para los que gusten de un juego casual sin argumento y en el que estresarse un rato. No hay vidas ni se puede salvar por cierto ;) Permadeath FTW! ;) Miau

author: {'steamid': '76561197990608860', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1647299941}
review:
Imagine if someone combined the alien landscape of Doom and the twitchy movement controls of Quake then slapped on some randomised maps and enemies for good measure and you're well on your way to PAranautical Activity!

It's a little rough around the edges here and there, but it's still amazing to actually play and I highly recommend giving it a go!
